review.title: “My experience at Edelman has been both fun and educational.”

review.title: “DRANK THE COOL-AID, YOU BETTER TOO”

review.cons: Cons – there really isn't much cons to Edelman - oh, I forgot, is it a 'CON' when they promise you one thing and then deliver on something else - when upper management in the NYC consumer group turns over faster then you change your bed sheets - or that over servicing of clients is the norm - and not even frowned upon -

review.title: “Solid opportunities to learn and teach.”
review.pros: Pros – Can't say enough good things about the culture at Edelman. It's something everyone seems to believe in and team members are eager to teach to new employees.The network is an asset, but it's also because the network is very open to engaging one another and helping where assistance is needed. You can shoot an email to someone in another office and before you know it, someone in an office across country or even the ocean has responded provided info with the you need.
review.cons: Cons – Whether you're in a large office or small office, it's take a little more time/effort to get your work recognized. People are always willing to help, but there are A LOT of people, so selling your results and your office's results to Edelman at large can be difficult.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Happy Employee”

It makes for a great atmosphere that makes you want to be better.
review.cons: Cons – As with any PR agency, finding a balance between work life and social life can be challenging. But when you love what you do, it makes it easier to put in the long hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great job with training and inspiring future leaders.

review.title: “Entrepreneurial mindset”

review.title: “Pretty Good!”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – New client work is always welcome, but acknowledge when someone is already spread too thin especially when they communicate it. And when you say extra help is on it way, please actually deliver on that.

review.title: “The best in the business”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is hands down the best PR firm in the business. I've been with the company for more than 10 years and worked at 4 other firms before joining Edelman, so I know what I'm talking about. Edelman's independence, entrepreneurial spirit, prudent risk-taking, thought leadership and commitment to quality differentiate it from other agencies, particularly those that are owned by huge holding companies. It is the iconic communications firm of the 21st century. I've never wanted to leave Edelman because I've always been able to find my next career challenge within the firm.
review.cons: Cons – As it gets bigger, internal politics is becoming more of an issue (although it's still nothing like the other firms I've worked at). There is also a tendency for the firm to take on too many new internal initiatives at once, which puts a burden on employees who are trying to keep their clients happy. Until recently, serious bad behavior within the very senior ranks seemed to be tolerated. This appears to be changing but the jury is still out.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more selective about the internal initiatives you roll out within a given timeframe. Make sure they're all business-critical and not too many are launched at the same time. Get tougher on bad behavior, particularly at the top.

review.title: “A fantastic group of people that are supportive, fun, and excited about their work”
review.pros: Pros – * Interesting and engaging work* Smart, fun, and always eager to help co-workers/friends* Casual workplace attire and environment* Working hard as a team when projects need it, people really pull together* Little perks like free coffee, cereal, and treats at work* Lots of opportunities to work on teams, for both work and outside of work events
review.cons: Cons – * So far I can't think of any
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to promote the open and engaging workplace environment. You're doing great at that. Keep empowering the right people to take on challenges, and trust the best people to hire/manage new talent under them. It's all been well so far.

review.title: “I love working at Edelman! Sharp people, fun work environment and great clients.”

review.cons: Cons – Edelman has high expectations of its employees and that sometimes challenges the work and life balance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I deeply appreciate the company and culture you have built. Keep building and refining it!

review.cons: Cons – Hours can be long, but hard work pays off
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continute the collaborative and supportive environment you've created

review.cons: Cons – Corporate politics; work-life balance; extremely competitive review/promotion structure
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't forget the little people!

review.title: “Edelman values employee career growth, happiness and the highest quality of work”
review.pros: Pros – smart colleges, top clients, private family owned firm, emphasis on work-life balance, ability to advance, value employee health, good health insurance
review.cons: Cons – agency life regardless of the agency means long hours, client work can be taxing as they expect the highest level of service at an agency like Edelman
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – provide a better EdelmanU experience and quality of classes

review.title: “Great Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has the best work-life balance from any company I've worked at before. The hours are great and people really care about your sense of well-being.
review.cons: Cons – As far as Public Relations firms go, Edelman is pretty corporate feeling and you don't get to know as many people because it is so big. They also only do reviews once a year, which can put people at an unfair disadvantage.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Fast-paced, strategic thinking, smart people, room to grow”
review.pros: Pros – I'm fortunate to work with and learn from some of the smartest thinkers in PR. Edelman's size means the company can leverage resources from around the network, around the world. Leadership is constantly thinking of ways to innovate and adapt to a rapidly changing world, and invests in training for employees. Edelman allows employees to move to different groups and pursue client work that matches personal interests and expertise, and also allows employees to transition to new offices around the network, where possible. For most employees, there are plenty of opportunities for promotion and advancement. Dress code is casual. Company is upgrading technology so all employees will have modern laptops and choice of company-provided smartphones.
review.cons: Cons – Like all PR agencies, work is often very fast-paced and employees must juggle multiple projects and client obligations which can be challenging. There is pressure to be "always connected" even on vacations or sick days although management is trying to change this attitude. For most, working remotely on a regular basis is not encouraged.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Explore the possibility of letting employees work from home/remotely on a limited basis. Encourage management to set positive examples of work/life balance.

review.title: “A great place to learn big-agency PR by working with the best people and clients.”
review.pros: Pros – Work with top client names like Pfizer, Microsoft, Starbucks. Collegial, very team-oriented environment with tons of smart, energetic people. Many teams have the budget and mandate to use high-dollar or edgy PR tactics. The company really does value its people and offers a wide array of fringe benefits, from free fruit and candy to casual dress and a fairly generous vacation policy.
review.cons: Cons – Hours can be long and unpredictable. Even if you've got the vacation time, it can be very hard to take it and sometimes work will find you no matter what. Many clients are demanding and some are not nice. Although Edelman tries to be entrepreneurial, there are plenty of people (and clients) who operate as cogs in the machine -- there's often an incentive to do things the way they've always be done. On big accounts, sometimes there are too many layers for junior staff to get much independence and responsibility.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We have got to find a better way to train our junior staff on taking initiative and pitching media. The big accounts teach a lot in terms of process and scale, but everyone AS and below needs the experience of being on a small account where they personally are accountable to the client and the media or online influencers.

review.title: “It's back-breaking, challenging work... and so rewarding”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is full of brilliant, innovative minds who impress me with every interaction. At the SAE level, I've been pleasantly surprised by the opportunities I've had to sit in rooms and brainstorm with very senior, extremely bright colleagues.
review.cons: Cons – The hours can be ridiculous and being on the senior side of junior level is really difficult to navigate. Edelman can be a pretty thankless environment so you have to have something that drives you, personally, other than kudos from your team leads.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Don't ask questions to which you don't want the answer (i.e. How are you doing? How can I help?)- Say thank you more often and more directly recognize the hard work of your team members. Help junior team members see the value in the hustle.- Do more than say you believe everyone is an account executive--be it, when necessary.

review.title: “The brightest minds in strategic communications”
review.pros: Pros – Working alongside some of the smartest people in the business, working with top brands, global network, maintains family company feel
review.cons: Cons – Can feel like a small fish in a big pond
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Love working with these talented people”
review.pros: Pros – Satisfying work, great talent, excellent benefits, good collaboration across offices/departments
review.cons: Cons – Out of date infrastructure, poor on-boarding program, proprietary software applications are not intuitive
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I believe that there is excellent management (and vision) at the very top but local and department managers could use some management training or perhaps be screened better for management abilities before put in these positions.

review.title: “Entrepreneurial and ripe with opportunity - on an incredible global network.”
review.pros: Pros – The fact that Edelman is the largest agency really does have its perks - from the global network, accounts that touch many geographies and practices, to development opportunities. I'm also part of a smaller team so I don't feel like I'm a number. We definitely have an open and encouraging culture as a family company.
review.cons: Cons – Starting at a junior level is competitive.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Good training ground”
review.pros: Pros – Smart senior folks to learn from, work with interesting clients, good benefits
review.cons: Cons – Junior folks do most of the work, hard to focus on current clients when always looking for new ones
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest more in the professional development of your people and you will have less turnover

review.title: “Eciting work, great colleagues, but constant understaffing issues and little work-life balance”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is one of the worlds premiere agencies and attracts top tallent as such.
review.cons: Cons – Unfortunately, a churn-and-burn mentatlity especially as it relates to junior and mid-level staff is very common. Edelman loses a lot of great tallent to burn-out.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Generally Neutral”
review.pros: Pros – Good brand, great client names. Influential CEO.
review.cons: Cons – Too few opportunities to change groups, offices, locations. Very political. Salaries seem to be based on market research vs. individual performance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Separate P&Ls make the company act like several boutiques instead of one global company.

review.title: “Great for career development, lacking in culture and employee welfare”
review.pros: Pros – Impressive client roster, private firm, opportunity for career growth and advancement, strong team atmosphere, industry accolades, large network of knowledge sharing and for relocation, great peer-set to learn from
review.cons: Cons – Senior staff is hands-off at times and unwilling to jump in and help. Salaries are always under industry average and the company knows it. Morale is low due to mismanagement at top. Nepotism is a dirty word, but is a frequent policy. A lot of politics to get anything done.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Turn to junior and mid-level staffers for ideas. We are in the weeds and can tell you what the needs are. Reward your talent at every level and work to improve culture in every group.

review.title: “Edelman Digital is a great place to work with one MAJOR flaw.”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, great place to work.
review.cons: Cons – They can't/don't pay anywhere near industry rates.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay the creatives.

review.title: “Found: a company that cares!”
review.pros: Pros – Culture: The company is concerned about the employees, giving back to the community and creating an environment to encourage creativity to provide the clients with the best work possible.Benefits: Full benefits, health dental, generous PTO/Sick policy--you even get your bithday off!Perks: Ice cream Friday, cereal Monday, manicures, snack cart, free flu shots and a free mobile device
review.cons: Cons – The company is growing, space is at a premium, some floors are redone, some need to be remodelled.Not everyone has a laptop, but new employees will get them going forward and they are replacing the older desktops as they get out of date.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue encouraging and being accessible to all employees from every level. When employees know their voice is heard that means a great deal to them--especially when they see things change based on their suggestions.

review.title: “Abundant opportunities to pursue your goals.”
review.pros: Pros – The industry is fast-paced and intriguing. My colleagues are the best in the business. The leadership is trustworthy and encourages us to be creative, step outside the box, and break barriers. There is an infrastructure in place that makes success an achievable goal.
review.cons: Cons – Rare internal politics erupt which is inevitable anywhere you'll work. And here I feel it truly is rare.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work.

review.title: “Great people to work with, under-compensated”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people who push you to grow and will help you develop a job into a career. If you're good, they'll be really flexible when you request an account or office change.
review.cons: Cons – Severely underpaid when compared to other digital agencies or in-house opportunities. The SF economy has sky-rocketed in the last 3-4 years and rent has gone with it. Unfortunately, Edelman has not kept up with these increases. For this reason, we lose good people to other jobs quite often. In San Francisco, retaining good talent comes down to pay. That's just how it is right now.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Commit to maintaining great talent through more substantial salary increases.

review.title: “Cretive space with great people.”
review.pros: Pros – I love it here - everyone has a voice, and all ideas are encouraged. It's a creative space with great people, and they are very work/life balanced. You can actually have a personal life, too, when you work here.
review.cons: Cons – It's still a bit too heavy on the out-of-date PR model, so creatives have two sets of "clients" still. They ARE working on this, however, so i believe this will be different by this time next year.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, the biggest/most influential clients, career pathing, fun culture
review.cons: Cons – Your expectations for after hours work varies by manager
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Clear delineation of when comp days are allowed based on number of hours worked

review.title: “Surrounded by the best and brightest in my field”
review.pros: Pros – Working at Edelman has truly been the best career opportunity I've had to date. My day-to-day is always different, full of challenges and the rewards that come with meeting those difficulties head on. My colleagues are so smart and engaged, and above all happy. It's not a culture of complaining, it's a culture of doing, even when the doing isn't all puppies and rainbows. But with that being said, sometimes my job IS about puppies and rainbows, which is really awesome. I couldn't be more proud to be in an environment that provides career development and opportunities at all levels.
review.cons: Cons – As the saying goes--in the world of PR, there is no such thing as vacation.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman is an inspiring, forward thinking agency.”
review.pros: Pros – Sense of community and pride among employeesAlways one step ahead
review.cons: Cons – Expensive health, vision and dental benefits
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Fast-paced, exciting, collaborative, career- and team- oriented, values-led, enterpreneurial”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients, strong company culture and values, lots of opportunities for advancement (up, across, globally, among practices etc), fast-paced, rewarding, focus on quality work, a lot of development opportunities,
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance is a huge goal but still a challenge we're struggling to overcome
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More development of senior leaders that focus on the business of the business - how to become the next generation that runs the company - start that now. More clarity on succession planning.

review.title: “Overall a great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Resources available for both clients and employees, sense of community, sense of appreciation.
review.cons: Cons – Some management structure problems at the VP/SVP level
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Commit to maintaining great talent through more substantial salary increases.

review.title: “Challenging, rewarding and full of opportunity”
review.pros: Pros – It's a place where you can be as successful as you want to be. You're encourage to take risks, try new things and make changes so that you're happy and productive. I
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance can be a challenge.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman is the best PR agency to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Strong ethics, values and entrepreneurial spirit, family run company, amazing talent and support, great opportunities for professional development, a variety of career paths
review.cons: Cons – My only criticism every year is the size of the annual merit raises. They are tiny. The bonus program is great, but as you rise in the ranks, you're likely to stay at one level for several years, and it doesn't seem right that strong performances are not rewarded monetarily. I also think it can hurt us with retention.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reconsider the policy for the annual merit raises!

review.title: “Positive experience overall, few complaints”
review.pros: Pros – As an intern I got to work on reports with great supervisors who worked on my writing and composing polished client facing reports
review.cons: Cons – Little opportunity to interact with staff and understand their positions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more open.

review.title: “Smart people, genuine interest in employees, but lots and lots of work”
review.pros: Pros – Company leaders are very smart and the firm is headed in a great direction; well positioned in the PR and Digital spacesI believe there is a genuine interest in making Edelman a great place to work
review.cons: Cons – There is a LOT of work to do - a good problem to have, I realize, but between that and the fact that this is a client-orientated business, stress levels are always very high.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be sensitive to how much someone has on their plate before adding to it and be a little more open to adding resources when it might be needed, especially if you don't want to adjust expectations.

review.title: “I think Edelman is a great company, but the salary could be improved”
review.pros: Pros – Great leadership, value all levels of employees, creative, laid back
review.cons: Cons – salary is lower than at similar jobs, a lot of large company policies and politics
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Supportive, positive environment that fosters growth, with both words and action!”
review.pros: Pros – Top-down philosophy that fosters positive, open-door environment with lots of built-in programs to help employees learn and go beyond their job description. From small things like bagels to big things like mentor programs and company retreats, Edelman acts on their philosophy.
review.cons: Cons – At the end of the day, it IS a large organization where people can get lost, if they choose to not participate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please update the GFS - lots of great information is buried in an out-dated UI.

review.title: “Overall a great place to be...most of the time”
review.pros: Pros – Great culture, incredible knowledge sharing and education, wonderful reputation
review.cons: Cons – some offices have trouble providing promotions and salary increases
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus more on your team members and less on the $$ when needed

review.title: “Home for extraordinary talent”
review.pros: Pros – Richard Edelman has an eye for talent. The assemblage of brainpower at Edelman is breathtaking, allowing them to think more deeply and serve more productively.
review.cons: Cons – You have to like the give-and-take. It's a company of great ideas. If you don't like to mix it up, if you don't like to make the case for your idea, this isn't the place for you.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More attention for those who nurture, grow and keep clients than for those who bring in the new ones.

review.title: “Leader in social media strategy”
review.pros: Pros – - Smart, strategic colleagues- Social media leader- Great leaders; promote work/life balance and infuse atmosphere with smart thinking and discussion- Digital gurus- Always on top of the the very latest across every social media channel
review.cons: Cons – - Not enough strategy and creative resources- Lots of overly-entitled millenials
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more people, even without fully funded resources. Hire better more eager and smart, than entitled and lazy.

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to work because of the people - I love coming to work each day!”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman always does things ethically. I trust the management to do the right thing when it comes to clients, but also employee care. I always feel that they really have their hearts in the right place. Not to mention their great client roster!
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes the different offices don't talk to each other as much as I'd like. Collaboration is definitely abundant at Edelman, but in some sense needs to be a bit more.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue showcasing our thought leadership to the rest of the industry and taking care of your employees.

review.title: “The grass is greener here”
review.pros: Pros – Great company culture, great accountability, a very supportive environment that encourages learning, benefits that are unheard of at other companies, beautiful office space, lots of upward mobility if you can negotiate, remain patient, and prove your worth. I came from a job at a studio and it was hell compared to the job here. Edelman truly cares for its employees. MATTER is the best department to work for.
review.cons: Cons – PR personalities and egos can sometimes be hard to deal with, for lower level employees, the revenue spikes between promotions are very minimal
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep working together as a team and seeing the big picture. Sure bringing in another team (specializing in that part of the scope) will take from your revenue as a department, but we are all one company and if we all help each other out, business will all grow and be conducted by the specialists to ensure it all proceeds according to plan.

review.title: “Collaborative, Collegial and Smart”
review.pros: Pros – I work with some of the smartest people I've ever met, who are interested in my perspective as well, and together we get to tackle some of the toughest and most interesting communications challenges facing the world today.
review.cons: Cons – It's not a place for people who aren't willing to work hard, who aren't self-starters, and who aren't able to bring their A-game nearly every day.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep on doing what you are doing, and keep on listening to your employees.

review.title: “Supportive, positive environment that fosters growth, with both words and action!”
review.pros: Pros – Top-down philosophy that fosters positive, open-door environment with lots of built-in programs to help employees learn and go beyond their job description. From small things like bagels to big things like mentor programs and company retreats, Edelman acts on their philosophy.
review.cons: Cons – At the end of the day, it IS a large organization where people can get lost, if they choose to not participate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please update the GFS - lots of great information is buried in an out-dated UI.

review.title: “Excited about Edelman after my first month of employment”
review.pros: Pros – The people are smart and creative. Everyone is hard working and dedicated, but with abundant personality. The depths of knowledge here is inspiring and it makes my talent acquisition role a pleasure.
review.cons: Cons – The office is very large and it is hard to get to know other employees that I do not work with often. This is just different for me coming from a smaller environment.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great company to work for!”
review.pros: Pros – Supervisors and teams are very supportive. People really listen to how you want to grow and what your goals are, and do their best to help you achieve them.
review.cons: Cons – As with any PR job, hours and be long and clients can be tough. Edelman does encourage work/life balance, but sometimes you really have to stand your ground to achieve it.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Best Place to Work. Period.”
review.pros: Pros – -Opportunity to truly shape career however you want-Bright ideas are recognized and rewarded-Team structure is collaborative-Countless perks
review.cons: Cons – Nothing! Everything is great and no complaints from me.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Thank you for the great office environment

review.title: “Best Place to Work. Period.”
review.pros: Pros – -Opportunity to truly shape career however you want-Bright ideas are recognized and rewarded-Team structure is collaborative-Countless perks
review.cons: Cons – Nothing! Everything is great and no complaints from me.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Thank you for the great office environment

review.title: “Great amosphere and leadership top-down”
review.pros: Pros – The culture is positive with every resource needed at hand to succeed
review.cons: Cons – Becoming so involved with the passionate work, you forget that you should be more social after 5pm
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to drive home the feedback from higher-ups-- inspiring and shows the larger picture

review.title: “Great place to work with super-nice people”
review.pros: Pros – Extremely friendly, dynamic and entrepreneurial environment. Competitive pay, lots of perks like breakfast, fruit, thirsty Thursdays and ice cream Fridays. How you behave is a part of the evaluation so jerks don't last too long. They also encourage - but do not always follow - a reasonable life-work balance. Work from home is also a consistent possibility to deal with this.
review.cons: Cons – Lots of hours at the behest of not-so-friendly dysfunctional clients. Weekend and holiday work possible.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There is a not-easy-too understand goal of reaching $1 billion in revenue that does not gel on the traditional focus on the client. Forget this irrelevant number and just focus on being the best PR agency.

review.title: “My take on Edelman.”
review.pros: Pros – The company is a good place to work because of the people. I deal with everyone and love all the different personalities.
review.cons: Cons – I don't have any issues with the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to provide company welfare to the staff. Breakfast items, candy, ice cream and social activities all make a big difference to the staff.

review.title: “The opportunities here are endless, and the ability to carve your own path and implement change are endless.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a family owned business, which comes through in almost every aspect. From the benefits to the culture, being part of a larger Edelman family has been a tremendous impact. Hours are flexible, we work hard when we need to, and we make sure to work hard but not too hard!!
review.cons: Cons – One has to be good with and adaptable to change to be a good fit for Edelman. Not everyone has what it takes.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “An amazing place of continuous learning and great opportunities.”
review.pros: Pros – We're able to attract and maintain terrific clients because of our (well-deserved) reputation for delivering strong work product. There's a lot of variety, so you're continually challenged and learning. Edelman attracts great talent, so you work with brilliant colleagues.
review.cons: Cons – It's a large agency; you have to find your path.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep investing in the infrastructure needed to run a large and growing firm; keep bringing in talent that meets clients' future needs.

review.title: “Edelman has a high energy that keeps you engaged and excited about coming to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Snack Cart, Walking Wednesday with the President, Company Town Hall Meetings, community involvement with non-for-profits, Habitat for Humanity, Chicago Food Depository, Volunteering
review.cons: Cons – Career pathing is left up to the employee.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Develop more training for career growth.

review.title: “Admnistrative Manager”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a company that has employees that are smart, challenged,fun to work with and constantly working to do the best for the client. In addition, the company strives for high integrity, ethics and also doing what is best for its employees in the work/life balance arena.
review.cons: Cons – I honestly don't have any cons that come to mind.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work!!

review.title: “Best place I've ever worked.”
review.pros: Pros – The leadership here is spot on. Supervisors are properly trained, and learning opportunities are ample. The office itself is incredibly nice as is the equipment. The company isn't afraid to spend money on its' employees. Drinking is pretty regular both inside and outside of work.
review.cons: Cons – The company is very competitive and deadline-based. It's an intense environment, which can sometimes be overwhelming.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please encourage and set aside time for more job specific training.

review.title: “Fifteen year tenure at a company that has grown leaps and bounds. Still feels like a small co even though we are global”
review.pros: Pros – Independent, family owned. Entreprenurial. Smart. Visionary. Creative
review.cons: Cons – Political. Financially driven. Knee-jerk decisions at times.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You have incredibly smart people working for you. Use that as a selling point for recruitment, pitches. Put our people at the center of our story.

review.title: “Great Work Experience. Experience Great Work.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is an iconic agency that has all of the benefits and charming quirks of a family-owned business. Even though it built its creds on consumer marketing, it does top-class work in other areas, like corporate and health. Obviously, the agency's digital capabilities are among the best in the industry as well. Getting exposure to all of that at any level adds up to a great work experience. It's also great to be working at a placed considered to be such an "employer of choice" and therefore have great talent from all kinds of levels go to some extraordinary lengths to get hired here. (Like Facebook ads targeting Edelman employees.)
review.cons: Cons – While the agency talks about a relatively "flat" culture where even the most junior person has a say, the message that it consistently promotes internally is "Isn't our senior leadership team JUST ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!?!" Things get _very_ self-congratulatory at the GM level and above, sometimes to the point of causing eye-rolls among the rest of the staff. ("Alright. Alright. We get it, already.") The fact that excellent work was done "under the watch" (though maybe not the active participation) of any particular leader is valued more than the people who actually did that work. Those leaders don't _mean_ to take credit for others' work, it's just that it doesn't really matter to them when that happens. There isn't a whole lot of consistent effort to bring the agency closer to the recruiting message of that "flat" culture. "Town Halls" and that sort of thing don't really cut it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Let great work speak for itself. Take the time to figure out _how_ things got done and what innovation is taking place outside the circle of a small group of superstars. Broaden your view of the agency beyond a small set of peer-level advisors.

review.title: “#1 for a reason”
review.pros: Pros – Creative culture, always striving to be the best, positive encouragement from top employees, touch bases to ensure that we are progressing on track within the company
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance, rewards for successful programs, being able to try out different areas of the practice to see where we fit best
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – promote those who deserve it

review.title: “This is a company that values its employees”
review.pros: Pros – Emphasis on employee developmentOpportunities for growth and acquiring new skillsOverall work environment is fun and inclusiveHands-on work for some of the biggest brands in the world
review.cons: Cons – Some practice groups have a lot of red tape/bureacracyEmployees are sometimes pigeonholed to defined career pathsCompensation isn't commensurate with workload at the junior level
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show appreciation for all the work junior level employees put in; either through compensation or other rewards

review.title: “Exceptional reputation, smart colleagues, and opportunities to work on multiple global and Fortune 500 clients”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has one of the best reputations in the PR industry. They do smart, innovative work for their clients and allow the opportunity to work in a variety of industries, on various companies both locally and globally.
review.cons: Cons – As with any PR career, hours are long and salaries are low in junior-level positions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I love the availability and the access employees have to upper level management. Keep up the good work!

review.title: “Challenging and rewarding first PR job”
review.pros: Pros – Huge network of people to bounce ideas off of, get advice from, be inspired by. A lot of opportunity to become a well-rounded PR professions due to Edel-U classes and constantly working with specialists in Digital, Creative and Media Services practices. New Business practice has been busy and secured a lot of new clients which obviously leads to growth and job security
review.cons: Cons – Big agency life often means long hours, unrealistic client demands and overcomplication of easy/mundane tasks. I think this is common at most large agencies so I'm not sure that it's a con, just something you come to expect if you work at one.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work!

review.title: “Hard work but I am working at the best PR agency I could work for.”
review.pros: Pros – Smart People; Resources; Team Size; Growth of firm and dedication to personal growth
review.cons: Cons – Long hours in Corporate Practice; Pay (Industry Wide)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More effective staffing

review.title: “A fun, hard working group of people that develop great work!”
review.pros: Pros – An amazing network of people who are very smart and love what they do.Great skill development and managers who care about your career path.Work with top companies and organizations.Fun young culture who like to have fun and work hard.There are opportunities to become an expert in a topic and develop specific skills.
review.cons: Cons – The work hours are very long, it's not a 9-5 job.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep motivating employees and encouraging a work life balance.

review.title: “Great reputation, but few long-term employees"”
review.pros: Pros – Awesome place to start your career and get agency experience from a company that is top-notch. Edelman has the power, the client names and a great CEO. Given that we are private it isn't based on "billability."Better training - Company recently announced Edelman Learning Institute, which shows the company cares about providing professional development for its' employees.Great reputation, when looking at Glassdoor many of the other power players in the large PR agency don't have the same
review.cons: Cons – Edelman Digital - They receive benefits and perks PR doesn't, like annual retreats and their system for promotions isn't matched to the PR side of things, yet the titles are the same.Transfers - Edelman makes it seem very easy for employees to transfer, but they still have to interview the job and it can take months. Also you cannot use it as promotion opportunity, must transfer at your level. For international transfers, you must be an Account Supervisor. Wish it was more transparent.Politics - Promotions aren't always based on merit, if you associate with the right people you will be promoted faster, even when not deserved.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman gave me the opportunity to grow and flourish”
review.pros: Pros – You get to work with some of the best in the business across various areas of PR, including crisis, digital, consumer, healthcare, etc. I had direct interaction with clients from the first week that I started. Senior employees definitely want junior and mid-level employees to rise quickly, and they empower them to do so. I was given multiple opportunities to own projects from the very beginning, and I love that I get to work with such a passionate group of people on a daily basis. Assert yourself quickly and develop an expertise within your team -- you'll have a much more fulfilling experience that way! Overall, the leadership at Edelman is top-notch, and the values and mission that Richard Edelman set for the firm permeate every level of the business.
review.cons: Cons – The salaries are very low, and I took a significant pay cut to work here. Maintaining a decent work-life balance is ALWAYS a challenge given the nature of the industry and the hours that junior and mid-level employees are expected to work. I regularly clocked 12-hour days for my first few months at the company, and I doubt that I'll ever work less than 10.5 hours/day moving forward.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Involve more junior and mid-level employees in new business pitches -- more ideas means that you can service potential clients even better!

review.title: “Good clients, difficult agency”
review.pros: Pros – Some name recognition in the brand, but losing that cache quickly.
review.cons: Cons – Too many to list. It's a sinking ship. Management team is a disaster, and that's really a compliment.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The business is heading for a nose dive because they do not invest enough in growing and retaining their talent. PR and marketing firms have employees as their biggest asset -- they can make or break the enterprise. Yet time and again, companies like Edelman get confused that the names of past and current clients are their biggest assets. My advice to management at Edelman is that this current way of operating is too short-sighted. By training and developing your people and caring and investing in them the way an industrial business might maintain a productive machine, Edelman will get far higher dividends than just trying to chase that next big client -- and wearing its people down in the process. The cycle is not sustainable for the business or its people.

review.title: “Limited growth opportunities, poor compensation, improperly trained managers”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a creative place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Lower level employees are not treated well, mid-level managers are poorly trained and made supervisors at a young age, advancement opportunities are slim. The few people who were promoted last year had a very slight salary increase -- much lower than the industry average. Turnover is high. Company morale is low. Senior and mid-level management is not doing anything to increase morale. Instead they limit advancement, cut programs and work you to the bone.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm not optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “If you are a minority, look else where”
review.pros: Pros – Of course Edelman looks great on your resume, it's the largest PR firm in the world. The opportunity seems endless for most.
review.cons: Cons – Minorities, especially those of African decent, do not advance at an equal pace as others. It may take two years to get promoted from a AAE to AE or AE to SAE. Minority interns rarely get hired, extended or even considered. It was also discouraging to see the majority of AA employees working in mail room. This is not an isolated situation, it happens in offices around the country.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look beyond color, it's 2013. Practice what you preach.

review.title: “A great environment with fair pay. Hard to balance a life with spouse and kids.”
review.pros: Pros – Very generous with bonuses, food and alcohol!
review.cons: Cons – There isn't enough emphasis on work life balance. It is encouraged to be available and on call ALL the time. It's part of the culture here. Those that enforce it are praised.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please do not encourage workaholism.

review.title: “Best of the PR Agencies, but High Burn Out and Widening Divide between Digital/Traditional PR”
review.pros: Pros – Of all the PR agencies, Edelman is the best. You aren't going to find a PR agency that is more devoted to pioneering new approaches and evolving rapidly to meet the needs of the market. The Edelman Trust Barometer and online training services are standout resources that go beyond what other agencies offer in terms of market resource and continuing education.While I can't confirm this is absolutely true, Edelman does appear to pay slightly higher than other agencies - at least among junior and mid-level roles.As far as PR training, if you can pick what agency you pick for, Edelman is the best proving ground for building a PR career. Edelman picks which client it works for, and there's a good mix in vertical and client size (start up to major tech company).
review.cons: Cons – There remains a divide in treatment and cooperation between the traditional PR and Digital divisions. Digital appears to get some preferential treatment - promotions tend to come faster and they regularly have off-site retreats where the entire region attends training and networking sessions. This added investment in the Digital side is creating resentment since there does not seem to be any specialty trainings/offerings for the traditional PR side.For general account work, junior and mid-level staff put in LONG hours, which seems to go unnoticed or recognized by senior management. This tends to be the norm in the PR agency world, but Edelman is guilty of burn out among lower level employees as much as the next agency.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There's still ambiguity in Digital vs. Traditional treatment - and this perceived preference toward Digital is creating a lot of resentment across the divisions. Even if these continue, this resentment can be curbed by management being more transparent and proactive in the purpose of these trainings. (Currently it feels like a "hidden secret.")Edelman can be the stand-out agency if senior management pays closer attention to the volume of hours lower level employees put in. Even if unavoidable at time, extra recognition of long hours and elbow grease (on a personal level) can go a long way in keeping morale high. Eliminate this burn out will also help Edelman retain top talent.

review.title: “Incredibly disappointing.”
review.pros: Pros – The driven co-workers and wealth of opportunities via Edelman's reputation.The (very few) passionate co-workers.The exceptional senior management that offered an intern opportunities and encouraged creativity, strategy and ideation from a junior-level, temporary employee.
review.cons: Cons – Don't expect to be welcomed here -- this office does not like new competition (i.e. me, an intern) or even their own clients (evidenced by immature account supervisors calling them names daily). Don't expect to be respected, either. No one cares about an intern's ideas -- even if they are relevant (save some upper management) -- or even their basic needs. This office is experiencing growing pains and needs to figure out what their office philosophy truly is vs. what they think it is...HR is in need of some re-vamping, too. I was shocked when my concerns were discredited and that it took an email to the top for my needs to be properly addressed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Realize there is a clear divide in this office and work to ensure every employee is appreciated. This office is rather two-faced and leaves a bad taste in the mouth. It feels like the junior staff is in need of some love and may be the reason for the huge gap in the office. Please get a new manger for the intern program. Please. It is embarrassing -- Edelman does have a great program in place...why does she hinder it? Also, a job description would have eliminated a lot of issues I witnessed/was a part of.

review.title: “Could use some work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a large company that seemingly exposes several career opportunities for employees. The catch is identifying where these opportunities lie strategizing how to tap into them. Edelman is a big name and a huge player in the PR field. Strategy-wise, the company seems to be headed in the right direction.
review.cons: Cons – Work-Life balance: This does not seem to exist. Part of the reason that I joined the company was because of previous awards it had won in this arena. This may have changed since I arrived, or perhaps the balance is just not in my department, but consistantly takeing work home and working on the weekends is an expectation. I have also only taken a lunch a handful of times since employment.Training: I think the company could do more to ensure that newer employees were adequately trained in both the company tools and processes, but on the clients background. I cannot speak for all accounts, but for my practice I was given materials to review and then handed work, with no formal time to discuss best practices or history.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – My advice to upper management would be to have mid-managment take six sigma courses, or another type of efficiency course. From my perspective, there is no work-life balance because the work and review process simply are not being conducted in the best way possible. Often, an assignement will be given without being thought through and with little direction. The work will get completed, and have to be re-drafted several times. This causes delays to the clients and delays in activation, as well as a waste of time and money. Efficiency is key.I'd also recommend when training mid-management the company focus on starting meetings with positive aspects. There is much to be said to highlighting employees for good work done, and not drooning in negative news.

review.title: “In theory, fantastic”
review.pros: Pros – Private company, reasonable hours, pretty flexible, well known and respected
review.cons: Cons – Super, super, super political. Sr. leadership play on favorites. The practice groups do not play nice with each other.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on performance based promotions. Need to motivate people to work together, right now they're motivated to compete and be nasty to each other.

review.title: “A great company that tried to create, but too much hierarchy limits that.”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of top clients across various industries, strong reputation and solid leadership at the top of the firm.
review.cons: Cons – Way too much hierarchy in the office which limits the entrepreneurship the company likes to identify itself with; long hours for fairly meager pay and expected to always remain on the clock for clients even in less than pressing situations.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reduce the number of positions within the firm - you don't need three levels at each stage, e.g. AE, SAE, SA and SAS. It creates bottlenecks and gives people too much ego in reviewing/proofing other people's work because they are "ranked" higher. Definitely think about increasing pay if you want to compare yourself to consulting companies where pay is astronomically higher.

review.title: “Looks good from the outside, dysfunctional from the inside”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a good brand reputation, which means any time worked at the agency will look good on your resume. If you are starting out in your career, this is a good place to get experience in PR and to learn some best practices that will serve you well in the years to come.
review.cons: Cons – I joined Edelman because of the agency's reputation, but was surprised at how mismanaged the company was when I started working there. Managers are trained to be very hard on their team, often pushing people to their limits in the interest of client service. Employees are often brought to tears either from the stress, workload, or critical feedback from managers. I've seen more coworkers crying in the ladies room than I care to count. Although you can learn a lot from working at this agency, the harsh culture and cutthroat nature of the company means you need very thick skin to survive here very long.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The Portland office could use a new senior management team. It is hard to retain quality employees when the management team doesn't care.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – You get a chance to work with high profile companies. The company itself is innovative and a good name in the business.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is low and turnover is high. Their trainee system is really just a way to test new hires without paying benefits.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Largest PR firm in the world”
review.pros: Pros – Exposure to some of the biggest clients. Junior level employees get the chance to get hands on experience dealing with clients, account teams and media. Fun atmosphere. Company happy hours at least once a month.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours for junior employees. Not a big emphasis on diversity. Too much talk and not enough action when it comes to creativity and speed.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Diversify your employee base. Everyone looks the same. Also, increase pay for junior level employees. Level I-III employees do much more work than what they are compensated for.

review.title: “Great Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is heads above other public relations agencies. It's general HR policies are enlightened and compensation is generally better than the competition.
review.cons: Cons – The demands of the public relations industry make work-life balance difficult to achieve. In some ways, management is still an old boys' network.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ensure women's compensation is equal to men's.

review.title: “Work”
review.pros: Pros – I firmly believe there is no better place to grow your PR career than at Edelman. Having worked my way up from the intern level, I have received a wealth of opportunities, from client engagement to management opportunities to material development and strategic thinking, that I just don't think I would have had elsewhere. Talent and potential is both noticed and rewarded, and age does not factor into your success. Working hard doesn't just earn the respect of your co-workers, it can also translate into tangible, meaningful opportunities and benefits, including promotions and salary increases that could not be matched by any other agency in the city given my age or years of experience. Our office culture is also highly valued, and I appreciate the generous vacation time, flexible working hours in instances of appointments/emergencies and the constant encouragement to be ourselves and bring our best selves to the table.
review.cons: Cons – More attention is paid to the thoughts of mid-level and senior leadership than to junior staff, which can sometimes make it seem like your word doesn't have as big of an impact. Work/life balance is harder to maintain as you increase seniority, particularly at the mid-level and lower-leadership spectrums. Additionally, there can be a lot of pressure to exceed expectations with clients, even those that are challenging or arguably refusing accurate, well-thought counsel. Especially in these instances where a collaborative relationship with a client is strained, team morale can suffer, and leadership can be slow to recognize the need for internal team change.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Acknowledge junior staff--we see and hear all within this office, and we work harder than many. Continue to acknowledge and reward good ideas and hard work--for me, this is what would make it hard to ever leave this agency.

review.title: “TERRIBLE, STAY AWAY!”
review.pros: Pros – -happy hours once a month-casual environment (jeans)
review.cons: Cons – -higher ups play favoritism-finance team treats PR team like they are a bunch of idiots-some of the VP's think they are better than everyone else and yes they will treat you like you're no one-if you're not in the in group, good luck!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -fix your organization before it becomes a place no one wants to work.

review.title: “Learning experience but with minimal guidance”
review.pros: Pros – Nice people, chance to get experience as an intern.
review.cons: Cons – As an intern, I did not receive much guidance. Sometimes came in and there was no work for me. Could have used more one-on-one coaching or mentoring. Did menial work most of the time.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Best agency experience - creative, collaborative teams and amazing culture”
review.pros: Pros – culture, people, work/life balance, opportunity to work on large and small clients, collaboration (cross-practice and office), independent firm, creativity, benefits, ability to relocate within the U.S. or globally
review.cons: Cons – compensation compared to other industries
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Love working at Edelman!”
review.pros: Pros – I love working at Edelman. Despite what I had heard about traditional PR firms (particularly those the size of Edelman), the company has a collaborative work culture. You are encouraged to ask for what you want and voice your opinion, no matter what level you are. Perks also include insanely smart colleagues, transparent business practices and the fact that it is privately owned.
review.cons: Cons – For the amount of work expected of the junior staff, starting salaries are very low. Work life balance isn't the best, but I have met people from PR firms with much worse balance. I think it's really a hallmark of the job (and the high-profile clients that come along with it) and less a reflection of the company.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “One of the Best”
review.pros: Pros – Couldn't ask for a better company to start my career with. Everyone here is knowledgeable, friendly and great at their jobs.
review.cons: Cons – No vacation/benefits as an intern, but that wasn't expected anyways.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great place to launch your career”
review.pros: Pros – Smart, ambitious people; range of opportunities, as long as you are vocal and have supportive managers.
review.cons: Cons – Salary for junior staff is low.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Growing and Learning Environment”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman provides opportunities and experiences to grow and learn professionally and personally at any level. Whether it's a conversation in the cafe with an individual from a different practice to interactive presentations. Learning something is an everyday occurrence.
review.cons: Cons – One of many in the larger offices.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – N/A

review.title: “Outstanding company with strong vision and entrepreneurial spirit”
review.pros: Pros – There is a lot of freedom to design your own career path and to continuously learn and reinvent yourself without needing to leave the company.
review.cons: Cons – People working here are a special breed- entrepreneurial, unafraid to speak up, loud and proactive. This is not for everyone. If you are quiet and meek, you will get crushed and your chances of succeeding are low.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Amazing learning experience”
review.pros: Pros – The team had great global clients and the office provided a nurturing and collaborative office culture. Edelman cultivated creativity and entrepreneurship.
review.cons: Cons – More dedication to improving compensation for top performers is needed. Rewards and recognition programs are good, but an added focus on rewards (including financial) for employees below VP would be appreciated by many.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Pretty good”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing people, good collaboration, challenging.
review.cons: Cons – I don't have one. Maybe better clients?
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You guys rock

review.title: “graphic designer”
review.pros: Pros – great environment to work in with great people
review.cons: Cons – pay seems low for the city i live in and work i do
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Everything is perfect -- except salary could be better”
review.pros: Pros – Leadership, values and clients -- we are given an opportunity every single day to partake in some of the most exciting work going on in America and all over the world and when you factor in the greatness of what goes on inside the office -- the internal relationships we're building with our leaders and with each other -- Edelman is absolutely the best place to work.
review.cons: Cons – Salary for lower level employees -- it's not terrible but it's not exactly that attractive, especially when compared to that received by the same level employees at other businesses and in other industries.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Nothing -- the Edelman DC senior level management is best in class.

review.title: “Steer clear of healthcare team in Atlanta!”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunities to learn if you're on the right team and have a supportive manager.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman as a whole might be an okay place to work, as long as you're not a member of the healthcare team in Atlanta. The management of this team is manipulative and toxic and forced five people - including myself - to quit last year. Wish I had known going in that the healthcare team in Atlanta is known by the rest of the office as a horrible place to work. One Edelman Atlanta staffer on another team confessed she held her breath when she walked by our desks because the whole area gives off a toxic vibe and a well-liked and respected Atlanta EVP admitted he/she (trying to protect their anonymity) couldn't stand the SVP of the healthcare team and thought he was a poor excuse for a manager.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a look at the turnover of the healthcare team in Atlanta and then at its management. That is the source of the problem!

review.title: “Fun place to be, but didn't give interns a lot of responsibility”
review.pros: Pros – Fun Office- great networking and social events. The office view is beautiful and in general its a young crowd. Interesting clients
review.cons: Cons – As a trainee I wasn't given a lot of responsibility and was constantly asking for more. My boss was really nice but its seems like to you really have to pay your dues to gain full time employment
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Working at Edelman is rewarding and challenging (in a good way).”
review.pros: Pros – I value Edelman's independence as an agency, its diverse practices and its global footprint. The LA office is very diverse and offers a great location for commuting from most locations in SoCal. I believe there is good opportunity for professional growth within the LA office.
review.cons: Cons – Because of its size, it does take time to navigate within the agency. Edelman offers so many practice groups and services that it requires time to fully understand how to integrate them in your day to day operations.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Developing new business is important, but we must continue to keep our eyes on our current clients at all times. Sometimes your best new business is your existing clients.

review.title: “Progressive and Full of Opportunity”
review.pros: Pros – The Edelman team, from Richard himself to each Assistant Account Executive, are simply the smartest group of professionals I've worked with in this industry. Having worked at two other large agencies, I can confidently say the level of talent at Edelman blows other agencies away. Senior management is incredibly involved and accessible and although it's a huge company, it somehow maintains a small, start-up feel. I think that's because they strongly encourage an agency-wide "entrepreneurial spirit," which empowers teams to pursue boundary-pushing programs for clients and employees to pursue limitless opportunities in their career path.
review.cons: Cons – If you don't have a strong POV, presence or outgoing personality, it's easy to get swallowed up at Edelman. Although it feels smaller, it's a huge, global agency at the end of the day and it truly gives life to the phrase "jump in the deep end and sink or swim."
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We work on the road and from home pretty regularly and the rental laptop/remote access situation is pretty bad. Other than that, two thumbs up!

review.title: “Great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – The culture and collaboration are fantastic and make it a pleasure to go to work every day!
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes it just feels too big and that there isn't a ton of interaction between teams, even in the same practice group
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Challenging, supportive”
review.pros: Pros – It's the pre-eminent thought leader in its industry. It is an innovative, flexible and generous agency. Its relatively flattened hierarchy promotes communication and creativity from all levels.
review.cons: Cons – I'm seriously having trouble coming up with something general and accurate. I mean, it's an intense job -- it's bound to take up considerable hours of the day, to involve periods of intense effort that do not result in a fruitful outcome, to butting heads with forceful, opinionated colleagues, etc. That would be the same at any company where growth and passion are integral components.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I would love to have its client list in the energy sector shorn of all fossil fuel-related companies, much as it eschews doing work on behalf of tobacco product companies.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – -Great management that really takes pride in developing young talent-Challenged on a daily basis-Get to big clients-Looks great on a resume
review.cons: Cons – -Long hours-Low pay at bottom of the latter
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Endless Opportunities”
review.pros: Pros – The abundance of career opportunities here at Edelman is endless. The company is structured for each employee to ultimately determine their own career path based upon their interests. Additionally, as the top pr firm in the world Edelman attracts top tier talent and works with some of the largest brands in the world. Being with such a large company also allows you a global network of resources to assist you in your day-to-day needs and the opportunity to work with other Edelman offices across the world.
review.cons: Cons – Part of this is just the nature of the industry, but it is very challenging to maintain a work/life balance at times. If you are only open to a 9-5 Monday-Friday gig, this industry and company is probably not the best fit for you. That said, Edelman is great about holidays and PTOs.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Smart people, receptive senior management and limitless opportunities, but the experience is what you make of it.”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing talent across the network (and knowledge sharing has become a much higher priority in recent months.) Edelman knows good people when they see them and do their best to retain them, whether it's through extended sick leave when a family is ill or footing the bill for an expensive conference. On the west coast (potentially elsewhere), they put a big emphasis on ongoing education, as well as getting to know/like your colleagues on a personal level, with bi-annual retreats. Depending on your team and manager, there is a LOT of room for professional growth and junior level team members are often given an unusual amount of responsibility based on good performance.In order to succeed at Edelman, you have to ask for what you want. As long as you make a case for your desires (especially concerning career path) and speak up early and often, you're generally rewarded.
review.cons: Cons – At times, very long hours. Work/life balance isn't necessarily a myth, but it can be difficult. The salary also seems to be lower than industry standard.Your experience greatly depends on your team and manager. If you don't secure advocates for yourself and learn how to navigate the process/politics, it's very possible that you'll get overlooked for promotions, raises, etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more proactive with comp days, spot bonuses, and general recognition for a job well done. We love our jobs and don't mind working hard to deliver spectacular client service, but a more consistent reward system (or even a simple 'thank you' email) would go a long way in increasing overall job satisfaction.

review.title: “Great place to learn and grow”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a great place to come in and learn/improve your valuable PR skills based on insights from some of the best PR pros in the business. While Edelman is a big, privately owned company, you are never lost in the shuffle. There are numerous opportunities for additional education and spearheading new initiatives. If you have an idea, Edelman lets you run with it.
review.cons: Cons – Typical agency problems - long hours, last minute deadlines, quick burn out ratio. The difference is that Edelman goes the extra mile to compensate you for your hard work with comp days, internal and external praise, etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It would be nice to have a little more guidance as to career growth - what do I need to accomplish to move up?

review.title: “Edelman is truly a great company to work for or hire -- we're well-respected and it's much deserved”
review.pros: Pros – Intelligent people who bring many different backgrounds and skills to the table; entrepreneurial spirit; high-profile clients; independence which allows freedom to reinvent ourselves and evolve as the world changes, and allows company to really take care of employees; cross-office and department collaboration; many resources at our fingertips; proprietary tools; engaging training; much better/more flexible work-life balance than at any other agency for which I've worked, despite the rumors I heard before signing on
review.cons: Cons – The location might not be the most convenient for everyone, but space is really great
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – N/A

review.title: “Great place to build a career”
review.pros: Pros – Entrepreneurial; feel like you're surrounded by the best
review.cons: Cons – None to speak of currently; This job is what you make of it
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “The place for real thinkers”
review.pros: Pros – - Client base consissts of the best of their industires- Smart colleagues- Great leadership that communicates often and well- Oustanding work- Highly values creative thinking- Diverse employee base is becoming even more so
review.cons: Cons – - Ver fast-faced, to the point of leaving little room to breathe-
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep sharing transparently and running out the big egos that behave poorly.

review.title: “The place for real thinkers”
