review.title: “A forward-thinking firm with great leadership”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman recruits some of the top talent in the industry, so the place is brimming with creative ideas and go-getter attitudes. The company is continuously looking for ways to adapt and change the PR space while catering to clients' needs and exceeding expectations.
review.cons: Cons – If you're put on a challenging account, you may be working very long hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to recognize and foster talent in junior staffers.

review.title: “A positive and challenging work environment surrounded by smart people who strive for common goals.”
review.pros: Pros – Creative programs are regularly rolled out to keep employees interested and learning something new to help our work in the industry; the Global Women's Executive Network (GWEN) demonstrates that the company is invested in its female employees and is working towards an even division of leadership; senior leadership is open to conversation with staff and feedback regardless of level
review.cons: Cons – Currently no cons to report
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Can't Imagine Working Anywhere Else”
review.pros: Pros – I like coming to work and being surrounded with smart, entrepreneurial people. The work quality and innovation that happen on a daily basis are truly impressive. I've also noticed a trend towards a more collaborative culture within our New York office and across the network.
review.cons: Cons – Despite the increase in collaboration, there can still be some backbiting and competition. There are also a few obvious "favorites" that rise through the ranks unreasonably quickly. Compensation is also slightly below industry standard.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We're heading in the right direction, but watch out for office politics.

review.title: “Great opportunities”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing opportunities for growth and education. Managers really want to help you succeed within Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – Work-life balance sometimes hard to keep up at junior levels.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to foster growth in junior employees.

review.title: “Great place to build a career”
review.pros: Pros – Open, collaborative work envirionment that challenges employes on a daily basis. Family-owned and independent and is able to operate like many other agencies (and companies for that matter) can't.
review.cons: Cons – Base pay for entry level employees not great, but good opportunity for advancement.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Help staff the lower-level positions as they are understaffed in some departments.

review.title: “The best PR agency in the world”
review.pros: Pros – Tons of opportunitiesExcellent colleaguesA place for entrepreneurshipTop brand to work forHigh mobility across different practicesDiversified development path for career
review.cons: Cons – It's a very challenging and competing environment, and the working tension is sometimes very high.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Dynamic, Challenging, Best of the Best”
review.pros: Pros – smartest, most creative people in the industry. period.you will never stop learning here.marquee clients.ability to shape-shift and take on new roles if you ask for them.opportunities to engage with senior-level executivesbest global network - when you need someone in Jakarta at a moment's notice, we've got that.
review.cons: Cons – there can be a lack of collaboration between P&Ls or geographies.easy to burn out if you don't actively manage work/life balance.sometimes the entrepreneurial spirit can result in the need to constantly innovate new processes and tools just for the sake of it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide more training to employees. You've got the best in the business, help us stay that way.

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to work with growth opportunities and career support if you seek it.”
review.pros: Pros – People and culture are great. Supportive senior staff. World class clients and wealth of knowledge, resources and training opportunities. Employees work hard and have fun.
review.cons: Cons – It's a large company so sometimes you feel a little bit like a cog in a machine; it also means you need to be adamant about your wants/needs/goals to achieve them.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Awesome”
review.pros: Pros – It is a very relaxed work place with great people to work with. Edelman always gives to employees so many oppuritnies to excel and revap thier career path.
review.cons: Cons – I have not encountered any in my five years in Edelman.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing a great job.

review.title: “Rewarding, hands-on and enjoyable work experience.”
review.pros: Pros – Hard work pays off, great people, room for upward mobility and career growth
review.cons: Cons – At times the workload can be stressful and it's hard to ever officially unplug, but that's the nature of the PR industry overall.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Share feedback and constructive criticism, discuss goals and create plan to help employees achieve them.

review.title: “Lots of opportunity for growth, but politics is a big pain here.”
review.pros: Pros – Provides lots of avenues to explore your career, easy to move around within the company, and provides employees with consistent learning opportunities to perfect what we do.
review.cons: Cons – Politics determine your title more than merit does. If you know the right people, your career will go far. If you are just good at what you do, you may get overlooked.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The leader of the office dictates the office culture -- be the kind of person who inspires creativity and promotes diversity.

review.title: “Fast-paced, demanding work environment that values strategic and creative thinking and offers endless opportunities.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman offeres its employees big clients, big resources and big ideasThe company invests a lot in career growth opportunitiesAlways learning/improving
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balanceSalaryDisconnect between senior management and junior staffCompetitiveness over new work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be present; don't consistently cancel or shuffle meetings that aren't priority; don't miss an opportunity to provide feedback

review.title: “Happy at Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – There are wonderful people here, they are smart, respectful, and all are striving to do great things. Work life balance is important here and the employees are important and treated as so.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes it's a bit unorganized but management is working diligently to create process and get things moving forward.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Let's get these process' in action.

review.title: “Energized culture, dedicated to work that makes a difference, inspiring colleagues.”
review.pros: Pros – As a private firm, the company is dedicated to staff development and career progression. The company is very flexible in terms that there are countless unique opportunities within each office and across the network. Colleagues are Grade A and the culture is work hard, play hard.
review.cons: Cons – You need to have the ability to truly own your work-life balance in bigger offices. Work can be stressful at times (but who doesn't want a little bit of that?!).
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Best way to grow as a PR professional and become a master of the trade”
review.pros: Pros – I love the direction, encouragement and work ethic of the team I am working on along with the office as a whole. My colleagues truly care about my professional development, project efficiency and success. Everyone at the office continuously makes me feel welcome, and the atmosphere of the office is a perfect setting for me to work at my best. Everyone always encourages healthy work/life balance.
review.cons: Cons – I do not have any cons!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I do not have any advice. I am thoroughly enjoying my summer at Edelman. I am receiving excellent advice, direction and insights. This experience is not only teaching me more about the field of public relations and communications, but also, I am becoming a better strategic thinker and "team player."

review.title: “I learn something new every day!”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a great place to work - I'm surrounded by smart people who love a challenge and who are always willing to go the extra mile for our clients and each other. I learn something from my colleagues every day, and the firm appreciates and values ideas and work no matter where or who it comes from - intern or top creative director.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is fast-paced environment focused on flawless execution and client service. People that thrive here have an innate entrepreneurial spirit and a thirst to always learn and change. You can't phone it in - you'll get run over by the next guy who wants it more than you.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue doing what you're doing!

review.title: “The best company I have ever worked for.”
review.pros: Pros – Every day I am amazed at the sheer tallent of our workforce, this is the best team of marketing professionals in the world. The company has shifted directions and clearly communicates these changes to the entire organization, there is continued training and most importantly trust in each employee to take risks and be bold.
review.cons: Cons – This industry is notorious for being one of the most stressful in the world, Edelman is no exception but that is not the fault of the company... more the choice of career.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more selective at proactively pitching the right pieces of business.

review.title: “Life is good at Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Creative working environment, supportive team atmosphere, intelligent colleagues, interesting clients, excellent professional development, great career advancement opportunities.
review.cons: Cons – I can't think of any.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make the Fusion site easier to navigate.

review.title: “Challenging, Rewarding, Constantly-Evolving”
review.pros: Pros – When they say it's an entrepreneurial environment...they mean it. It's a major company, but still scrappy like a start-up in many respects. The people, and the camaraderie among them, can't be beat. And the company treats their employees well and truly has a "family" feel to it...it's the rare sort of place where people still can, and want to, build long-term careers.
review.cons: Cons – Internal structure lacks clarity and seems to be constantly changing. The ability to be flexible and adaptable is commendable, but at some point, there has to be some consistency and commitment to a path.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – 1) Give a long, hard look at fiscal structure throughout the organization. In an ideal world, we would adopt a set-up that ensures clients always get the best service, and thus continue to give us their business year after year. As it stands, certain aspects beget infighting and territorial behavior and ultimately do the company a huge disservice. 2) Help staff understand the business-side of account work, and Edelman, from an early level. 3) Continue to reward great work and ideas and embrace a strong work-life balance culture to retain the best staff.

The people, and the camaraderie among them, can't be beat. In an ideal world, we would adopt a set-up that ensures clients always get the best service, and thus continue to give us their business year after year. review.title: “Great company, great people”
review.pros: Pros – This office prides itself on high-quality work - and rightly so. Together, in an albeit high-pressure but collaborative atmosphere, this team delivers great work time and time again, consistently meeting client needs and exceeding expectations. I feel very supported in my work at Edelman; when I have run into difficulties with an account there are always many people willing to help out, offer encouragement or brainstorm solutions. I appreciate the company's global presence, as this allows for us to share resources and expertise cross-practice and cross-office to seamlessly meet client needs.
review.cons: Cons – There is a very large drinking culture here. I would encourage Edelman to examine this as part of the office culture. While it is fun to let loose, not everyone drinks heavily - and some don't drink at all believe it or not - and it's important to be inclusive of others and remember that there are healthier ways to de-stress. While this is admittedly an industry thing and not just an Edelman thing, Edelman strongly encourages drinking as the primary way to deal with stress and celebrate client wins, and upper management sets this example by their own behavior at office functions. While fun sometimes, this is not a sustainable stress reliever in the long run, and not always a healthy example to set for junior staff.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A lot of opportunities to grow your career”
review.pros: Pros – 65 offices around the world, integrated across all practices, good work-life balance philosophy
review.cons: Cons – Compensation is on par with industry standards
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide more direction for integration between PR and Digital

review.title: “An engaging, educational and challenging workplace to lay the foundation for a great PR career”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman network of PR practitioners in various verticals/specialties; client list / work; benefits; workplace environment; senior leadership; industry thought leadership; strong (and growing) Digital practice area
review.cons: Cons – It's an agency - so you're going to put in the work and hours, but if you do, you will learn and grow your career quickly; some offices can be too "top-heavy" with not enough junior staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to educate your employees - especially in satellite offices - with classes and further PR education with a variety of industry topics and trends. Continue to empower employees to explore other internal opportunities - domestic or abroad. Train managers - just because someone has a title doesn't mean they should be a manager of junior staff.

review.title: “The best in the business”
review.pros: Pros – The people are the smartest and most innovative in PR and the culture supports innovation, new ideas, and collaboration
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes, we get focused on the "next big thing" and forget that it's OK for us to perform the basic public relations services some clients seek
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Drive a cultural change at the TOP. The bottom's already changed, but the top is lagging behind.

review.title: “Big company with some of that small family-owned feel”
review.pros: Pros – The firm is filled with very smart and hardworking associates. Compensation is very competitive, and the benefits are excellent. Plus, it feels great to work for the best in the PR field. Finally, I think that Edelman, in many ways, still has that family-owned flavor where management truly cares about their employees.
review.cons: Cons – As Edelman gets larger and larger, it is getting more and more bureaucratic and top-heavy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you are doing: investing in your staff, sharing the rewards of success and encouraging community engagement.

review.title: “Working at Edelman is like eating homemade apple pie...it's good and good for you (mostly).”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman supports risk taking and guided independence.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman has not yet cleared up the confusion between "digital" as a channel versus a practice.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Edelman needs to figure out a way to reward cross-office client/revenue sharing.

review.title: “Exciting, challenging and modern place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has many opportunities for growth and career change for those that prove themselves and raise their hands. Edelman also cares deeply about making the company a fun, exciting and creative place to work, all while providing the benefits, policies and programs needed to feel supported. Creativity, autonomy and flexibility are always at our fingertips. What's not to love?
review.cons: Cons – More dedication to improving compensation for top performers is needed. Rewards and recognition programs are good, but an added focus on rewards (including financial) for employees below VP would be appreciated by many.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep listening to employees through employee surveys and manager conversations with staff. Act on the things that matter most to employees. Give the same creative, bold approach to how we run Edelman as we try to do for our clients.

review.title: “Smart people doing great work for clients.”
review.pros: Pros – There are many pros to working for Edelman: There's a commitment to IP that sets the firm apart from competitors and makes us all smarter; a privately-held firm, Edelman boasts strong leadership, from the very top and through the offices and practice areas; THere is culture of promoting from within and a focus on career planning; finally, global = opportunities for clients and staff alike.
review.cons: Cons – Since it's big, Edelman can also be daunting to navigate internally. With so many "A" personalities and over-achievers, there is also internal competitiveness that can get in the way -- to its credit, Edelman leadership keeps a keen eye on not letting it get out of hand! As with other major PR firms, stress is commensurate size, major clients and focus on excellence.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – One piece of advice would be to balance the flow of internal initiatives. There are so many new ideas, processes and initiatives, that it can be hard to keep up, learn new tricks and incorporate them into smart counsel to clients before another one (just as cool) comes along.

review.title: “Autonomy & Appreciation got married and had a kid - Productivity”
review.pros: Pros – Best reasons to work here include:Very intelligent and pro-active management that tends to have come to work for the company for the right reasons. None of the grand-fathering into management positions seen here, which is rare.Excellent trust levels to get your work done, but accountability is always in place, so you can put your brilliant strategies to work on big name clients, but if that other guy's lousy idea fails you won't be blamed for it, he will.Knowledge sharing is encouraged and highly valued. I was surprised particularly in the world of PR that there was no miserly hoarding of intel or secretive action going on within account teams. Again, that knowledge sharing. Good stuff.
review.cons: Cons – If you're used to the high agency life, it's a little less lavish here. Not so many freebies, great clients but few outings and the work culture is professional in every way including social conduct.Don't go here for a bro-down, and they drink at 3pm on Fridays but don't expect anyone to hang around the office after the bell rings.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management here is really good at being supportive and suggestive, but not overpowering, and they keep their own workplates loaded up so things stay fair (I'm not a manager either, I feel like I need to mention that after this glowing review)

review.title: “Edelman employs smart, innovative people and aims to create a work environment to keep them.”
review.pros: Pros – -Employs the smartest, most innovative people in the communications industry-Affords access to some of the most influential clients in any industry-Invests in continuing education for employees-Fosters a fun, caring work environment-Provides opportunities to work across the globe-Takes corporate social responsibility seriously, and seeks out opportunities for the company and individual employees to give back to the community
review.cons: Cons – -Long hours-Large company can mean some inefficiencies-Work/life balance can sometimes suffer
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work and continue to listen to employees feedback!

review.title: “Working at Edelman is like eating homemade apple pie...it's good and good for you (mostly).”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman supports risk taking and guided independence.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman has not yet cleared up the confusion between "digital" as a channel versus a practice.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Edelman needs to figure out a way to reward cross-office client/revenue sharing.

review.title: “My experience with Edelman has pushed me to be a better employee and PR professional.”
review.pros: Pros – -everyone is helpful-work with some of the smartest people in the PR/Communications industry-fantastic clients-feel supported by my coworkers and manager-work hard, play hard atmosphere (every one knows how to have fun, but know when to be serious and get work done)
review.cons: Cons – -work long hours-tight deadlines-pay is low for junior level staff
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman takes culture seriously and loves to give back to their employees.”
review.pros: Pros – You get to work with some the greatest minds in the industry on some of the world's best brands. Because Edelman is an independent agency, they place an increased value on culture and maintain an entrepreneurial spirit that makes working here fun and rewarding.
review.cons: Cons – Like any PR agency, it is sometimes a struggle to maintain a healthy work/life balance and office politics can come into play.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Everyone seemed happy during my interview and they really are!”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is an outstanding company that values and cultivates leadership and skill building.
review.cons: Cons – As with any agency, client work can make it difficult to maintain a strong work/life balance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to strengthen your mentorship programs.

review.title: “Steep & exciting learning curve”
review.pros: Pros – Great team, supportive and encouraging. Flexible and receptive to change, structured just right for growth.
review.cons: Cons – None that I can think of.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Encourage graduate studies among senior staff. Strengthen professional development program.

review.title: “Smart people, quality work”
review.pros: Pros – fast-paced, interesting clients, team produces cutting-edge work, people are friendly and fun
review.cons: Cons – long hours at times and on certain projects, pay is competitive within the industry, but low in general
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – management is working on transparency, and this is a wonderful direction to move in

review.title: “A great place to build a career.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are amazing, smart, creative and invested in the success of the company. I am continually amazed at the level of work and creativity shown by my colleagues across the globe. Edelman is a place to build a career.
review.cons: Cons – At times, the offices can be competitive with each other and seem to be out of sync--especially when it comes to building the right teams, with the right expertise from across the network. Some of this can be attributed to the confidence and pride in one's individual "home" team, but can also come across as greedy and self-serving.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's not always about the big wins, stay focused on the quality of the business and the ongoing service we provide to our clients. Also, reward those who work collaboratively and continue to incent teams to work cross-office. Continue to consider others beyond the "usual suspects" for the bigger and more interesting roles at Edelman.

review.title: “Working at Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – They really care about their employees and their work/life balance
review.cons: Cons – Can be very stressful at work at times
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great learning experience, but a lot of politics and favoritism"”
review.pros: Pros – Hands on learning experienceBreadth of practice areasAbility to cross collaborate with other officesReputationTransparent internal department and office transfersColleagues and environmentEntrepreneurial spiritEvents
review.cons: Cons – Politics - but this is to be expected at any corporationFavoritism - HUGE issue. Management cannot see what happens when they favor one colleague over another. Resentment from other colleaguesSalary - on the low end for experience levelManagement
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do not put direct reports into buckets; listen to your team and reviews. Train harder to become more effective. Great managers with the ability to manage and coach should uplift and motivate direct reports. There are some great managers here; retention starts with an employee who is happy.

review.title: “Great place to build your skills and experience”
review.pros: Pros – Top-tier clients; hard-working staff; great facilities;
review.cons: Cons – lack of work/life balance; very competitive between practices and other Edelman offices; salary often below market rate for the position;
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – doesn't seem like promoting and working to entice junior staff to stay longer than 2 years is a priority - no bonuses, difficulty moving up, below average salaries, low raise increases, etc.;

review.title: “Senior Account Supervisor”
review.pros: Pros – The opportunity to work with couple of the most brilliant minds in the industry
review.cons: Cons – Hard to brake the ice in the network
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay attention on how to share the knowledge and be sure the offices collaborate

review.title: “Family owned values drive success”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has the stability of a large and growing firm. Yet it is the family owned values that drive the companies continued success.
review.cons: Cons – Human resources is slow to hire. There are limited growth opportunities for non-PR staff. Counter offers are rarely made and good people end up making the competitors even stronger.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “My overall experience at Edelman has been incredibly positive. The pros definately outweight the cons”
review.pros: Pros – Great career and growth opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Often makes for a difficult work/life balance, seems as though the salaries could be a bit more compeititive
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Incredible company to learn the ropes of PR, but pay is horrible.”
review.pros: Pros – Constant learning opportunities, well experienced leadership, opportunity to do work that's higher than your "level."
review.cons: Cons – Demanding hours, almost unlivable pay.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Appreciate the junior staff more and reward them with compensation for the work they do.

review.title: “Organization is great; local offices not in line with corporate philosophy”
review.pros: Pros – Terrific employee programs.I've worked with some of the smartest people here.Great pride in the brand and the work that we do as a firm.
review.cons: Cons – Locally, not willing to invest in people or clients in any significant way."Talk the talk" but do not "walk the walk" in terms of corporate culture/philosophy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest time and money into the right people; it will pay off.

review.title: “Big company with some of that small family-owned feel”

Plus, it feels great to work for the best in the PR field. Finally, I think that Edelman, in many ways, still has that family-owned flavor where management truly cares about their employees.
review.cons: Cons – As Edelman gets larger and larger, it is getting more and more bureaucratic and top-heavy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you are doing: investing in your staff, sharing the rewards of success and encouraging community engagement.

review.title: “VP Creative Director”
review.pros: Pros – Face pace environment. Smart and energetic people. Can do attitude. Lots of change to come in the next year as they vamp up their creative resources.
review.cons: Cons – Senior level people tend to manage up, not know how to manage projects or how to give direction to the junior level. Some seem short sighted and/or resistant to change.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Typical Agency Experience”
review.pros: Pros – Work with some of the industries best, access to all corners of the globe and truly a collegial work environment. Hands down the best place to start one's PR career.
review.cons: Cons – The same things plague Edelman that plague all other global PR agencies. Poor compensation, high burnout rate and demanding managers that don't value work / life balance. While the legacy of Dan is woven into the very fabric of this agencies being, some of his core principles are lost in the struggle to meet financial targets.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management accountability and a focus on employee satisfaction. High turnover seems to be a detracting factor to team morale, the more people that leave the worse it gets for the incumbents. HR could also do a better job in finding the right talent, their lassez faire attitude and lack of attention to detail makes it hard to build a strong team.

review.title: “Typical large firm”
review.pros: Pros – Tons of resources, opportunities to work with very smart, creative game-changers
review.cons: Cons – Yoy really are just a number, unless you have an in with senior management. Stay too long and they will forget you exist.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look outside of those who kiss ass. Value staff for the work they do, not the work they talk to you about.

review.title: “Strike a better balance”
review.pros: Pros – People, process, products, places. We have smart people; sound, documented approaches; innovative offerings; and offices in 67 cities throughout the world. There's a lot of opportunity with Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – Little overhead. It's probably why we are so profitable, but it weighs heavy on PR staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Strike a better balance of billable/non-billable work for senior PR staff. In other words, senior people are expected to do a lot of administrative work (staffing, resource allocation, new business, budgeting, financial management, training, other non-billable initiatives, etc.) and not sacrifice client work to get it done. It is incredibly difficult as there are only 24 hours in a day. And most aren't motivated by all the administrative work, but rather would like to spend more time focusing on clients.

review.title: “Technical Role”
review.pros: Pros – Great people work here. Everyone committed to what they are doing. Very knowledgeable folks. Massive client base which gives one the opportunity to work on an incredible range of projects.
review.cons: Cons – They are going through changes all the time. While this opens up opportunities for the right person, it can create a bit of instability.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Remarkable breadth and depth of experience in a culture focused on getting to the best answer”
review.pros: Pros – Best people, best clients, dynamism and variety. A global network that is active every day
review.cons: Cons – Not a place for people who move slowly
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to recruit the best

review.title: “Intern”
review.pros: Pros – Relaxed, professional environment, organized, fulfilling
review.cons: Cons – No set work hours, long days
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Questionable ethics, high-pressure environment”
review.pros: Pros – Some smart people work there
review.cons: Cons – Cutthroat, with client service not a priority
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They should try to walk the walk, not just talk the talk.

review.title: “Don't believe the hype”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman's extensive client list provides employees with the opportunity to work with some of the biggest brands in digital/consumer/health/travel.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is by far the worst corporate culture I have ever experienced in my 10+ years on the job market.Account teams are ridiculously unorganized and upper management is populated with opportunistic and disingenuous individuals that play favorites and are all too eager to throw junior staff under the bus at a moment's notice.Rude emails, name calling, unjustified accusations of inefficiency, screaming obscenities on company conference calls: all part of the day-to-day life at Edelman.And if you think the Human Resources department will be there to help you when you inevitably bear the brunt of this abuse, think again! Edelman's HR department is by far the worst I have ever encountered.There are plenty of PR companies out there. Learn from my mistake and think twice before signing on the dotted line with these folks.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat others as you would want to be treated

review.title: “Edelman will not appreciate you. You are expendable.”
review.pros: Pros – The opportunity to work on large, very well-known brands and build a resume that will make you stand out, internal resources, learning opportunities
review.cons: Cons – The culture has changed for the worse, the company has become too large and top-heavy, so mid-level staff are not properly supported and do the work of junior staff on top of their workload, very political- good work is not appreciated as much as it should be if you aren't "playing the game."
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More junior staff support- your Senior Account Executives can't do everything. There is a lack of culture here- work is no longer fun. We spend 10-12 hours here a day and it feels like there is no point to being here and we are expendable. Appreciate the staff you have- give bonuses, Inspire us- don't just offer money to us if we get new hires- that is not how you retain talented staff. Appreciate those of us with media relations talent- that is the backbone of this business and you don't value it at all. Consulting is not everything. Be flexible with those who don't fit your account manager mode. There are many creative, talented people going to waste and leaving because you lack appreciation for those with amazing, non-cookie-cutter skills and expertise. I have been here for seven years and never expected to feel this way.

review.title: “great creative workforce, but not so much support staff”
review.pros: Pros – great creative culture and young vibrant workforce but not the same for support positions
review.cons: Cons – finance teams do not collaborate and work against each other. There is very little trust between groups.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be more open and transparent with your teams, especially when it comes to hiring managers.

review.title: “Intern”
review.pros: Pros – -hands on-great clients-amazing culture-Great location
review.cons: Cons – There were none that I could think of

review.title: “Opportunities if you ask for them”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of opportunities to work on a variety of accounts and projects
review.cons: Cons – Need to know how to work the system to get what you want; never be afraid to ask
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “good people, inefficient system”
review.pros: Pros – lots of opportunity to work on different products. I was able to move around and explore different sectors.
review.cons: Cons – I had about 8 different bosses in two different offices. Too much like "Office Space." Was there in the middle of the recession and they couldn't hold on to many people. Also, hours were ridiculous.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Redefining integrated communications.”
review.pros: Pros – Global resources and entrepreneurial spirit.
review.cons: Cons – Resistant to change, lack of support for new initiatives.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Embrace knowledge-sharing and new team member performance metrics.

review.title: “Abusive with no integrity”
review.pros: Pros – Was allowed work from home
review.cons: Cons – Was hired in a contract to hire position. Immediate need was to help with a launch which was to happen in a few weeks. Soon after launch, I was summarily terminated with no reason despite the fact that just the prior day I was praised for my efforts.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop lying and preying on unsuspecting folks

review.title: “All the benefits of a global agency and a boutique”
review.pros: Pros – Great colleagues - genuinely enjoy spending >8 hours/day with themCulture has steadily improved - praise, accountability and real-time feedback as well as a fun and collaborative approachGet to work with incredibly smart people all across the Edelman network
review.cons: Cons – Agency life can be unpredictable, and work-life balance occasionally suffers as a result.Politicking inevitable at executive level of broader company
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember to put your people and your clients ahead of your egos and P&LKeep investing in the company to maintain our leadership position

review.title: “Excellent global company”
review.pros: Pros – Good family values that respects the talent and creativity of its people. It's a great group of people happy to share their passion. Each employee is given the tools and responsibility to achieve.
review.cons: Cons – The hours can be long but it hardly matters if you love what you do. It's hard to find a lot of negatives - it's a great team. No job is perfect but I honestly am having a hard time thinking of 20 negative words
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Wonderful place to intern”
review.pros: Pros – Wonderful place to start; has high status and makes room for many opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Could pay more for the hardwork; interns dont get overtime
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great management

review.title: “Account Executive”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to work, lots of opportunity
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance is something many of the junior employees struggle to keep
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Smart People, Lots of Resources for Growth”
review.pros: Pros – many educational resources for professional growth, opportunity to work with a lot of smart and creative people on diverse projects, straight-forward hierarchy, employee review process
review.cons: Cons – when i first started, i worked on a big tech account. it seemed like management was more concerned with keeping the client happy at the expense of us, the people actually executing. this seemed to be the case even when the client had unrealistic demands and was already starting to cut back. they ended up ending our contract, poaching around 4 of my colleagues and that made for a very tricky and unpleasant transition period.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “account executive”
review.pros: Pros – work with smart, innovative people.
review.cons: Cons – some potential for ambitions to get in the way of results.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Over worked, underpaid, undervalued...”
review.pros: Pros – Great for your resume.High profile clients being great experience.Lots of in-house perks, i.e. office parties, outside events, catering, massages, etc.
review.cons: Cons – Not easy to transition to new position OR new office.Upper management doesn't make time to engage and teach level 1 and 2 employees.NO sense of team work. Most people are just trying to get ahead for themselves.High level employees express no plan to fix continuous problems regarding morale in the office.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Walk around the office and talk to people.Engage with lower level employees....you're upset cause they're not doing their job, and they're frustrated cause they have NO IDEA how their daily tasks are contributing to the bigger picture!!!BE PRESENT in the office and at office events! They know you're busy, but would it hurt to try?Take a look at the workload your teams have...and the time they have to do it. You'd probably be getting better quality work if you had everyone on the same page.

review.title: “Fast-paced, always changing environment with great people but occasionally questionable decision-making”
review.pros: Pros – The people are amazing. You'll make great friends and feel invited into a very collaborative, friendly environment by your peers. The agency at large is very well-respected, which is a great status to maintain and be part of when working with clients.
review.cons: Cons – Decisions made by senior leadership are not communicated well to employees. Any communications that are made by leadership are clouded in positivity, lacking detail and decreasing their credibility. Also, the leadership team seems to have become a group in and of themselves, protecting one another and becoming more disconnected from the team at large. For example, senior leadership members were almost all promoted to higher positions during the most recent common review season, while hard-working and deserving midlevel staff were largely overlooked despite similar years of experience and age.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate decisions that are made regularly. Reinforce ideals of an environment (such as approachable leadership) by practicing them, not merely stating them.

review.title: “Great work experience, but lots of double standards and too much office politics”
review.pros: Pros – You really get to learn a lot at Edelman! Anyone new to the business will get all the training they need starting their career here. If you can get someone from upper management "behind" you, you will excel and do really well. The first three years there, I experienced relative job growth and comparable salary adjustments. There were a lot of employee perks and benefits- probably the most I've ever had at any other company. If you like hard work, are just starting out and need experience, this is the place for you! I thoroughly enjoyed my job here and all that I was able to take away from the experience.
review.cons: Cons – There was a great salary disparity at all levels- raises were based on who you know, who your team managers are, and what clients you worked for. Once the VIP behind me was let go through "downsizing," there was no more job growth or salary adjustments. I noticed a glass ceiling for minority job growth and advancement- no minority upper level managers, and virtually no minority staff (other than interns) working on projects that were "diversity" oriented! Managers were reluctant to let their good employees advance to other areas of the company. Often, new people or temporary consultants were hired on instead of promoting from within across areas. Seniority didn't really mean much unless you were an Executive level employee. There was a lot of back-stabbing and corporate bickering among staff, double standards for different staff levels and even finger-pointing, blaming and all-around very hostile environment. The micro-managing became unbearable- I had to clock in/out when I used the restroom?? HR was not very helpful- seemingly mediators, but never resolved any issues other than to assist with your exit interview, which by the time you were done with it, your computer was disconnected from the system and you were locked out of any files and your access denied! Communication is the cornerstone of Public Relations- how ironic that Edelman can execute PR events with the best of them, but management had some of the poorest communicators I had ever worked with!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get a clue! Undercover Boss is a great show that opens the eyes of out-of-touch bosses- Edelman needs a serious dose of that! My experience was a few years ago, but if things haven't changed much (which from reading other reviews I gather they haven't), try being more open-minded and not so narrowly focused on traditional ways of running a business. Try equality across the board, not by department or levels of management. You need to think outside the box with regards to organizational behavior relative to management and staff, and be just as creative as you are with your PR events. Hire more diverse staff: people who can bring new cultures, ideas and ways of doing things to senior level positions, and not just in their own countries! Hire a company like Accenture to help make Edelman the type of company people expect it to be!

review.title: “Good apples and bad apples”
review.pros: Pros – The company is the best of the large agencies. There is a lot a person can learn. Social media folks are the best around.
review.cons: Cons – There are still a lot of 'bad apples' at the executive level who care a lot more about moving up than anything else. An employee's happiness at Edelman is completely dependent on the attitude of his/her manager.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great name, doesn't live up to expectation”
review.pros: Pros – Great for your resume, you work with people who are friendly and very talented.Awesome clients! It's a good start to your career because people have high expectations of the agency.
review.cons: Cons – Trainees are not paid, too many interns/trainees hired takes away from recognizing talent and providing them a full experience. Dispose of trainees/interns not to mention most stay past hours without pay.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Best Public Relations Internship Out There”
review.pros: Pros – At Edelman, interns work incredibly hard and are given a lot of responsibility. Most interns handle a workload of a AAE and add a tremendous amount to their portfolio. You're going to work more than 9-5 but that's standard PR for you! I've found that upper management is really receptive to hearing ideas from all members of the team, including interns, and it was pretty cool being able to contribute to overall strategy as an intern.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is pretty meager and I think that creates stress for interns, especially when you're there for six months.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increase intern pay. As most interns have their bachelor's degree and are expected to work for 6 months, it'd be considerate to adequately compensate them for their work and experience.

review.title: “Wonderful but challenging career”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is world-class. They cultivate the best strategic minds in the industry - they train professionals to not just be mouth pieces, but true partners and counsel to clients. There is a wonderful range of clients to work on and many growth opportunities, as long as you put in the work and dedication. The people are fantastic - some the brightest - but also fun and wonderful to be around. The leadership really cares about its people. They provided awesome programs to aid in professional and personal development.
review.cons: Cons – Work-life balance was always a challenge, especially if you had demanding clients but I think that's true of any large agency. It can be easy to burn out if you don't set smart boundaries. There was also office politics (minimal) but again I think that's true of any agency. Edelman seems to be on the lower-end of the scale when it comes to compensation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Sometimes it didn't seem that negative feedback in peer reviews of management was taken seriously. Poor managers would still be promoted because they kept clients happy. It might help if there was follow-up or acknowledgement that those managers wore working to improve their management skills.

review.title: “Wonderful people, challenging environment, lots of opportunities for growth”
review.pros: Pros – -Surrounded by smart and motivated people-Senior leadership is forward-thinking and strategic-Cutting-edge thought leadership and innovation; well-respected in the industry
review.cons: Cons – -Could do a better job of nurturing “non-traditional” career paths, although strides have certainly been made there-New business process can sometimes be cumbersome and complicated-Having so many smart and talented people means we have a tendency to “over-think” - need to focus on providing clean, simple, impactful ideas to clients
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing - listening to your employees and taking action. We appreciate and applaud your efforts.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Energetic, smart peers and managers that are invested in your future. Great mix of big and small accounts provides budding PR pros with excellent job experience from the minute they walk in the building. I wouldn't work for any other agency.
review.cons: Cons – Less about Edelman in particular and more about "agency life": For first-timers at an agency or those coming from an "in-house" PR position, be prepared to work hard. That said, you get what you give.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Trainee Experience was okay.”
review.pros: Pros – - Great HR staff, willing to speak with you and help you at anytime when they aren't busy- Great amount of projects on the consumer marketing side (However, you must have the staff trust you with the projects or they will give them to a paid intern; your experience is really what you make of it)- Good perks throughout the week (food, etc)- A lot of opportunity to attend client meetings; if you are invited
review.cons: Cons – - Senior management can be very wishy washy with their expectations of you; depending on the work load or their mood. This can disrupt communication effectiveness.- Arguably, Interview expectations can be completely different from the expectation when you start your traineeship
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Senior management should have more respect for their trainees presence. Edelman is a lot of work, requires a tremendous amount of time, and can be very stressful for people whom are in school.- Overall Edelman is the number one PR Firm for a reason. They have a very smart set of staff, and a lot that students can learn from if they make their experience worth while and can donate the time to do so.

review.title: “The land of Zombies and Stepford Wives -”
review.pros: Pros – good global clients that you can work on - some employees thrive there because they go to their desk, work quietly and do what they are told - very stepford wife mentality
review.cons: Cons – They have created such a large organization that runs well - they just took any humanity out of the place - more concerned about reaching a billion in revenue then caring about employees; the once a year company meeting is so highly produced it is watching 4 hours of Edelman Propoganda shoved down your throat -
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management should wake up and see that it should be more about money and they should care about their employees -

review.title: “Good place - great people”
review.pros: Pros – Super nice office - great location. Really smart people. Edelman is a big company globally. PDX office is super focused on growing.
review.cons: Cons – Hours can be crazy. Some clients are hard to work with. Some areas of the office are better to sit in than others.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get Edelman more visbility in Portland market. Its good we do a lot of celebrations don't stop those. I've seen people bash the leaders on this site. I disagree. They are great but tough, and if you don't know them its your fault. Some of the leaders before were the worst.

review.title: “Good learning environment, but management is a disappointment”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a good place to start your career. You work long hours and are presented with very challenging tasks, but you can learn a lot over a short period of time.
review.cons: Cons – As you continue working for Edelman over a period of time, you learn that those who get promoted are basically failing up. The ones who succeed are not the best PR specialists, but those who are best at PR'ing themselves.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management should reflect more carefully on why Edelman loses many of its best people after working there for only a couple of years. People become disillusioned. They don't leave for salary reasons. It is because they are not being rewarded in other ways.

review.title: “Jumping through hoops”
review.pros: Pros – Big name client experienceWorking with the best of the bestSome great at-work perks (coffee, food, beer on Thursday's)Portfolio building
review.cons: Cons – ZERO work-life balanceManagers make you jump through hoops to prove yourself (waste of their time & clients budget)Low payIf you don't bleed Edelman, you won't make it there
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Remember what it was like when YOU were in an entry-level position

review.title: “totally not impressed with the company”
review.pros: Pros – big agency good money not great results
review.cons: Cons – nothing got done. all we did was create plans we couldn't execute
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Too much bureaucracy and bad middle management”
review.pros: Pros – the place has a great name and carries some prestige so it looks good on your resume. the senior management is good and there's a lot of different areas that you can get involved in.
review.cons: Cons – there's too much emphasis on how much time you're billing and not enough emphasis on recognizing when people are doing well. the middle management is really horrible and HR sucks.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Never looked back”
review.pros: Pros – Beautiful office space, desirable locations, and looks great on a resume
review.cons: Cons – Bottom line: If you don't eat, sleep, and breathe like these cliquey woman then save yourself the headache and go someplace where difference and originality is praised
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't just get work done through people but help develop people together through work!

review.title: “Constantly thinking outside of the box.”
review.pros: Pros – Good people, best in class.
review.cons: Cons – Terrible work life balance and some difficult clients.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Push back more on clients, it's not worth losing employees.

review.title: “Great experience within Consumer Public Relations”
review.pros: Pros – People, location, clients, management, promoted frequently
review.cons: Cons – Not as progressive as other agencies
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman Public Relation Office Assistant”
review.pros: Pros – Great reputation and name in the business
review.cons: Cons – Not good to their lower level employees
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat everyone the same way

review.title: “Disappointed with career growth”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, fun to work with
review.cons: Cons – Very cheap company; only got one bonus in three years and it was only 1 paycheck worth. Very few promotions in my group. HR and two people I interviewied with misled me about possibility of interim promotion. Requirements for a promotion kept changing. Head of my group rarely communicated creating an environment of paranoia and frustration in the group.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Depends on what you're looking for”
review.pros: Pros – Work with smart, creative people; if you want agency experience, this is a good place to get it; ability to work with large and interesting clients; challenging environment; nice benefits and time-off package
review.cons: Cons – Big divide between junior and senior staff; work environment can be chaotic and unpredictable; many senior staffers don't have the time or interest to fully explain projects, provide feedback or mentor; your experience largely depends on the team you're on and the type of clients you work with; long hours are expected; senior staff can be disrespectful of junior staff's time; it can be a good place for entry-level people or very senior, but not great for mid-level.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't spread everyone so thin and pay more attention to developing junior and mid-level staff.

review.title: “Unsatisfactory”
review.pros: Pros – Good client accounts - CPG, etc.
review.cons: Cons – Unprofessional staff, management unconcerned. Not a good experience.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Not a great experience”
review.pros: Pros – Big-name clients, smart staff, hands-on opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Management structure doesn't make sense - you only report to your account teams and you may NEVER work with your manager directly (yet your manager reviews your work), senior management often reams out junior staff, worked non-stop til 1am many nights without any recognition, very cliquey
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good training ground for junior and mid level”
review.pros: Pros – Young professionals get exposure to PR at top notch client companies, along with many lesser known companies. Opportunities exist to work o a wide variety of client types and industries.Benefits and compensation are good to very good, opportunity for travel and there's even global "work abroad for a year" program.
review.cons: Cons – Easy to get siloed in a group or on a large account, but Edelman has improved opportunities for employees to transfer teams and onto new accounts over the last few years.Lots of egos and internal competition among offies, practice areas and individuals. Squeaky wheels tend to get a lot of grease, deserved or not. Lots of big egos. Still a pink collar ghetto, with the vast majority of upper management jobs held by men, though arguably slowly improving in this area.Expectation that you are "always on, always connected" can be burnout. Definitely not a 9-5 place.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman Public Relations Intern”
review.pros: Pros – Full-time, great professional experience for public relations graduates, friendly and caring employees and supervisors willing to give advice and improve your work
review.cons: Cons – One of the smaller Edelman offices

review.title: “Great destination for hard workers looking to gain invaluable experience”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, top clients, forward-thinking vision and excellent management.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours and modest compensation.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Quirky, one-of-a-kind place with mostly great people doing meaningful work for heavy-hitting clients”
review.pros: Pros – Independence, guided by our own interests and client interests; good pay and benefits; the fact that the Edelman family is deeply involved with and committed to our business makes all the difference; this is a place where you can chart your own destiny and try new things
review.cons: Cons – Bad behavior at senior levels tolerated too often and too long, although efforts have been taken to address this in the past few years; base pay is typically fair at senior levels although bonus potential is relatively low (and target payouts just decreased by 1 percent in FY13, although stretch potential increased accordingly)
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Fantastic”
review.pros: Pros – From day one, my coworkers were so welcoming to bring me aboard and hit the ground running on projects. Best feeling to have such an amazing team to work with and makes going to work so enjoyable. I can see myself here for a while.
review.cons: Cons – I may still be in the honeymoon phase because there is nothing to complain about from my experience thus far.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great work environment, but only limited support resources for people below the VP level”
review.pros: Pros – 1. I feel secure in my job.2. It is easy to find a mentor within the firm. We have a formal mentorship program, but even without enrolling, it is easy to find industry leaders willing to provide professional and career advice. This has been invaluable for me.3. My current team dynamic is awesome. I enjoy working with the people on my local team, and we work together to produce outstanding results for our clients.
review.cons: Cons – 1. I have not been provided the technology resources (laptop, compatibility with Mac products, etc.) that are necessary to support high levels of dedication to my clients' accounts. Though our IT department has been updating systems, there seems to be a reluctance to provide those expected to execute the2. Staffing seems to be heavily weighted toward the senior management side of the business. The ratio of strategists to executors on accounts often seems to be 1:1, where it should be more weighted toward execution.3. Though my colleagues and I are often asked for opinions on how to conduct client activities, it often seems these are courtesies rather than legitimate requests for input.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get real with technology - the folks doing the work for clients run Macs now. IT always complains that Macs aren't secure, but they've made it work for our creative staff in Digital, so it must be possible. Make remote desktop compatible with Macs, or give us laptops like most other professional service firms.

review.title: “Great place to work. Fosters creativity, provides responsibility, lots of room to grow.”
review.pros: Pros – Leadership and mid-management are eager for creative ideas. Employees are given ample opportunity to prove themselves with clients.
review.cons: Cons – Always on culture. Leadership attempts to stifle it to preserve work/life balance, but be prepared to respond. It's part of the industry, and being available gets you in-line for promotions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Protect staff from over-use and burn out. Employees aren't just assets.

review.title: “A Stand-out Employer Among the Other PR Agencies”
review.pros: Pros – -Training is much more robust and taken more seriously than at any other agency-Work-life balance (it is what you make it - I've found mine and so have several of my other colleagues)-Many or most teams work cross-practice-Everyone knows Edelman... if you've worked here for any length of time, people seem to take you a bit more seriously as a PR professional-LEADERSHIP - we have exceptional leadership in our office; he's very accessible and focused on making things better for his teams-Edelman NEXT - allows you to carve your own path and how you want to progress within the agency, even if you want to change directions or locations-Working at Edelman Atlanta comes with all the benefits of being at a world-class (arguably the best) PR agency - smart people, our colleagues set precedents and trends all the time and our clients are some that people dream for years of working with-Pretty lax "business casual" dress code, yet we can wear jeans every day
review.cons: Cons – -Office location and surroundings downtown-Parking (we pay if we're below VP and the deck is NOT very safe)-Non-competitive salary (even after it's been increased, it's still below several other agencies - big and small)-Comp time policy for working outside of workday schedule (but to be fair, that's an agency-wide issue)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please, please, please be a little more prudent with who is put into leadership positions, especially those with records of high turnover and employee management issues. And I'd also advise to continue tying to improve compensation for employees - especially in comparison to agencies in town like Porter, MSL, C&W, etc.

review.title: “Great Company to Work For”
review.pros: Pros – You can create your own path at Edelman if you a. meet the right people b. work hard in showcasing your talents to senior leadershipPeople- Brilliant, talented, friendly. There's always the difficult person here and there but overall, everyone is just incredibly nice and smart. i don't leave mainly because of the people actually..
review.cons: Cons – FavoritismCompensation: Unfortunately, the longer you stay, you realize that others competitors are paying more outside and people that come in are making more than you. It's very disappointing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay attention to training your junior staff. It will greatly benefit you in the end and make sure you are taking care of people first before of the business. Work life balance is key and the junior staff should feel protected and encouraged to balancing the two.

review.title: “A place where you can truly grow your career”
review.pros: Pros – 1. Enterpreneurial spirit is one of the company's values - they encourage you to take risks and challenge yourself. If something doesn't work, dust yourself off and try again. That's why so much great work is done here.2. Opportunities for career pathing - Edelman has a "matrix" organization. You don't move straight up the ladder, you can move laterally, vertically, etc. If you want to try something new, there is a geography track, practice track, GCRM (global client) track to look forward to. If you don't feel like you are fitting into your current role, seek something new or propose creating a new role if possible.3. Good work-life balance. We work very hard but Edelman is a family-run business and they understand the importance of needing to blow off steam and family time. Employees are given great options for paid time off and the company holds fun events like happy hours to build camarderie in the office.
review.cons: Cons – The fast pace may not be for everyone. You need to be flexible and able to focus on many things at once, lest you be left behind.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Everyday I learn something new - the work is engaging and there are constant opportunities to grow!”
review.pros: Pros – Work hard, play hard - If you continue to do good work, Edelman makes sure to reward you for your efforts. The company is very transparent and clearly demonstrate that they care, value, and appreciate their employees. Edelman tends to treat everyone with respect, including the interns. There is no closed door policy because there are no offices, it's a very open environment and people are approachable. Edelman cares about employee growth and work/life balance. There are many company paid outings to gather with your fellow colleagues and let loose a bit. I love that I can wear comfortable clothing to the office everyday! This is not always common in an office setting. Richard Edelman seems to be a very humble, and genuinely nice man.
review.cons: Cons – Like any agency, at times you are spread to thing or have overwhelming amounts of work. However, Edelman does attempt to try to create a balance as much as possible.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – In my experience, very little hand holding and micromanagement. There is at times red tape which could be scaled back a bit. The trust is there because Edelman professionals are among the best in the business, but at times there is sensitivities about how to approach media or clients etc. The more trust you instill in your fellow colleagues or subordinates, the more they will have the opportunity to grow, learn and get comfortable interacting with different constituents.

review.title: “Edelman has been a wonderful way to enter the working world.”
review.pros: Pros – Awesome people, well-reputed company, generous benefits and time off, offices around the globe
review.cons: Cons – Long hours. But its necessary and it pays off.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “My colleagues are incredibly creative, ambitious and down to earth. Best team to work with!”
review.pros: Pros – Politics don't play such a high role here. You're legitimately rewarded for your efforts. There's also no discrimination or egos flying around when it comes to sharing great ideas and going with the best one. Everyone is freakishly smart but incredibly funny and down to earth. You feel like you can be yourself here.
review.cons: Cons – I know I can easily ask for a higher salary elsewhere but to be working with this team is truly a privilege. Good people are hard to find...especially in New York.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – In many instances there are individuals given a SVP or EVP title who granted have many talents but sometimes they lack in the actual skill of managing people. If they're a creative individual especially - they should not be managing a team under them - just let them focus on the bigger picture.

review.title: “I've had better.”
review.pros: Pros – Large company names look great on resumes. Once you get your foot in the door you can transfer to other offices/cities. If you get the rare chance to work with other offices (new york/chicago/atlanta), you can learn a lot. Severance packages tend to be generous (or so we've heard).
review.cons: Cons – Culture is driven by fear. Local management has zero agency management experience. Turnover of respected and talented employees is extremely high. Agency brand recognition is low in the market. All the free coffee and soda (or meal replacement shakes....) in the world can't make up for a hostile work environment.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you want to be respected, don't scream at or patronize your people so much.

review.title: “PR staff: excellent. MIS operations: needs work.”
review.pros: Pros – In my 15-month tenure at Edelman, I have met some amazing people in the PR business and, as an MIS team member, been involved with some large and interesting projects. Senior leadership of the company seems to have a vision and a plan to execute it, and is doing it very well. Benefits are good, and time-off policies (vacation, sick, leave, etc) are great.
review.cons: Cons – Unfortunately, the vision for the global MIS infrastructure is not only clouded, but nearly non-existent... or at least, not communicated to staff. The global infrastructure team has cycled through five managers in eight months and continues to be understaffed. The CIO position has been vacant for at least six months. The US-wide bonus eligibility was changed suddenly this year to require over 12 months of service (and not pro-rated), excluding several people hired 12-13 months earlier who were counting on it... it does make me feel less valued than the person sitting next to me who has been employed three weeks longer than me. Salaried MIS team members really feel that, being a cost center and not billable, we are not given the consideration that billiable employees may sometimes get. During a recent office seating re-organization, the entire NY-based MIS team was moved from the open-cubicle seating plan to what amounts to glorified picnic tables.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There are some great people in MIS... long-term employees, smart and accomplished... that would make great leaders. Each infrastructure team leader on the revolving door was hired externally. Management should look to promote from within, as they do in the PR practices (this is why I have rated "Career Opportunities" very low.) And, at the very minimum, the MIS department needs a global CIO to provide an overall vision and execution plan. Lastly, uncouple the purchasing of MIS equipment from the regional CIOs and put it under one unified, global team. It is very difficult for the global infrastructure team, charged with providing efficient connectivity worldwide, to provide such a service when a local person can easily say "no, we don't want to spend the money" and then complain about their sub-par access to resources.

review.title: “Edelman Digital New Hire Experience”
review.pros: Pros – In the short time I have been here (~4 months) I have already grown to love the company culture. Very rarely is the first answer 'No'. It is clear your experience here is what you make of it. This and the work/life balance will (hopefully) have me calling Edelman home for years to come.
review.cons: Cons – There seems to be some confusion among titles and responsibilities. Some people who you would assume have higher titles don't, while others who may not seem as advance do have a higher title.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “If you work in PR, you want to work here.”
review.pros: Pros – -Training and development: Edelman U, mentoring from direct supervisor, and opportunities to learn management skills at a junior level were invaluable as a young professional. Also received feedback regularly (good or bad) from supervisors which helped me improve and learn consistently.-Opportunities to work with top brands and on global accounts: Several accounts I worked on were based in major US and International markets outside of New York, which gave the opportunity to gain experience working in markets other than where I live.-Perks and benefits: Amazing benefits and perks available from day one. Felt that Edelman truly created a benefits package that was about the total person not just the professional.-Employee engagement: Excellent programs to get involved with co-workers and communities outside the office.
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance: provided little flexibility/mobility with the option to work from home. Often had to work on time off and on family vacations. Extremely hard to completely disconnect for even a day.Review process seemed trivial as I learned that promotion decisions were made before the 360 reviews were complete. It seemed to be more political than based on merit or meeting goals that were set for the year (can be true for a lot of companies, but still disheartening).
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – No advice needed to be honest. Upper management has been fantastic and very focused on employees

review.title: “Supportive managers who want to see you succeed”

review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to hire managers who are dedicated to teaching junior level employees and work on making onboarding a bit more seamless.

review.title: “Overall a very positive experience so far.”
