review.cons: Cons – On-boarding process is disorganized and not comprehensiveIt's expected that you will be available on the weekends or during vacation
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Top-Tier Leaders with a Revolutionary Vision and Opportunities for Employees to Grow”
review.pros: Pros – Forward-thinking company that is a step (or more) ahead of everyone else when it comes to anticipating the future, due largely to senior leadershipOpportunities for career growthEmployee satisfaction is a major priority
review.cons: Cons – Within specific practices/offices, senior team members can be lazy (work from home or come in late and/or leave early) while junior team members do a disproportionate amount of the heavy liftingWhen turnover occurs, replacement hires are rarely adequate compared to former employees - it seems as if some hires have been made primarily so that current employees can collect a referral bonusNo matter how often it is preached, office politics (between other practices or offices, or even within the same team) is a frequent issue
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ensure that everybody, not just junior team members, does their fair shareWhile replacement hires will by nature have different strengths and weaknesses than their predecessors, make sure they fill the voids the team needs them to fillCrack down on all aspects office politics by refusing to reward it and disciplining those who engage in it at the expense of others

review.title: “Hard work gets rewarded amidst a true entrepreneurial mindset”

review.title: “Engine for growth and leadership in the PR Industry”

review.cons: Cons – This is not a 9-5 job, but if you want to learn you put in the time. And everyone here does.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Reward the staff more. For this being the powerhouse agency that it is, morale is certainly not as happy as it should be.

review.title: “A smart, creative firm that has taken its heritage in PR to set the industry standard for social and digital”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people - a firm is nothing without themKnowledge expertsDedicated creative, analytics, build, search and planning resourcesClient rosterIndustry credibilityPersonality - each office is of course different but the culture in the SF office really is brilliantPrivately owned - the business advantages are huge
review.cons: Cons – It's a large firm so isn't for everyone - takes some time adjusting if you're not used to it
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – PR & digital could be better integrated on some accounts

review.title: “Challenging, fun, thriving environment”
review.pros: Pros – Great account managers, savvy and strategic planners, top-notch tacticians, courageous leaders. Fun people. Aggressive growth and rewarding experiences. The perks are also pretty awesome - great parties, free soda and coffee, constant surprise goodies and a killer office space/location.
review.cons: Cons – As with typical agency life, the hours can be long, the stress can be high.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep challenging your team, and maintain work life balance. Lead by example.

review.title: “Tons of experience to be had, tons of work to be done”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman will give you, by far, one of the best professional experience in the business. They'll also work you as such. If you're up for the challenge, go for it. But do know that this is not a 9-5 job. There's also a big push for giving people opportunities if you, a) prove you're worth the investment and b) ask for it. Whether it's moving groups or offices, the longer you stay with the company, the more you'll get back.
review.cons: Cons – Very low pay compared to the amount of work you do. Also, your experience is very much tied to who your manager is. If your manager sticks up for you and acts as an advocate, you'll go far. If not, you may be overlooked -- simply because everyone is too busy to notice.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your employees more. Especially with junior staff, one of the reasons they leave at such a high rate is because they feel underpaid.

review.title: “Best Place I've worked at since graduating college”
review.pros: Pros – Tons of people that are: smart, engaging, thoughtful, and hard working. You can literally carve a path for yourself doing what you want to do and you are set up for success.
review.cons: Cons – There is a lot of senior managers and personalites that are so vastly different, it is sometimes difficult to navigate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat each employee as the same, and try to be as encouraging as you can be. It could go a long way, and would probably be returned 10 fold by your employee.

review.title: “Smart People, Entrepreneurial Environment, Focus on Outstanding Strategic Thinking"”

Edelman's IP offering is a huge enhancement, helping all associates connect as part of a larger global conversation and offering something truly unique and valuable to clients and other stakeholders.
review.cons: Cons – It's a very, very political place. The path to promotion is unclear and byzantine. And senior management is sometimes slow to correct or remove under-performing group heads and other leaders. It doesn't necessarily impact work on a day-to-day basis, but this swirl can begin to feel frustrating, and become a significant time suck.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay very close attention to your practice group heads - especially in the shadow P&Ls. review.pros: Pros – Management and staff absolutely focus on clients and their goals.Walking the floors, each practice is always abuzz with some new idea or project in motion. Management does foster teamwork, leadership, and meeting goals.
review.cons: Cons – High turnover lately in IT staff, and high unexplained turnover in IT management, which in turn has created more staff turnover. Projects have slowed or stalled as a result. Luckily, this has not yet affected clients.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management does a great job of communicating down through the PR practices. How about communicating down through the IT teams?

review.title: “Leading the way in PR”
review.pros: Pros – Great collection of talent in both senior ranks and junior ranks.No ideas are bad ideas; very open environment to speak your mind and let your voice be heard.If egos are present, they are not out in the open; people work together to get the job done as a team.The company consistently attracts, retains and wins big name clients.
review.cons: Cons – The hours can be long at times, especially for the compensation.Sometimes things can feel a bit corporate, as people get tied to their desks and their personal work.Creativity and improvisation are always welcome for discussion, but are often not actualized due to strict adherence to previously client-approved plans.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to be open and honest about the direction of the company.Place more attention towards Edelman's personal brand: more dollars towards company website, corporate innovation and building a creative, dynamic company culture.

review.title: “Overall good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Overall smart peopleWork life balance is manageable, considering the industryRoom for growthGenerally recognized for hard work
review.cons: Cons – Work/life balance can be tough at timesSome turnover as of late
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It would be great to have even more international opportunities for staff

review.title: “Work Hard, Play Hard”
review.pros: Pros – Unbelievably bright co-workers, interesting client work, and true entrepreneurial spirit. If you're willing to work hard, Edelman will work with you. But you gotta work HARD.
review.cons: Cons – Office politics abound, and once you're typecast it's really difficult to get beyond that. Salaries are ok, but not great.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay to retain talent upfront, not when they threaten to leave.

review.title: “Excellent place to learn from the best and grow in your career!”
review.pros: Pros – Many great things about Edelman: working with the best in the industry, mentorship programs, tuition reimbursement, company culture that consists of 2 company outings a year as well as monthly happy hours, and much more!
review.cons: Cons – Not necessarily a con, but this is a fast paced work environment! Be ready to be incredibly organized and an Outlook calendar pro!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Simple feedback goes a long way - continue to share with your direct reports so we can continually improve!

review.title: “Great place to work and gain experience”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits, friendly coworkers, room to grow, creative workplace, ability to work remotely
review.cons: Cons – Long hours which makes work/life balance difficult to maintain
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Amazing people, amazing opportunities at large firm”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is great because it has a large global network, is family owned, is an independent company, full of friendly people, and there are many opportunities to network and meet new people.
review.cons: Cons – There are obvious cons that are common across all agencies, such as work-life balance and lower compensation.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman provides an intellectually challenging, fast-paced and friendly environment where you can have a strong career.”
review.pros: Pros – -Enthusiastic, supportive coworkers-Opportunity to work on accounts that cut across numerous practices-Opportunity to meet people from other practices through EdelU educational courses and extracurricular activities, such as softball or happy hours-Interesting, engaging work and opportunity to build strong client relationships over years
review.cons: Cons – -Low salary for first few levels of employment-Hours can be sporadic (i.e. super busy one week and laid back the next)-International opportunities are primarily for high level employees
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Great Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – Exciting, well-respected and ahead of the industry. Working here gets you noticed - great place to learn and grow.
review.cons: Cons – Everyone brings their "A" game -- every day! You need to be on your toes, always.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Best place to build a career in PR”
review.pros: Pros – Hands down the best place to build a career in PR; ability to work on major global brands; access to the best proprietary resources and research; relatively competitive salaries and benefits; ability to work from and experience various offices within the network; culture is great in most offices
review.cons: Cons – Edelman's a huge firm, so you can easily feel overwhelmed - there's a lot of PR you need to do for yourself to get noticed, but managers for the most part are your advocates; account teams are very large and you may only have one or two, so it's easy to paint yourself into a corner
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure junior staff are able to interact with senior leads on a fairly regular basis; ensure salaries are competitive for the regions we live in

review.title: “A community of brilliant individuals who genuinely like working with one another”
review.pros: Pros – Like any workplace, Edelman Digital is all about the people. Luckily, the work force consists of some of the brightest and most driven people in the industry-- without any of the competitiveness or petty infighting of other agencies. With an open floor plan, horizontal account structure, and a cheerful, collaborative culture, it's a fun place to work where talent and hard work are recognized and rewarded. More attention is paid to creative thinking than job titles, and great work comes out of the tight-knit teams. The Digital crew may work hard, but they also play hard and have a lot of fun together both in and out of the office.
review.cons: Cons – As with any agency, work/life balance can definitely get to be an issue-- but supervisors go out of their way to provide comp days, bonuses even at a junior level, and positive recognition when you're working long hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing!

review.title: “I never want to work anywhere else.”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing company culture, working with the best minds in the industry, true sense of teamwork, ability to get involved in multiple meaningful projects, pride in the work
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes not enough accountability from senior leaders; some can be overworked and cranky
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Some senior managers get so caught up in the fast-paced nature of the business that they forget to recognize the work of those who helped them get there.

review.title: “Rewarding Firm with an Excellent Network of PR Pros”
review.pros: Pros – The management and HR team dedicates time and resources to ensure a smooth transition from previous employment. Its company objectives foster an educational culture and assists employees in producing reward-winning results for clients.
review.cons: Cons – Work can become demanding and require more of your time than expected. Being a goal-oriented company, the end is always top-of-mind. With that said, be prepared to over service your client in order to produce the best possible results for all parties.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Allow the junior- to mid-level employees to get involved in seeking new business. It creates a sense of ownership for the employee.

review.title: “Edelman + PR = On the way to greatness but not there yet...”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, although often silo-ed, usually good opportunities for advancement, although it can move very slowly. Many people here have been here for years. Edelman is working to improve office life and communities through programs such as Living in Color and Global Citizenship.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance is difficult, people are just working all the time, and it is very difficult to get them away from their desks. We do have some fun though, but it take a while to get everyone amped up for an event, in or outside the office. There are some company policies or systems that are not totally effective either (GFS and Helpdesk).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There should be a policy for bio length and content. Fusion and Sharepoint should be maintained better with easy to find case studies, or information on who to contact in which office for each account, as well as general administrative needs.

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to advance your career and learn lots quickly, but be prepared to sacrifice your personal life.”
review.pros: Pros – Great learning environment, Room for growth, Large network
review.cons: Cons – Work-Life balance, payment at the junior level
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Lots of opportunity for people willing to work for it.”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients, really smart teams, and lots of room to be entrepreneurial and creative. Definitely not a place for someone who just wants to punch a clock.
review.cons: Cons – Can be political and catty with occasional favoritism rearing it's head; hours can be long
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman + PR = On the way to greatness but not there yet...”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, although often silo-ed, usually good opportunities for advancement, although it can move very slowly. Many people here have been here for years. Edelman is working to improve office life and communities through programs such as Living in Color and Global Citizenship.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance is difficult, people are just working all the time, and it is very difficult to get them away from their desks. We do have some fun though, but it take a while to get everyone amped up for an event, in or outside the office. There are some company policies or systems that are not totally effective either (GFS and Helpdesk).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There should be a policy for bio length and content. Fusion and Sharepoint should be maintained better with easy to find case studies, or information on who to contact in which office for each account, as well as general administrative needs.

review.title: “Edelman is a solid place to work”
review.pros: Pros – A lot of investment in the businessFocus is on primarily client service and quality work, not the bottom lineHigh quality people
review.cons: Cons – Can be political at times
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work

review.title: “Compensation much too low; poor work/life balance”
review.pros: Pros – Good teamLooks great on a resumePrepares you for any other Pr firmBeautiful roof deck
review.cons: Cons – Very long hours resulting in poor work/life balancePay is horrendous for the hours-complete exploitationExpected to dedicate life to job to get aheadPay raises are small/promotions are difficult to obtain
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – A little less micromanaging would be better

review.title: “The company is a great company to work with”
review.pros: Pros – Love the focus of the work - public relations.
review.cons: Cons – The managers really didn't know how to handle new employees and, some of them didn't even know what the old employee did and could not or would not take the time to show the new employee what was need.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A great place to start your PR career”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has an amazing training program and access to some of the best resources. Everyone who works at Edelman is very driven, intelligent and hungry with ambition. This is a great company to start your PR career. You will have the opportunity to work on some really top-tier clients. Edelman is also a great company to put on your resume as they are one of the top PR agencies in the world.
review.cons: Cons – There is a lot of politics and red tape at Edelman. Promotions and requests to change teams/offices (a benefit they push) can take a long time and requires a lot of work from the employee. You can often get lost in the shuffle. Employees that have been there for several years are often overlooked for promotions and pushed aside. Many people have had to threaten to leave to get the promotions they deserve. The pay is not good and the hours are very long.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't get so caught up in meeting corporate numbers, reviews, hours, etc. that you forget to reward the people who are working in the trenches. A small token of appreciation and recognition goes a long way!

review.title: “Excellent internship program. Great way to get your foot in the door.”
review.pros: Pros – The brand recognition of Edelman alone is worth your time, but fortunately the internship program is very strong. Hard work is noticed and rewarded. The culture is collaborative and very enjoyable. Great internship program.
review.cons: Cons – You have to work hard to prove yourself, which is fair. Unless you've graduated, the internship is unpaid, which is a huge downside. Worth it in the end though.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay your interns, all of them.

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – There is room for upward mobility
review.cons: Cons – Edelman needs more management bootcamp

review.title: “It's been a great place to start my career”
review.pros: Pros – -great people with lots of talent-good office dynamic-great clients to work on
review.cons: Cons – -limited opportunity for advancement-limited salary increases
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -you need to pay and promote employees to retain them

review.title: “It is a good place to work--stable”
review.pros: Pros – Stable--people are outgoing and generally hard-working
review.cons: Cons – Could gain from more exposure to more projects
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be inclusive and allow staff to have growth opportunities

review.title: “Edelman was busy, but an awesome culture and great people made it all worth it.”
review.pros: Pros – Imagine a work environment where you're recognized for your hard work and overtime, praised for taking initiative and speaking your mind, and encouraged to balance your life and work as best you can - that's Edelman. My management was excellent, co-workers were cool, and I learned more about business at Edelman than any of my previous positions. It was non-stop busy in my department, but the days flew by! If you're offered a position at this company, I highly recommend taking the job.
review.cons: Cons – The department and position I worked in was very busy and often felt under staffed. Some days I left with my head throbbing but, of course, most jobs are like that once in a while.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management style at Edelman Chicago is great. It was obvious in my department that management communicated regularly and rarely let pressing staff issues fester. Well done! One suggestion might be a bit more diversity, especially at the top, but I think that goes for most organizations.

review.title: “Lots of work but will learn a lot.”
review.pros: Pros – -Variety of projects you get to work on so you do get experience on real consumer facing work-Medical & Dental benefits are great-Perks like free fruit daily & "social" gatherings every month-People can be reserved or in a clique but once you get to know them they are not so bad
review.cons: Cons – -Communication is horrible when working on projects in between cross-functional teams-Management seems to have no concern for a project that has a very tight deadline and you are told to deal with it.-You are invited to a meeting and not given a reason why you are there and then asked to do x,y.z
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please train project managers and strategy people to provide better defined project goals.

review.title: “Great people, great company, great experience.”
review.pros: Pros – Get to work on awesome, high profile national clients and get hands on experience working with other Edelman offices.
review.cons: Cons – It's really difficult to get an interview here! They do all the hiring out of Chicago, so the local office has no pull for any hiring.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great work ;)

review.title: “I've become a smarter person just working here, but I'm also just so exhausted!”
review.pros: Pros – -We stay ahead of the curve in digital, always seem to be a step ahead of our competitors-Growth is important overall-Work with a variety of clients and opportunities to move laterally if pushed-Allow involvement in other
review.cons: Cons – -Work/life balance is difficult to achieve at best-Taking vacation is possible, but you definitely pay for it by working crazy hours before and afterwards
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Working 50 hours a week shouldn't be the rule, it should be the exception. Keep that in mind if you want to reduce turnover.

review.title: “Edelman continues to support me in my journey to find career opportunities that excite and motivate me.”
review.pros: Pros – -Collaborative work environment-Senior management provides opportunities to learn, even if it means failing once and a while-Access to Senior managament and Senior Strategists for counsel-Opportunities are given to the most qualified, regardless of job title-Managers are invested in the growth and progressions of their direct reports
review.cons: Cons – -Resource sharing among offices-Growing pains as the company continues to expand
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue open lines of communcation with junior employees to help share context around company decisions and priorities.

review.title: “Working for Edelman has allowed me to strengthen my professional skills while advancing my career.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a name recognized globally. Working here provides the opportunity to work on great accounts and strengthen your skills. Edelman frequently provides educational trainings to their employees.
review.cons: Cons – I don't always feel employees are rewarded appropriately for their hard work in a timely manner. i.e. salary compensation, title changes.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I believe the senior-level management could be more transparent at time regarding new business opportunities by providing detailed reasons for why the company did not win a certain account. This way we can better ourselves as a whole and be more prepared next time.

review.title: “Great experiences, no life”
review.pros: Pros – At Edelman you have the opportunity to work with some of the greatest brands and companies in the world. Great experiences and management lets you dictate your own career path. Promotions are consistent as well as raises.
review.cons: Cons – There is a price to pay for all the great experiences you'll receive. You are tied to your desk and/or phone 24/7. No work/life balance at all.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't take junior staff for granted. There is definitely a 'burnout' cycle because of the tough hours and demands of senior managers.

review.title: “good”
review.pros: Pros – company receives a lot of industry recognitiongreat resources
review.cons: Cons – work/life balancehard workers need to be recognized more via promotions, awards, etc...big client teams always receive the praise, leaving little room for other teams

review.title: “Edelman is a great company with vision, and resources to help you grow professionally, if you take advantage of them.”
review.pros: Pros – - reputation - experience with the best in the business - global resources and opportunities - work on big name accounts
review.cons: Cons – - very big, can get lost as a "number"- big divide between VP level intel and junior staff- a lot of bureaucracy
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “I've been lucky to have very good bosses”
review.pros: Pros – A dynamic place to work; lots of smart and ambitions people; casual dress code; good benefits; flexibility to balance life and work; convenient office location
review.cons: Cons – It can be very cliquey, certain managers play obvious favorites, etc. People make quick judgments here and if you don't fit in off the bat then it's nearly impossible to dig yourself out of that hole. The Chicago office's ability to retain diverse staff is appalling (and I define "diverse" very loosely to mean anyone with a background other than a white sorority girl or a gay man).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please put some more thought into how to staff people on international assignments -- either short-term projects or even relocation. There seems to be a lot of interest, but word on the street is that it's very ad hoc and personality-driven right now.

review.title: “Rewarding”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a place that nurtures its employees. Everyone is asked to come forward with their goals and managers are always open to helping employees acheive those goals. It's also a place of opportunity. Staff members are challenged to take on exciting projects. There's never a dull moment at Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman, while a place of opportunity and growth, can be a very busy environment. There's always a lot to juggle and a lot to learn, for staff at every level. But I also find that is what keeps Edelman employees engaged. Managers also do a great job at helping staff find their own work/life balance.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Exceptionally well-managed company with smart and competent employees”
review.pros: Pros – The senior level staff at Edelman works closely with their teams to ensure people are challenging themselves and reaching career goals, while at the same time pleasing the clients and meeting the goals of the company. Overall, Edelman is a place where you will certainly meet some of the smartest, most driven employees and have access to some of the most outstanding resources and tools in the industry.
review.cons: Cons – At times, it can be difficult to balance work with a personal life. Going far in this industry often means sacrificing many late nights and weekends. That being said, the payoff is extremely rewarding and acknowledged by senior-level staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to put employee satisfaction and morale as a priority. It shows! Overall this is a fantastic firm, and I wouldn't rather be anywhere else.

review.title: “A World Class Company”
review.pros: Pros – I have been here for six years and I will tell you this is a world class company with the best thinkers in the business, great/challenging client work, excellent management, a lot of freedom and a great collegial environment. It's like playing for the Yankees of PR.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes there are silos and rivalries pop up but they are short-lived. And increasingly they are fading.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “The best people and clients, but long hours”
review.pros: Pros – A-list clients who are willing to think big and spend big (as much as anyone will in this economic environment). Really smart, hard-working people and a collegial environment where people help each other out and work as a team. You can find industry-leading experts in almost any aspect of PR here and tap their expertise. This is a great place to learn PR from a big-agency perspective - account management, client services and a wide range of PR strategies and tactics. Management appreciates how hard we work and allows for a lot of latitude in when, where and how people work. They are open and willing to let people switch groups and accounts in order to expand their skill set, in my experience.
review.cons: Cons – The hours are long and the clients extremely demanding -- more than at the smaller agencies I've worked at. There is a certain amount of office politics at the senior levels and that can trickle down to the rest of the staff. Much of the media relations work is done by media specialists and on some accounts that means entry-level staff don't get much direct experience pitching reporters; candidates who are looking for media relations experience should ask specific questions about this when interviewing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more people so we can work fewer hours. Flexibility, dress code, etc. are really appreciated but the workload is what burns people out. I am also regularly seeing a trend where people who shove work off to others are praised (and promoted) for effective delegation and modeling work-life balance, whereas those who get stuck with the work are criticized for not managing their time effectively.

review.title: “It would be hard to find a better PR agency to work for.”
review.pros: Pros – The agency values innovation and is constantly introducing new tools for clients and employees to help ensure service delivered meets evolving communications needs.Senior professionals at Edelman are among the best in the industry.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman seems overly structured in the way it advances employees with a calendar approach to promotions and raises. A more fluid system of recognition might alleviate recurrant morale issues at review periods.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman is a top notch PR firm that values career growth, learning, and people.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman values corporate social responsibility - they preach it to clients but they also practice it. It's a great place to learn and you are surrounded by extremely talented colleagues who are collaborative, media savvy, and push you to be your best.
review.cons: Cons – The hours can be long and unpredictable.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We need the latest technology tools to do our job better.

review.title: “Overall, very positive experience: Edelman practices what it preaches (investing in employee resources and programs).”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is an independent company with strong executive leadership that makes smart investments in its people and resources. They promote from within and work to provide employees with tools to be successful.
review.cons: Cons – Despite an effort to encourage collaboration across offices and geographies, it still can be a challenge for offices to "share" opportunities.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “I love working at Edelman San Francisco”
review.pros: Pros – Very creative and inspiring co-workers, supportive management, excellent reputation
review.cons: Cons – Maybe a smaller agency might be better for some people, but not me.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Disappointed in the very low percentage raise offered at annual performance review

review.title: “Create your own adventure”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, highest quality thinking & ethical standards, supportive culture where you can grow and shape your career. If you're entrepreneurial, smart and passionate about PR, there's no reason to work at another agency. The sky's the limit here.
review.cons: Cons – Geographic and practice silos can present barriers to collaboration, although that's changing.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Demanding but rewarding”
review.pros: Pros – If you work hard, you are rewarded for it. Opportunities for growth are fairly provided and there is an environment that fosters the growth of those who go above and beyond. My managers are the best managers I have ever had in my professional life (though it is relatively short). They genuinely look out for my best interests and allow me to work autonomously. At the same time, they go out of their way to provide me with the help I need if I ask for it.
review.cons: Cons – Can be incredibly demanding and high stress. In an effort to manage the economic downturn, they rely on existing employees before hiring new candidates. While this is a good thing in that it means there are no layoffs, it can translate into overworking employees (i.e. asking one person to play the role of three). They expect a lot from junior staff ... but if you prove yourself, you are usually rewarded for it.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It's a great place to work where people love their jobs, but often times are overworked.”
review.pros: Pros – Health benefits, compensation, co-workers, office lifestyle, creative environment
review.cons: Cons – long hours, work/life balance, healthy lifestyle harder to manage
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Fun work, unique people”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people; interesting work that is always changing/never the same routine; good benefits; fun culture
review.cons: Cons – Difficult clients; multi-tasking different projects; constantly seeking new business
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman has been an excellent place to put my knowledge to use and grow as a practioner.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman puts a huge emphasis on helping employees stay engaged on client projects and opportunities to further your growth in your field. They offer excellent learning opportunities and put a big emphasis on learning about public relations/media/digital services and new services available to help you offer more to clients.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is pretty rigid in the way that they structure their promotions/entry-level opportunities. Even if you are really well received in your office- promotions and available jobs all depend on the client load that the office has.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman is an amazing place to work and I feel like I have every chance in the world to be successful.”
review.pros: Pros – Strategic leadership, family values, belief in a good work product and investment in the business (including employees)
review.cons: Cons – Some practice and specialty overlap contributes to internal competition or confusion.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please keep doing what you are doing!

review.title: “Motivating, inspiring”
review.pros: Pros – Working at Edelman has been an unparalleled learning and work experience. Peers and senior leadership alike are knowledgeable, motivating and still all-around fun people to be around. Tasks have been meaningful, and I have found that the "work hard, play hard" idea really is in place here.
review.cons: Cons – Occasionally, workloads can be daunting, but Edelman is very adamant about work-life balance.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great environment, fun co-workers”
review.pros: Pros – - Young office (early twenties to mid thirties)- Fun environment- Good work/life balance- Lots of resources
review.cons: Cons – - Lower salary range- No carpool options for commuters
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Excellent”
review.pros: Pros – Fantastic team, smart people and an environment that fosters growth!
review.cons: Cons – There are senior level politics and competition that makes it hard to navigate.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “THIS is what i always wanted to do”
review.pros: Pros – While the environment is very relaxed, everyone works very hard and cares about the work we do
review.cons: Cons – There can be long hours and big demands by clients
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You are doing a great job :)

review.title: “Great place to work- smart people, innovative work and a beautiful office.”
review.pros: Pros – - smart people that are fun to work with- beautiful office- strong compensation and a good benefits package- opportunity for growth- interesting work that keeps me challenged!- flexible work environment, very accommodating and supportive of a work/life balance
review.cons: Cons – - very big office, can be tough to navigate when you first join, but everyone is friendly and willing to help out.- very fast paced- can sometimes feel like there are not enough hours in the day, but i think that's the case anywhere!
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “The best people and clients in the industry.”
review.pros: Pros – All the diversity of experience & support of a large global company with the metabolism and hunger of a startup.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance can be challenging in an environment where you are surrounded by highly driven colleagues and large clients.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Never-ending Awesomeness”
review.pros: Pros – There is an amazing collaboration of ideas with departments and practices between all the many offices worldwide. I have worked in corporate for the past four years and have seen many improvements; communication, continuing education and transparency - each person I have met throughout the years has enriched the experience and made Edelman far outshine other companies. The compensation and employee benefits and ‘perks’ are fantastic.
review.cons: Cons – The hours are tough but the rewards are worth it! Concentration is easily broken with the immediate access everyone has to your office space.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You're doing an amazing job and in my opinion the Chicago office has never seemed more content and happy - Thank You so much!

review.title: “So far so good!”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman Digital is a very innovative and focused group of people. Everyone is very determined to do a great job with everything they do and are very collaborative and appreciative of each other.
review.cons: Cons – As a new person it's a little difficult to connect because everyone is already so tight knit.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “The clients and managers demand excellence, and the work is rewarding.”
review.pros: Pros – Fortune 100 clients;Excellent opportunities for professional and personal growth;Chance to work alongside incredible talent in the industry;Nurturing office culture;Creative thinking is valued.
review.cons: Cons – Office politics abound;Workload is sometimes unstable (either too much or too little);Pace doesn't always allow for consistent feedback;Pay for entry-level is low, though not devastating.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – For junior level employees, place less emphasis on billability, and more on quality of work. Be more transparent in practices.

review.title: “A very collaborative, motivating experience working with some of the best brands in the U.S.”
review.pros: Pros – My colleagues are all wonderfully supportive and encouraging, and I always feel like I'm part of a larger team. Edelman also has numerous resources, which allows me to do my job to the best of my abillity while also offering my clients superior service.
review.cons: Cons – In short, I am not paid enough.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Most everyone I work with is incredible; however, there are a few people who are very flaky or seem to take advantage of the junior staff's willingness to work hard on "mundane" tasks.

review.title: “Working at Edelman has been rewarding and challenging - mainly because of the high caliber of employees and clients.”
review.pros: Pros – Very smart and driven coworkers, high-profile clients, opportunity for growth, outstanding senior managament, good continuing ed opportunities, efficient and nice offices, good benefits.
review.cons: Cons – I wish there were more communication about the capabilities and resources of Edelman's various groups and cities.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More presentations (lunchtime seems to work well) where the various groups can show off their top projects and capabilites to the other groups with whom they don't often work.

review.title: “A great learning experience, surrounded by smart people.”
review.pros: Pros – Employs intelligent people who produce quality work, a leader in the PR industry, provides career flexibility, and offers a comfortable and challenging work environment.
review.cons: Cons – Workload can at times be overwhelming, but if you speak up- colleagues are always there to help.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman fosters a collaborative, creative environment that makes coming to work fun.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has some very smart, very creative people that are experts in their particular field. This expands beyond just the Washington DC office. It is great to be able to interact with others who are subject matter experts and learn from their experiences while honing your own personal expertise.
review.cons: Cons – It can be tough connecting with other Edelman employees from different offices or practices. More could be done to increase exposure of other groups and practices.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to find ways to allow more junior staffers participate in Edelman's global outbound conversation. Our teams are content producers it would be great to highlight what they do outside of the office more, particularly in their related subject matter expertises.

review.title: “Empowering.”
review.pros: Pros – Unmatched room for growth and the company stays abreast of the current and future trends in the industry. Edelman truly wants its employees to be the best in the business.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours are required and expected. This is not just Edelman, however, but that of all PR agencies.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “I'm a new hire - still learning the ropes!”
review.pros: Pros – There a great vibe of collaboration that I find refreshing. Bringing in views from various teams/departments is a nice way to recognize other's input and to share knowledge.
review.cons: Cons – The office space can be difficult to work in - while its nice to have many colleagues in one area, it can be hard to work with many phone calls and conversations going on around you. Ear plugs help, but can only do so much
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Creative, fun and can make what you want out of your career.”
review.pros: Pros – The company promotes self discovery and following your individual interests and talents. Collaboration is key to succeeding at Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – Some leaders are very conflict averse and rely on a silly "red light" HR system to fix bad behavior rather than addressing it head-on. This can make things tricky to navigate and manage for mid-level supervisors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Address bad behavior head-on, just like you do good behavior.

review.title: “I've learned a lot of the basics, from some of the best in the business.”
review.pros: Pros – Great BenefitsHigh ExpertiseGreat LeadershipHigh-profile clientsSalary is very competitive
review.cons: Cons – Impersonal attentionLosing some business to "boutique" agencies
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate more often, and more directly, with employees

review.title: “I have found Edelman and Edelman Digital to provide tremendously rewarding experiences in a great environment.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity to constantly evolve and take skills to new opportunities. I have felt the support to stretch myself.
review.cons: Cons – It's a PR agency and you need to fasten your seatbelt for an exciting but exhausting ride.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Great place to learn from smart people, innovative clients”
review.pros: Pros – Challenging, interesting, opportunities for growth, top-notch staff, big agency with a small agency feel, family-owned
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, can be stressful
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work

review.title: “Enjoyable”
review.pros: Pros – Creative environment with fun perks and a lot of room to grow
review.cons: Cons – Advancement can take longer than it should.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “great opportunity, tough environment”
review.pros: Pros – high prestige, excellent experience, vast exposure
review.cons: Cons – mixed messages from senior leadership

review.title: “My time at Edelman Digital was definitely tumultuous.”
review.pros: Pros – They have an excellent online academy / education center. Anything you want or need to know about Public Relations or Digital practices is available in easy to digest formats.Senior Leadership is very competent and has very good intentionsNew Office facilities, stocked kitchens and weekly catered snacksBenefits and Compensation are competitive
review.cons: Cons – Very immature workforceWork live balance is preached but is not really appreciated as part of the cultureInternal service teams are viewed as providers as opposed to partners and part of same team (i.e HR,Finance, Production)Employee Turnover is high at all levels of organization.(Specifically the West Coast Office)Favoritism is still an issue
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Improve your hiring tactics to increase probability of employee fit and hold employees accountable to clear, objective performance goals.

review.title: “Some good, some not so good.”
review.pros: Pros – Unparalleled intellectual property and industry insight, from Trust Barometer to Capital Staffers to other sector-specific research.Brainpower that is as strong as anywhere in the industry. Edelman people are smart and have good ideas.A fair number of passionate, good people who are colleagues as well as friends.Strong benefits package.Access to technology and resources like research and graphics/design.
review.cons: Cons – Internal politics, both between and within offices, that lead to people being kept in the dark, trying to control staff/accounts to protect money, or talking negatively about colleagues (including to their supervisees). There are people known throughout the office for being mean or difficult, but they get promoted?Favoritism for certain groups and individuals in promotions and office recognition. it creates a negative vibe that causes cliques and harms the friendly nature of the place.No pushback on nightmare clients. Some clients are verbally abusive, issue unrealistic demands, or generally treat Edelman people horribly. Yet senior management don't push back on the abuse, always say "yes" instead of managing expectations, and expect staff to just deal with it by working harder and ignoring how they are treated. There's a reason there are accounts no one wants to work on.Decreased emphasis on core, fundamental skills like writing and media pitching, but lots of talk about buzzword-y "public engagement." As the company has pushed its strategic approach, there seem to be fewer junior and supervisor level employees interested in becoming excellent writers, understanding how media works, or learning all fundamentals of the industry.Limited opportunities for overseas exchanges or work transfers (management thinks they are resolving with International Fellows, which moves 8 people per year in a company of 3,500).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Practice what we preach: Recommit to transparent and inclusive communication when it comes to promotions, multi-office work, and staffing. Stop letting people who create division or conflict to continue to serve as team leaders (and even be rewarded for their behavior) and invest in stronger management training. Double-down on leadership development for staff, so potential rising leaders have more opportunities. Better manage staffing so the same people aren't overworked all the time. Recapture some of the hard-working, modest personality that defined Edelman before it became the biggest.

review.title: “Fast-paced, interesting work.”
review.pros: Pros – Great work-life balance. Fun office environment. Great, talented people.
review.cons: Cons – The compensation is not great. Employee retention is not highly valued here, and it is tough to advance in this industry (Edelman included) without hopping from agency to agency.

review.title: “I don't work on the PR side. And because of that, this place is not the place to work.”
review.pros: Pros – Camaraderie amongst the team I work with. Some levels of understanding. I have flexibility in time off.
review.cons: Cons – There are just too many things to list. I'm just very frustrated here. But there is a lack of respect for what we do in our division. There's a high enough turnover rate. We have a severe lack of process which I hope changes. And there are just so many other issues.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I do not have the energy to discuss this.

review.title: “I love working for Edelman!”
review.pros: Pros – The people at Edelman get me out of bed every morning. Passionate, collaborative and incredibly intelligent. Management does a great job communicating our mission, values and plan for growth, and it's satisfying to see how my role plays a part
review.cons: Cons – Because people are so passionate, they also work very hard, so it's sometimes hard to maintain a work/life balance. But you can't be the best if you expect a 9-5er.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Every Experience is Unique to Your Team”
review.pros: Pros – -Great classes from Edelman's experts. Really sharpen my media relations and writing skills.-Nice random perks. Free Starbucks and Chik-Fil-a on occasion. The office also planned random fun activities as a stress release.-Mostly everyone had really positive friendly attitudes. Never sensed in hostility.
review.cons: Cons – There were days when I was up to my eyeballs in random "chores" while other interns were twidling their thumbs. My computer was incredible old and slow. I felt like pulling my hair when deadlines were speeding near. I basically worked on the same assignment everyday for hours. I was bored to tears (LITERALLY)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Maybe the internship should do a rotation of the different sectors within the office. I was so envious of the consumer and digital interns.

review.title: “Poor Management Accountability”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has an excellent reputation for the work they execute and the high caliber clients. They attract desirable accounts which provide great experience and depth for any PR professional looking to expand their background.
review.cons: Cons – The biggest problem with Edelman I believe boils down to their size. They are the biggest privately owned firm in the world, which in turn can make it difficult to ensure employees are being treated fairly and given the opportunities needed to grow at all levels. I have heard other groups have great team unity and leadership, however within certain groups in the corporate practice the lack of senior management oversight leads to extreme misconduct amongst mid-level management. Verbal abuse and poor communication of expectations lead to loss of good talent. If they cannot retain the smart employees at the account level, they will continue to have problems cultivating their practice areas.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs more accountability amongst the SVP and VP level in treatment of employees. They tout themselves as team orientated, yet in my numerous years of experience within several agencies I have never seen such a lack of team spirit. Every person within my group at the account levels expressed no desire to stay with the group in the next two years. The groups high turnover rate through people leaving the company or moving practices is evidence of the lack of both professionalism and leadership.

review.title: “Good place overall”
review.pros: Pros – Best PR agency among big agencies
review.cons: Cons – Too many aggressive people who are out for #1
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Needs a more diverse workforce

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – --High-profile client work--Internal resources and opportunities for growth--Fun and energetic work atmosphere
review.cons: Cons – --Low salaries for junior level staff--Work/life balance
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Amazing agency with tremendous opportunitites”
review.pros: Pros – Constantly tries to do right by it's employeesGrowth opps and ability to try new things -just ask!The teamOpeness of most senior leadership
review.cons: Cons – long hours and Blackberry tetherSometimes slow to make necessary changes
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be sure your most senior leadership demonstrate the true values of the company and are role models for the rest of the staff.

review.title: “Always evolving”
review.pros: Pros – Fun, and hip place to work. Chaning with trends of field and adapting well. There is never a dull moment.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, difficicult clients, hard to balance life and work and still perfrom at the high level that is expected
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Interesting, new, well organized”
review.pros: Pros – Great training environment, well respected. Well located. Clients relatively easy to come by. Smart staff.
review.cons: Cons – Stingy, competitive within offices between business units and between business units in other offices. Our own collateral material is lacking (even though we make it for our clients)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Allow leaders to flourish by giving them interesting work. Don't be stingy with raises - an extra $1,000 means the world to us!

review.title: “Great work-life balance, but less responsibility at lower levels compared to other firms”
review.pros: Pros – Management is very supportive of work-life balance. Client/project load is very reasonable.
review.cons: Cons – Recruitment could be more selective - often times they look to fill the slot as fast as possible. The account teams then pay a high price for team members who aren't a good fit. Additionally the expectations and corresponding responsibilities given to more junior level employees are far below those at competitive firms. Coming from another agency (making a lateral move) I felt like I'd gone back two years in time when I started at Edelman.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recruit more selectively and entrust more responsibilities to junior employees.

review.title: “Positive”
review.pros: Pros – Level of work deliveredQuality of clientsReputation for excellenceSmart people
review.cons: Cons – You may be expected to work long hours
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “I learned a lot, but had nowhere to advance and was overlooked for promotions despite the fact that I do a lot of work.”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits. Environment. Dress. Location and connections worldwide.
review.cons: Cons – Poor management. Incompetent management. Failure of management to train and enhance existing employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide more internal training and don't overlook the staff that you supposedly care so much about keeping through the economic crises. The "valued" employees.

review.title: “There are a variety of projects to work on, but they're very Social Media focused.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are Edelman Digital are the strongest factor in staying at this agency. The work can be fun, but there are also many projects that suck the life out of you. Same as any job, I suppose.
review.cons: Cons – With such a focus on social media, the projects can get pretty repetitive. "Make us a Facebook page!" "We need a new Facebook tab!" etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Try to offer employees some variety. Often times, we're put on one account and that becomes our day in and day out task. It gets repetitive and leads to burn out.

review.title: “Great! Inspirational!”
review.pros: Pros – Everyone enjoys the job. great group of people who are also very creative and knowledgable. I was motivated and inspired by them!
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes the hours were long, but I was invested enough in the work that it didn't bother me too much.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great work, but make sure that employees aren't overworked and tired! We're all motivated to do a great job, but sometimes we exhaust ourselves.

review.title: “Great place to grow”
review.pros: Pros – From junior to senior staff, Edelman gives all employees the tools to grow and become successful. Always keeping on top of trends and thinking ahead make it at the forefront of innovation in the industry. Many opportunities to work on notable brands and exciting business. Working with smart teams on notable clients is a huge plus.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, especially when you find yourself working via blackberry after work hours. That said, don't get paid enough. Office politics.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to not only talk about, but take more action to help employees improve work-life balance. More communication, especially among different teams.

review.title: “This is the best agency I have worked for.”
review.pros: Pros – The resources are plentiful and my colleagues truly want to help me succeed. People generally seem to be happy working there. Edelman seems to quickly pick up on current and future trends. It then has the ability to take this knowledge and implement new best practices on behalf of its clients. I generally feel I am ahead of the curve at Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – There are so many best practices to be learned within the global Edelman network. Yet, it sometimes is a challenge to find the informaion you need in order to take advantage.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please help the junior staff better understand what is necessary to rise up to the senior ranks and succeed over the long term.

review.title: “Overall satisfied”
review.pros: Pros – Great co-workersFun environmentGreat projects to work onGood health care benefits
review.cons: Cons – Long hoursLow payLittle professional recognitionOffice politicsDifficult group management/leadershipFavoritismPoor department managementPoor senior-level communication
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do not quickly judge people and hold grudges. People make mistakes and should not be judged for them always

review.title: “Great place to get experience as an intern or entry-level employee”
review.pros: Pros – Given a lot of responsibility as an intern if you prove yourself, interesting and smart people to work with, are promoting more work-life balance
review.cons: Cons – it is easy to get trapped into feeling like you have to get in early and stay late just to prove yourself
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Excellent agency focused on new ways of working”
review.pros: Pros – Great people / thinkers who constantly focus on new ways of working.
review.cons: Cons – Same cons as any other agency.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None

review.title: “Great learning experience”
review.pros: Pros – Very competitive, a great learning environment, I felt like I learned more here than I learned in the classroom--very hands on. Employees are very nice and willing to help you and give you new projects and opportunities.
review.cons: Cons – Since it's competitive I really wanted a challenge, and sometimes I would sit around with nothing to do after reaching out to people in the office. It took 3 months for HR to schedule my interview, she kept pushing it back and kept pushing my start day back, and almost forgot to tell me.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – HR needs better follow up skills.

review.title: “Paranoid environment”
review.pros: Pros – - Good industry to be in- Good worker bees (meaning nice people)
review.cons: Cons – - Paranoid and controling environment- Political environment- Control the message AND their people- Office is losing good people- Most senior folks are not business people and don't know social media
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Establish some values for the office and for how you conduct business and stick to them

review.title: “Very good. I adore my team and have a very strong partnership with my client.”
review.pros: Pros – World class clients, challenging assignments, bright and hard-working people.
review.cons: Cons – Politics. Ongoing staffing issues that lead to long hours.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Inefficient processes, incompetent senior management. Good place to start, bad place to stay and a lot of BS.”
review.pros: Pros – Not really a pro, but nobody there expects anyone to be accountable of anything, nobody ever gets fired for mistakesRoster of easily recognizable clientsOpportunities to travelGlobal company, some of the international projects are quite interestingInspiring owner/CEO
review.cons: Cons – No work-life balance,No feedback or mentorshipSenior management in the West Coast digital group is under-qualified or straight out incompetentSenior management functions based on old cliques, professionalism and competence are secondaryCreativity is not valued, pitched ideas are safe to mediocre
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recruiters need to look for competence and not just hire for the sake of filling positions

review.title: “Best of the agencies”
review.pros: Pros – There is a strong focus on development of intellectual property and progression of the industry, and much solid account work is done through the agency.
review.cons: Cons – It's a highly political environment and heavily driven by NY and Chicago, so opportunities for meaningful promotion elsewhere in the network are limited
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There is a need for much better recognition of the talents of staff in offices outside of NY and Chicago.

review.title: “Work hard, learn a lot”
review.pros: Pros – incredible clients, very smart colleagues, management with great vision for future, no question Edelman is the best of the best
review.cons: Cons – work lfe balance is a struggle, politics
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Review work life balance on your team for more productive staff. Burn out is inevitable.

review.title: “Seattle office very political”
review.pros: Pros – PR boot camp for lower-level account workers. Great training and opportunities to work on top-notch brands and a variety of clients. Good number of days off.
review.cons: Cons – Seattle office was very political, with promotions often going to the average popular people, not really on merit. Some of the senior leadership were walking HR violations. When I was there, it was a revolving door - lots of turnover. People got sick of not being recognized and left for greener pastures.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get your head out of high school and respect everyone on the team.

review.title: “AE”
review.pros: Pros – The company has a good reputation.
review.cons: Cons – I feel I am underpaid.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show your employees they are valued by investing in their future with the company rather than hiring people you don't yet know. (spend your money on rewarding current employers before you spend it on hiring new people)

review.title: “Edelman overall is ok to work for.”
review.pros: Pros – The ingenuity and creativity of the staff is really impressive. We are always on the cutting edge and it’s exciting to see the programs we are able to set up for clients. Also, lack of diversity is pretty apparent.
review.cons: Cons – Managers tend to have favorites and compensation is questionable in regards to what I hear others are making at same levels elsewhere.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be sure communication is clear and open with your team. Be sure to keep open mind when considering who should be pulled in on projects, even if the person is not a friend or “favorite”.

review.title: “Fairly new, but very happy”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a reputation of attracting the "best of the best" to work in an environment that is fast-paced, challenging, forward-thinking and engaging. Guess what? The reality lives up to the reputation. I am consistently impressed with the intelligence, competence, forward-thinking management and ideas my colleagues come up with. Senior management is approachable and open to ideas from employees at all levels - a welcome change from some other agency environments - and nearly everyone has a thirst for "more:" learning, living, doing. If you want to learn, to be challenged and see some great things brought to life, Edelman is an ideal place to call home.
review.cons: Cons – At 500-600 employees, Edelman is one of the larger agencies in Chicago. It spans four floors in the AON center and, truthfully, that kind of change can be a little daunting. That said, management recognizes this and is working to provide smaller group orientations and practice meetings to help orient new hires. Additionally, employees work hard and long hours. Vacation isn't frowned upon, but can be difficult to schedule and take.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I've found Edelman's senior management to be incredibly intelligent, engaging and approachable. They want to see their teams succeed and, thus, are willing to invest time in their employees (at all levels). I'm thrilled to be contributing to the resulting work and learning from these individuals.

review.title: “Smart people, great innovation, fun work, but poor balance”
review.pros: Pros – - Really interesting clients and projects- Smart, extremely talented people- Firm has a great reputation in the industry- Good continuing education/training program- Senior management is, for the most part, top notch
review.cons: Cons – - Compensation is often low compared to agency competitors (benefits are good, though)- Continuous struggle with work/life balance (easy to get burnt out)- Some favoritism shown- Some leaders within offices are too focused on bringing in $ and don't pay enough attention to employee growth
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Retaining that employee who is overworked and frustrated is more important than winning another new business pitch.- Make sure employees get that work/life balance they deserve.- Reward your people for great work, and strive to keep salaries in line with (or above) our competitors.

review.title: “Review”
review.pros: Pros – I love the entrpreneurial spirit that is pervasive at Edelman. I feel that my managers are among the best in the business, and the talent of the junior staff is unparalleled in the industry. The projects are innovative, and the clients look to us for more than execution.
review.cons: Cons – High expectations lead to high quality work, but sometimes requests and expectations can be unrealistic, especially on a tight turnaround.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The leadership is outstanding. I am confident that the best and the brightest are leading teams here. I greatly appreciate that many of the senior managers have non-agency experience or have worked on the client side as it adds new perspective and ensures our work is always top notch!

review.title: “Benefits of independence”
review.pros: Pros – Independence. Entrepreneurial spirit. Public engagement. Taking the lead in creating the future of communications. These are a few of the many best reasons to work at Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – With independent and entrepreneurial approaches, a day at the office will challenge your time management and energy levels -- never a dull moment!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's great that our organization has many bright stars who earn recognition in and out of the office. It's just as important to reward the more reserved, under-the-radar "worker bees" who contribute to Edelman's success every day in many different ways.

review.title: “Great People Make All the Difference”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman DC is a great place to work because of the people who work there. The team comprises smart, hard working, ambitious (but not cut-throat competitive) people who are also fun, funny and kind. Taken collectively, they create a culture that rewards both professional excellence and personal investment. As with any job, the workload varies from challenging to dull and at times there is more work-life balance than others. But, when you are working with people who you truly believe are good people, who want the best for the client and for their team members, you want to put forth extra effort. I think our clients see this in our work too, which is why we have excelled in this market, particularly in recent years.
review.cons: Cons – While generally, I feel the office is well-managed, there is not always transparency, particularly on compensation issues.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to foster a culture of transparency – be more candid with employees about their performance relative to their peer set and how that impacts compensation. Continue to hold office-wide meetings and to leverage group heads to communicate with employees about strategic decisions and their impact on the office and employees. Also, I hope as the office continues to grow, you work to retain the personal feel and intimacy that makes it such a great place to work. I worry, even now, that we are losing that.

review.title: “A place that encourages”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman's many industry awards and significant growth over the last 5 years are well-deserved. The management team is constantly reevaluating the company's strategy and competitive position. The company rewards innovative thinking and permits employees to take risks and try new things.Edelman's size and prominence attracts top-tier clients and employees often have the opportunity to work on interesting projects that get attention.
review.cons: Cons – Like all professional services firms, Edelman employees work fairly long hours and are expected to be available by PDA on nights and weekends.While we have big-name clients, there are plenty of projects that aren't particularly sexy. A single employee's experience will be largely shaped by his clients and team. It is possible to change divisions (e.g., Consumer, Technology, Corporate, etc.), but it doesn't happen often and the employee must go through an interview process much like an external candidate.Overall, Edelman offers rich opportunities, but an employee must actively pursue them.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -

review.title: “Happily in 'Big PR'”
review.pros: Pros – - Has a strong industry presence- Serves big brands- Good opportunities for upward movement- Enables you to work alongside some of the PR / social media industry's best experts
review.cons: Cons – - Large company, may not be quite as agile to react to industry change, compensation requests, etc. as a boutique firm
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please continue to share what's happening across the company. Being 3000 people strong, it's not always easy to see what it happening in all areas. I appreciate the company updates and emails that provide details on the company happenings.

review.title: “Love working at Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Entrepreneurial -- dream what you want and you can do itWork for best in class brands and companiesFamily culture
review.cons: Cons – PR is fast paced and client service focused with long hours if you want to do good jobLots of resources and important to navigate and understand to give the best client service
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep investing in the companyKeep open communicationsWatch showing the praise on only a few

review.title: “You get what you give.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman reminds me of the create your own adventure book series. If you can think it up and make the business case, you can often craft your ideal job. People are very smart and fun to work with and comp. is very good once you've eached mid-level.
review.cons: Cons – It's a demanding work environment but you get what you give.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Slow down and take on less so you can really do it all right. Keep the culture despite rapid growth.

review.title: “Great place to work, and a company that is continuously improving”
review.pros: Pros – --The company continues to innovate and grow--Edelman focuses on the staff and on making sure this is a company where people can have long and meaningful careers--You get a chance to work on some of the biggest clients and best projects
review.cons: Cons – As the company grows we continue to add capabilities in different divisions, which means multiple groups within Edelman can handle the same project (Ruth, MATTER, Consumer Marketing, etc). As a result you often find yourself competing against other Edelman teams or offices for chunks of a client's business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue investing in the young employees. Pay them better, give them more training, give them more ways to grow and learn and experience.

review.title: “Edelman Chicago”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, good clients, investing in technology to support teams, working to address negatives through integrated committees, independant company allows for re-investment vs. pay outs to investors
review.cons: Cons – Competitive P&L's, disconnect b/t Sr. management and rank/file, work/life balance is talked about - but difficult to acheive, salaries are not as competitive as other firms
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on growing and rewarding talent, continue to address negatives and not be afraid to allow mistakes, re-survey to ensure competitive salaries

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a great place to work. Very talented people work here. Their are numerous opportunities for exposure within the company. Edelman recognizes people's strengths and places them in positions to exceed. People who work here are best in class and have a great attitude.
review.cons: Cons – My only con about working here is that pay is not as great as comparable companies. They do standard one-year reviews and that is the only time, most often to receive a pay increase. Most people work way more than 40 hours a week and that is almost an expectation. Work/life balance is getting better and the company is doing a good job at voicing their support for time off and breaks as needed.
