review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great stuff at Edelman. My only recommendation is offering more competitive salaries and benefits packages. Premiums and deductibles are pretty high for insurance plans.

review.title: “I'm proud to be a part of Edelman's Team!”
review.pros: Pros – Great People, Great Benefits, Great Learning and Growing Experience, Great Relationships.
review.cons: Cons – It is very fast paced, which I like - but for some could be a downside! Honestly, I don't have much negative to say about Edelman
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Edelman has great overall leadership! We have some of the best thought leaders in the practice. It is important for team leaders to examine when teams are burnt out and handle accordingly.

review.title: “Good Place to Work”
review.pros: Pros – - A global network with rich resources- Emphasis on client service- Commitment from leadership to engage employees and recognize talent- A strong reputation among the industry- A solid education/enrichment program for staff
review.cons: Cons – - Work environment can be political and competitive- Lack of follow-through on internal initiatives makes it difficult to put trust in new programs
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Continue to invest employees and encourage staff to exlpore other opportunities within the company to avoid burn-out or lack of challenge

review.title: “I am just your average college student with expriencing the opportunity of a lifetime!”
review.pros: Pros – I LOVE IT HERE AT EDELMAN! This is most definitely not the average 9 to 5 because everyone is like family.
review.cons: Cons – I have not experienced any downsides of working here at Edelman. Everything has been perfect since day I started here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you are doing because I have experienced so much since I have been here. The managment taught me life lessons that can be applied to my everyday living.

review.title: “Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a good company culture filled with great people and servicing top-notch clients with public engagement needs. The company's visionary leadership is a positive motivating force and I'm proud to be an employee of Edelman.
review.cons: Cons – From my perspective, there honestly aren't very many downsides of working at Edelman. The company offers a variety of career paths and professional growth opportunities that employees can fully utilize.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I believe employee roundtable discussion with the various career levels is most important and from the few sessions I've sat in on, I feel they offer a great way to solicit positive and constructive feedback from employees, who can be comfortable speaking up in front of their peers.

review.title: “Edelman Digital aims to stays on top of the ever-evolving social media landscape.”
review.pros: Pros – The Digital Department is a fun, young department that works hard to execute innovative digital campaigns for every single client. Oftentimes these are more traditional consumer clients who are just figuring out what it means to develop a social media strategy. Edelman Digital prides itself in having the know-how to take the reins and help launch social media campaigns.
review.cons: Cons – The department is constantly evolving to keep up with new trends. There is a lot of growth and turnover.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better communication with mid-level and lower-level employees.

review.title: “Good place to learn.”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of energy here, and possibilities really are endless - you just have to make them for yourself.
review.cons: Cons – While strong people are recognized, sometimes promotions are based on time rather than on true performance.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Squeaky wheel gets the grease. Management needs to listen to all employees, not just those that make a fuss.

review.title: “Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is in its own category of excellence. The work and clients are top-notch, the senior management is supportive of work/life balance, and an entrepreneurial spirit is woven into the company's DNA. You can work at Edelman for a very long time, and completely reinvent yourself many time along the way. There are hundreds of niche experts in all areas throughout the company - you never have to wing it with clients, you can find an expert to weigh in. My co-workers are passionate about this company in a way that simply doesn't exist at publically held companies. Our U.S. workforce of 2,000 is a force to behold - and we usually win at what we set out to accomplish.
review.cons: Cons – Shrinking violets might take a bit longer to adjust to so many bold, confident co-workers.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great work.

review.title: “There's a reason Edelman is consistently named Best PR Agency”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a true leader and visonary and it's an honor to be a part of the award-winning, awe-inspiring work.
review.cons: Cons – No rest for the weary!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Kepp innovating, keep leading, keep pushing the envelope in Public ENGAGEMENT

review.title: “This is not a 9 to 5 job”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a family. Edelman is a place to grow your career and to learn from the best. Get ready to work hard.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is not a 9 to 5 job. I work in my car on the way to work and on my way home. That said, I love it all.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The management are strong and supportive.

review.title: “Entrepreneur with a safety net”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman Digital provides you the freedom to develop your career in a direction that you want to take it. I have never worked with a more talented group of people. Digital here is not an afterthought.
review.cons: Cons – This is not the place for you if you don't have a passion and dedication to your clients and projects.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Foster better synergy between the east and west coast teams.

review.title: “Great place to learn and grow.”
review.pros: Pros – Growth opportunities, mentorship, ability to work with the best and brightest - both internally and on the client side.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours from time to time --- but that is not specific to Edelman.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep listening to employee feedback at all levels.

review.title: “Edelman Digital - A great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – - The overall digital team is composed of great people from all backgrounds.
review.cons: Cons – - IT support for our growing Creative practice and needs for mac users are still lacking.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Keeping the junior staff motivated and excited to do the work is always important. Making sure compensation is accurate for all the good work that is being done should always be the focus.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – - Top brands/clients- Opportunity for advancement- Get to have a hand in groundbreaking work- Strong reputation within the industry
review.cons: Cons – - Need to improve work/life balance
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Work to lower the amount of turnover in the firm

review.title: “Edelman is everything they say they are and more”
review.pros: Pros – When you read the bios and mission statements of companies often times what they desire to be is not what is in the mirror. This isn't so at Edelman. What you see is not what you get; it is quite more. It's refreshing to be in a place that is so transparent.
review.cons: Cons – I haven't encountered any yet.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – As difficult as it must be, continue doing and being what you are as you strive to breed excellence in everything that is done and everyone that is involved.

review.title: “When you first start at Edelman...”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of energy, fun, exciting. Variety of tasks and employee moral building is all around each and every week.
review.cons: Cons – You have to be a self-starter and cheer for yourself initially. What are the working hours? Do you get overtime when you have to stay late or come in early to finish a task or project. What is my job description? What is my level? None of this was explained until after the 4 week meeting with my supervisor.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think there should be an initial meeting with other admins to help you learn the ropes, how to integrate yourself with the Edelman/Digital culture. Maybe there should be little "clubs" for each job type so you can start off strong. Everyone is not a self-starter or proactive and therefore without some guidance they might become disillusioned early in their career at Edelman. I took it as an adventure and journey to meet people and find and discover and learn the systems at Edelman. Everyone might not like it that way.

review.title: “not applicable”
review.pros: Pros – Great Benefits. The company does a lot for it's employees, snack cart, outings. It's a fun place to work.
review.cons: Cons – At times, not enough work/life balance. Sometimes we have so much work to do we are forced to stay late into to night.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be nice to your employees, they work hard all day and a simple Thank You from time to time is nice to hear from you. So us you appreciate us.

review.title: “Best of the best”
review.pros: Pros – One of the best and most forward-thinking agencies in the business
review.cons: Cons – Work can be stressful and crazy at times
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep innovating and looking for "what's next?"

review.title: “A great place for a career.”
review.pros: Pros – Industry leading global company. Very employee-friendly and supportive.
review.cons: Cons – Wish the detailed budget numbers were more available. It's hard to monitor and manage levels of expenditures without them.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the good work

review.title: “Highly reccommend Edelman as a great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Smart, talented people. Great compensation. Brand new, high-tech offices and equipment. Excellent resources and professional development opportunities. Great location, great benefits and great amenenties.
review.cons: Cons – Non yet - I have no complaints.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great work!

review.title: “Good company, great people”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is great place to work. Although it's a fairly large company, local offices, practices and project teams give the feeling of a small, collaborative work environment. Culturally, the company is interested in growth, entrepreneurial spirit and investment in the company and its people.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman's challenges are similar to other large organizations, including competitive compensation, work life balance issues and developing and retaining junior and mid-level staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep focus on the good work: reinvesting in the company and the people that make it work.

review.title: “Endless Opportunities”
review.pros: Pros – Transfer and new experience opportunities, lots of feedback, excellent training for managers
review.cons: Cons – sometimes compensation seems a little low for some markets
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be sure to do a compensation analysis in each city's market

review.title: “Senior Account Executive”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, great benefits, and good opportunities for advancement. There is always someone who is willing to listen to your idea - whether you're just starting your career or several years in.
review.cons: Cons – For a communications firm, Edelman has room to improve in the internal communications side of business - senior management decisions are often not fully explained to junior staff.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Improved internal communication would facilitate a happier work environment for the junior staff members, particularly when communicating difficult issues such as compensation and bonuses.

review.title: “Endless Opportunities”
review.pros: Pros – Transfer and new experience opportunities, lots of feedback, excellent training for managers
review.cons: Cons – sometimes compensation seems a little low for some markets
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be sure to do a compensation analysis in each city's market

review.title: “Edelman review”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients, respected company, opportunities for growth, smart leadership
review.cons: Cons – heavy workload, sometimes long hours
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue helping employees with work life balance

review.title: “High expectations and demands without giving mentoring & professional development back”
review.pros: Pros – Benefits are fair. Company well known in the field. Managers are totally available via phone, email, IM, BBM, etc. (not sure this is a pro).
review.cons: Cons – Management focused on bringing in new business & protecting their practice's bottom line. Leads to not sharing knowledge & resources with other practices in the same office; and keeping team members fully&over utiliized even if it means over-servicing (anything to keep the client happy in a recession).Also, many times teams are top heavy with SVPs and there aren't enough junior staffers to do the bulk of the work. So junior staffers end up doing a lot of work well below their level. There is a serious lack of opportunities for jr. level staff to take the lead or serve as point person on projects or accounts. And the lack of interns (except for the most profitable practices) means a lack of ways for jr. staff to develop supervisory skills. Plus, with not enough hours in the day, there isn't really time for the senior staff to mentor.Very political environment where the deemed "up and comers" are favored heavily for advancement. (You hear the same names again and again.)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Advice to junior level staffers riding out the recession:Be your own advocate. If possible, be on a winning new business team (sure way to earn brownie points). Keep your resume updated & and your confidence up.

review.title: “Edelman Rocks”
review.pros: Pros – - Competitive benefits/salary compensation - Fun atmostphere, great office perks - Smart and business-savvy PR professionals - Opportunity for professional career growth
review.cons: Cons – - Siloed among practice areas
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – n/a

review.title: “Unqualified leadership and bullying culture make Edelman a challenging place to work and make progress”
review.pros: Pros – junior people are very enthused and initially passionate, clients are varied, multinational name brands, client opportunities are varied and interesting
review.cons: Cons – boys club, glass ceiling, management's fear of change, internal competition between groups is seen as entrepreneurial but its simply competition; clients and employees suffer for it. very senior leaders are allowed to yell and threaten employees
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Find someone with an operations background to lead as COO. Break down P&Ls and instead focus on client profitability and employee utilization. Zero tolerance policy for verbal abuse. Corporate wide title and role consistency.

review.title: “Good things continue to happen - it's a great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Growth opportunities; leadership; rewards; network; team; clients
review.cons: Cons – Lifestyle; politics/egos; demanding; high expectations
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Great work trying to make changes, keep getting feedback and putting it into action

review.title: “Edelman is my home”
review.pros: Pros – Awesome environment for both personal growth as well as institutional growth. Teamwork is a given and continued education is encouraged. I love my job. Truly.
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes the A/C is ridiculously freezing in here! Although, that's not much of a complaint. We all love our jobs so much and are so dedicated to the brands we represent that our hours are intense. Love every second of it.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the awesome job. Never have I been a part of company with such strong corporate culture and such pride among its employees. It's inspiring... hourly!

review.title: “Great Name, Poor Mid and Lower Level Management”
review.pros: Pros – Looks great on resume. Provides amazing exposure to high profile clients (depending on assignment). If you play your cards right and are willing to put yourself out there, you can have access to some of the great thinkers in the PR industry today.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is definately a powerhouse PR firm, but the things that make it so great don't always permeate down to the mid and lower level management, making it hard to really learn and grow within the internship. Your experience is solely dependent on which account you are placed on and under which management. Embarrassing and uncomfortable lack of diversity, both in background and demographics. Very little feedback. NY office is not for the weak-minded--you have to be aggressive or you will be left out to dry.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide much better structure for feedback at all levels. Make an effort to invest in your employees and make sure that the mid and lower level managers are carrying the same values as you.

review.title: “Great agency that can do better integrating its resources”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to work and develop your PR skills. Invests behind its Thought Leadership, both dollars and mindshare, helping employees think beyond the traditional PR definition. Truly is what you make it - if there is something you want to do and can make the business case for it, doors are pretty wide open. Smart people, great clients, amazing work.
review.cons: Cons – Geographic, practice and specialty group silos can make putting together the best team and best resources for clients challenging. That is getting better, though.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep backing up your hype. If you say you're doing something, do it. If you put out intellectual property, make sure its known and understood so everyone in the firm can use it and bring it to their jobs.

review.title: “"fly by the seat of your pants" managemant style”
review.pros: Pros – experience good for your resume - but move on quickly
review.cons: Cons – No communication or direction regarding client project needs and time commitments
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – better compensation is a must to retain talent

review.title: “OKay Experience”
review.pros: Pros – - Great senior leaders to learn from- Ample classes- Great clients to work on- Mentor program- location
review.cons: Cons – - Senior leaders were rarely around, and interns couldn't learn more than one "side" of PR. Focused mainly on account management and my interest was with media.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To interact more with junior staffers and help them grow within the company. Morale was somewhat down and not good.

review.title: “it was an alright experience”
review.pros: Pros – lots to learn--learn by doinglooks great on resume
review.cons: Cons – incomplete traininglittle useful feedback from management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be clear with your expectations and evaluation of performance

review.title: “Wonderful Firm!”
review.pros: Pros – The people, the leadership team and human resources leadership in D.C., the fact that most of the leaders care about employees, listen to employees and make it a pleasure to come to work every day. There's also a good client service focus, as there should be. Quality work is done and demanded. People are held accountable for behaviors for the most part.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the leaders outside of the DC office are not always honest and collaborative. There is far too much politics and back-stabbing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Live the firm's values and treat people with respect, be honest about performance and growth opportunities. Pay attention to senior leaders in the DC office and broaden their responsibilities. They have a lot more to offer the firm. Stay privately owned. Payclose attention to talent you don't want to lose. The warning signs are there but you must pay attention and let them know they are important to the future of the firm.

review.title: “top firm”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has the best reputation among PR firms within the industry - and that shows when working there. Thought leadership, employee training and career development are all opportunities afforded by working for a privately held company that reinvests its profits.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman is a large company with the usual amount of bureacracy and company politics. It's a place where you need to know what you want and go after it agressively - no one holds your hand.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in your people as much as you invest in your clients. Make retention a priority. Work to make titles and salaries consistent across the company based on determined expectations in terms of experience.

review.title: “Smart people, great opportunities, spotty leadership”
review.pros: Pros – Agency is independent and invests heavily in innovationGreat client list and opportunities to work on interesting campaignsSmart peopleGreat officeGreat benefits
review.cons: Cons – Quality of work and atmosphere is very much dependent on the teamConsumer team is particularly tough - lot of turnoverLike all agencies, work hours can be brutal at timesManagement is spotty - some really strong, some really lacking
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I enjoyed working with this team and think there is a lot of potential for the future of the company. I would encourage management to look at the new business process more closely - seems very inefficient.

review.title: “Excellent Initial Experience at Edelman!”
review.pros: Pros – The Edelman team is open and willing to help learn about what I should do as well as any other questions I may have. I love the work environment because everyone seems to enjoy what they do. We work really hard, and play hard.
review.cons: Cons – Even as an intern I noticed a lack of organization in the upper management. For example, there was no one site to find all active clients and contracts so it took a long time to track things down.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I hope the lack of organization can be resolved. I believe working on the organization would lead to a more efficient work environment.

review.title: “VP”
review.pros: Pros – Competitive salary, excellent reputation in the industry, great location, casual dress environment, generous paid time off, high profile clients, opportunities for advancement
review.cons: Cons – Certain work groups are VERY catty, almost sorority-esque. Human Resources function is very unprofessional, not many in mid level leadership roles are trained in leadership
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Get control of the workgroups' tendencies to gossip, it's had a terrible effect on morale. Try to hire a more balanced workforce, too many men or women makes for a culture dominated by the worst traits of either gender

review.title: “The gold-standard PR agency is not all roses”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people at all levels, some interesting clients, can be intellectually rewarding at times
review.cons: Cons – It an be a very political atmosphere -- your career advancement depends more on the manager you end up with and your willingness to play "smoke and mirrors," rather than your actual abilities and performance. The work can be very tedious if you find yourself stuck on certain accounts, and it is very difficult to move internally to something you might like better.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest more in your employees

review.title: “Oppressive, back biting culture”
review.pros: Pros – Great brand name with some very talented people, some good clients and a nice office. There are some interesting opportunities if you play the political game
review.cons: Cons – Terrifble dog eat dog environment with nasty inter-office rivalries. There is a reign of terror amongst senior management who you upset or challenge at your peril. No support from the human resources.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Encourage true collaboration and doing what's right for clients not profits, stimulate change in the culture and respect work life balance

review.title: “N/A”
review.pros: Pros – The people that I work with are some of the smartest and creative people around. Edelman is great when it comes to working with other practices to provide the best counsel possible.
review.cons: Cons – Management in Los Angeles doesn't seem to care about the career advancement of their employees. The rate at which people are promoted and / or recognized for their talent is inconsistent.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to your employees. Have 1:1s with them and don't only listen but take action or at least show that you are taking action.

review.title: “Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Smart peopleExciting workCompany brand recognitionOpportunities to grow
review.cons: Cons – Politics and "Inner circle" favoritismManagement is short-term thinkingLack of appropriate resources and supportLack of diversity/cultural ignoranceUnequal pay
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recruit smart and diverse people to provide clients with a range of viewpoints in developing engagement campaigns. Support all business, including specialty groups, and demonstrate commitment and long-term planning for professional development. Better manage group heads to ensure they are managing their teams correctly.

review.title: “Edelman Digital”
review.pros: Pros – good co-workers, good benefits, innovative ideas
review.cons: Cons – long hours, little pay, not enough staffing
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Long hours, not enough support

review.title: “Awesome company to get started with!”
review.pros: Pros – Great training resources, tons of knowledgeable people in all PR industries, open and friendly environment, events sometimes happen, great location in the financial district, working under some distinguished PR folk.
review.cons: Cons – This office in particular works LONG hours. If this doesn't bother you, you'll fit right in. However, it's tough to maintain a work-life balance regularly. If you're driving, you have to pay for parking.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I like the management on the whole.

review.title: “review”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, great clients, good reputation
review.cons: Cons – inside politics, teams can be cliquey
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be aware of all employess, not just those who make a fuss.

review.title: “Ouch, that hurt”
review.pros: Pros – Ability to do things you may have never done before if you get a good account. Lots of variety of tasks, challenges and the opportunity to participate nominally in minor decision making.
review.cons: Cons – No real teams here, rather it is individual competition within the team, Politics in the office is not the best way to help clients. Really poor leadership and stratified management style. Very Old School. There is definitely an inner circle, a need to know attitude and poor morale overall all. This agency is about billable hours and you better not forget it. You can grow there if you can get "in" with certain people, not by accomplishments. I was disappointed and disillusioned, They had good PR about their company, I chose them over another but regretted it within my first week.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Empower and enhance all your employees, not just your buddy pool. Flatten your management system and instead of lunching with a reporter etc.. every day maybe Richard should lunch with employees. Provide better platforms for employees to advance. Read Managing Upside Down.

review.title: “Good place to get experience”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a lot of blue chip clients, and as you are starting out, there isn't a better place to get training.
review.cons: Cons – Top heavy organization and below average pay
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – better work life balance

review.title: “A Great Place To Work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has the best accounts of all the large PR firms; The work the company does is consistently top notch, and it has some of the most creative minds in the business; If I were a client looking for a firm that goes out of its way to make things happen, Edelman would be my first choice.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is below industry standard, and you have to fight for every dollar in your annual review, which can be demoralizing
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a hard look at who is actually doing the work; There is a lot of dead weight at the company, especially at the VP level.

review.title: “Great place to work, not for pay”
review.pros: Pros – As a young professional you will learn an immense amount of tools for successful media relations, writing and how to adapt to each client's needs. Your growth is dependent on your hard work and managers are more like coaches that want to see and help you succeed.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman does not reward the hard work of it's employees with appropriate compensation. The long hours it takes from employees to make Edelman a top agency doesn't seem to factor too much into the equation for management. Many employees often feel overworked, overwhelmed and underpaid.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management should review its compensation policies and bring them more in line with appropriate levels. Management should also review the true utilization rates of employees and work with the employee to achieve a greater work life balance.

review.title: “Only "Type A" Personalities Need Apply”
review.pros: Pros – Industry CacheBrilliant thinkers inspire you
review.cons: Cons – Attitude of some staffersBrilliant Thinker
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make sure you know how hard your interns and middle management work - but also realize ome of them have no clue what they are doing.

review.title: “Up and coming agency.”
review.pros: Pros – Good brand, good people, new office in New York.
review.cons: Cons – Went through rough patch a few years ago.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ease up on new hires.

review.title: “Good place to work, especially for driven conscientious people”
review.pros: Pros – Richard Edelman is a true, respected thought leader in the field of PR and the company does a great job informing and educating all its staff about the company's vision. Edelman encourages employees to embrace the changes in the practice of PR and gives them opportunities to develop their skills.
review.cons: Cons – Office politics and gossip, while inevitable, can sometimes make the office a negative environment. Staff departures aren't always handled well. Workloads aren't spread very evenly, leaving some staff overworked while others have lots of free time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do more to appreciate and recognize the work that junior staff perform. Encourage them to take chances and speak up with ideas and concerns. Remember that they often put in long hours under a lot of stress, but aren't as well compensated as you. Be willing to jump in and get your hands dirty every once and awhile.

review.title: “well respected leader in industry”
review.pros: Pros – working with smart and capable collleagues
review.cons: Cons – lack of investment in mid-level staff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – overall great job but there isn't much of a financial incentive for staying at the company long-term

review.title: “Ok Big PR Agency”
review.pros: Pros – Large company so there was a lot expertise to draw on. The global capabilities made it a good place for large clients.
review.cons: Cons – Personnel management is generally lacking. There could be a higher bar set to get into the company. Very hierarchal
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – make people not clients the priority. focus on good client service not on new business. grow organically and make sure you have expertise to fill client needs.

review.title: “Great, big company.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is an excellent public relations firm and the name itself garners a lot of respect. As a large company, it's run very well.
review.cons: Cons – When I first started working there I did not have a lot of input on what department I worked in.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I really respect Richard Edelman and think he does an excellent job communicating with the company's employees and being as present as possible.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Great atmosphere, smart and engaging people, creative environment where your thoughts and opinions matter. You can make your own path.
review.cons: Cons – Low compensation and long hours but you will find that with any agency. Have to be forward and be your biggest cheerleader.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to engage and listen to the junior staff and take into account their time and effort to complete tasks.

review.title: “Unless you want to be overworked, underpaid and regularly backstabbed...don't work here”
review.pros: Pros – You will learn a lot about media lists, media relations and social media while working here. This knowledge is very valuable. You will also learn a lot about office politics, which comes with a price but could be valuable eventually. Overall, the ultimate “pro” is that you will walk away with a major name in the PR industry on your resume.
review.cons: Cons – To name a few cons, Edelman Seattle is full of poor management, favoritism and toxic people. If you are not a favorite of the general manager, upper management or HR don’t expect to get a promotion, a raise or even be heard when you have an issue. If your manager feels at all threatened by you and your talent, you will be demeaned in front of upper management and clients, not promoted for reasons you will only find out during your review and will be positioned by your manager as “not meeting the mark” (regardless of meeting/exceeding client expectations). Some other cons include low pay, long hours and very little appreciation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You are losing talent to office politics, a terrible HR department and toxic people.

review.title: “Good place to learn, challenging to grow if you're not the "right" personality”
review.pros: Pros – There are many opportunities to learn and take on a variety of projects. There are also opportunities switch to difference practices. Edelman also encourages having a life outside of work and experiencing new things - I really value that and would hate to work for a place that doesn't encourage these values.
review.cons: Cons – To me, the louder you are, the more recognition and promotional opportunities there are. It doesn't always seem fair that you must be extremely vocal in order to be given new responsibilities. There does seem to be heavy favoritism at this office. Sometimes it's too big for junior staff to have the chance to dive in and take on more meaty projects and roles.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen to the junior staff - we have good ideas too. Also, management needs to look at how people are evaluated and promoted. I was overlooked for not being outgoing enough - at least that's what it boils down to - while others with less experience were promoted at the same time I finally was. It didn't matter that I had great praise for the great work I was doing from everyone on the internal team as well as from clients.

review.title: “Great place to work...not a great place to earn money.”
review.pros: Pros – Great work-life balance, plenty of professional development opportunities, open-door management styles and top-notch clients. Smart and accomplished co-workers. One of the few PR companies with long-term career potential for newbies, and excellent about promoting from within.
review.cons: Cons – The company is big enough that it can be difficult to get to a position of real influence. Furthermore, an employees experience varies largely based on the account they happen to work with, which is not uncommon for agency work. The real minus is the salaries. Unless you were brought on before the recession, chances are you're being paid below market.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Promotions, professional development opportunities and praise are excellent for morale and much appreciated. But if salaries don't increase when the economic situation stabilizes, there is sure to be a loss of talent to competing agencies.

review.title: “I love Edelman!”
review.pros: Pros – I have a fabulous manager. I have great work life balance. I am compensated well. I enjoy my work. The people are amazing.
review.cons: Cons – I can't think of any. I honestly feel so grateful to work here. Richard Edelman is fabulous and I enjoy coming to work each day.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stronger Leadership is needed in Chicago. Although they are competent, the leaders aren't heard from as often as they need to be.

review.title: “Love this company!”
review.pros: Pros – The people and ability to carve your own path.
review.cons: Cons – Too many titles and employees constantly looking for promotion. We should be flatter.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look closely at changing title structure and come up with new compensation plan.

review.title: “dsd”
review.pros: Pros – The work is very challenging and the issues and accounts are varied. The organization is also very entrepreneurial and dynamic.
review.cons: Cons – The work life balance is completely off... especially for the those starting off. This is probably the case with most agencies.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They need to look out for their direct reports a little more and need to spend more time on career and skill developement.

review.title: “Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – Brilliant people, good culture, well-recognized clients and an international brand. Edelman is definitely at the top of the communications industry.
review.cons: Cons – Financial compensation is not something Edelman is known for, and there are politics at every level that make it hard to push through ideas.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Thank you for making it a priority for us to reach out and become a part of the Edelman global network.

review.title: “Fair, but room for improvement”
review.pros: Pros – Entrepreneurial spirit, leadership within the industry, good life / work balance, top notch clients, global presence, interesting issues and challenges
review.cons: Cons – salaries are not nearly high enough for the caliber of people that work at Edelman, opportunities for advancement and promotion could be much better
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – recognize the hard work that employees do and reward them accordingly, more opportunities to visit other offices and learn from colleagues around the world

review.title: “i think the agency really is among the best, worked at several. More vision, talent and team orientation than others.”
review.pros: Pros – Good culture, interesting and prestigious clients
review.cons: Cons – Technology tools sometimes lacking in IT area
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – none

review.title: “If I didn't work here I'd want to be a client.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman offers the greatest variety and depth of public relations counsel in the agency realm. I worked at Waggener Edstrom, as well as Hill and Knowlton and had vowed never to work in an agency again. I began at Edelman as a part-time employee and was immediately impressed by the level of client service, support for employees and most of all by the senior leadership. Having worked at other agencies, I was stunned by the personal involvement of c-level executives in helping clients on a day to day basis and winning new business.The value account teams deliver is unsurpassed (at least based upon the experience in my office). All voices are valued and creative thinking is accepted at all levels.I realize this sounds a bit like a pollyanna, but is truly my experience.
review.cons: Cons – The reality is that agency life isn't for everyone. I do feel it is the best environment for learning and expanding your skill set. I am grateful that Edelman is a private company because we can weather the tough times and keeping employees is a priority.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Leading a diverse and global company is not easy and it is difficult to maintain a company's culture. I would encourage the leadership to support regional differences so that we can continue to provide the best local AND global support.

review.title: “Excellent company with outstanding values mixed with a fun and entertaining environment!”
review.pros: Pros – I love what I do, I love the people I work with and I'm proud to be employed by Edelman. The Seattle office is fun and hard-working. Employees work hard and reap the benefits... senior staff does a good job of acknowledging and rewarding people who make solid contributions. The office is casual, laid-back and endlessly entertaining, which makes me happy to be at work each day. I don't think I've ever dreaded coming to work and the environment and people are the main reason why. Communication is another strength; senior staff communicate company and office news often and consistently.
review.cons: Cons – You have to work really hard sometimes, but it's great to know that your co-workers are doing the same thing, making them dedicated and intelligent contributors.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep communicating to staff and be as transparent as possible.

review.title: “Great reputation, not a great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a place that is full of very smart people who, in my mind, are thought leaders in the PR industry. The training and education they give to employees is truly valuable and overall the clientele is very interesting. Beyond thought leadership and great clients, they have beautiful offices around the U.S. that are aesthetically pleasing to walk into every day.
review.cons: Cons – Upper management shows extreme favoritism to those who fit a particular mold. They will promote them relentlessly and noticeably allow them to micromanage the rest of the team (regardless of their title). If you are not one of their favorites, upper management will always find a reason why you shouldn’t be promoted and not give you a constructive reason why you cannot move to the next level. Aside from there not being an opportunity for career growth here, the pay is terrible. I am making 10 to 15 thousand less than my counter parts in other firms, and do not have any benefits like compensated travel (parking, bus, train) or a reduced rate on a gym. Aside from all this the people truly make this place miserable. They are passive aggressive, arrogant and will do anything they can to take credit for good work they did not do. I would not recommend working here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – If you demand certain things of staff, then demand that same quality and performance of all staff. We know that times are tough – but it is not a reason to underpay and under compensate your staff.

review.title: “Be prepared to work hard; you'll get out what you put in.”
review.pros: Pros – When you're starting your career in PR or communications, there isn't a better place to be for meeting others in your shoes, finding mentoring opportunities and getting connected with others in the industry. The company is great about offering internal education and growth opportunities to young professionals, and really invests a lot in making sure they've got the best of the best as far as workforce goes.
review.cons: Cons – Very hierarchical, and very political. If you don't play the game it's wisest just to get out.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Often the support or solicitations for feedback from younger staff members came off as feeble or obsequious. It pays to actually *listen* to junior staffers.

review.title: “There's a reason we're voted the best place to work each year.”
review.pros: Pros – The people are some of the best and the brightest in the industry.
review.cons: Cons – Integration and cooperation between offices could be improved.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Transparency and communication are important to continue to share. I like the frequency of communication from the top.

review.title: “PR Week's 2009 Agency of the Year for a Reason”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a creative powerhouse. Whenever I need some unique options to present a client, I round up a selection of colleagues from various parts of the company to brainstorm ideas - our collective creativity never fails to impress me! Edelman's medical benefits are superior to other companies' (though not all employees appreciate this.) Also, new hires automatically get two weeks vacation, PLUS what amounts to other week in optional/balance days. And that is on top of 10 standard holidays, including MLK and Presidents' Day. Another great advantage of working at Edelman: we're an independent company so we're able to invest in our future, our services and our people the way many Wall Street-beholden firms can't. Finally, you can't overlook the fact that Edelman was named PR Week's Agency of the Year in 2009.
review.cons: Cons – We're working hard to get better at this, but teams in different practice areas and geographies do not share information effectively. This is partially driven by Edelman's entrepreneurial culture (everyone wants to own their own little piece of the company) and by the way our P&L is structured. Speaking of structure, Edelman has few processes in place compared to other companies. In some ways, this helps us make decisions more quickly and with greater flexibility; however, we often end up duplicating efforts or wasting time tracking down information that should be readily available. Our financial processes (or lack thereof) are a great example; however, we are rolling out a new global financial system this year that I am hoping will make billing MUCH easier for us and for clients.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay particular attention to people management skills and give feedback diplomatically.

review.title: “Don't work at Edelman if you can help it”
review.pros: Pros – They have decent business prospects.
review.cons: Cons – Mean, politically motivated know-it-alls at all levels. You are looked down at if you are not Jewish -- and I'm part Jewish. Very few people are happy here, which is too bad. I've worked at a few agencies and this is tied for last place with Weber Shandwick.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop PRing the work environment to the outside world, without actually making it a good place to work. PR has enough reputation issues without the Edelman smokescreen.

review.title: “Great opportunities for mid-to-senior management, but junior staff is overworked and underpaid.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a well-known firm and has a strong creative staff. The agency also has an extensive list of clients across a number of practices including technology, healthcare, consumer, etc. The company does a good job of staffing accounts across offices and regions to take advantage of different expertises that vary across the country. The company also has extensive international offices that are helpful when clients need work done in foreign countries, need documents, translated or need access to press in foreign countries.
review.cons: Cons – Low pay for junior staff, and on large accounts the junior staff are not always given opportunities to experience different types of the business i.e. plan development, extensive media outreach, etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay the little people better. They're the driving force for your account management.

review.title: “Thoughts”
review.pros: Pros – Great professionals in the network
review.cons: Cons – Lack of clear leadership and direction locally
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Not sure...

review.title: “Edelman: a superior place to work”
review.pros: Pros – The company culture is wonderful, and teamwork, recognition and work-life balance are all priorities at Edelman. Promotions and kudos are given for jobs well done. Lines of communication are open between employees and upper management, and professional development opportunities are abundant. The company has top-notch clients and the work is interesting. Edelman University is one example of a unique company offering with great value--here, employees share knowledge, expertise and best practices to help aid professional development, quality and client satisfaction. Furthermore, Richard Edelman is a gracious and knowledgeable leader who communicates frequently with his employees and is always looking for and blazing the next breakthrough in the PR world.
review.cons: Cons – Having a number of large accounts is a blessing because it allows you to focus your time on one thing, but it can also be a curse because it can narrow your scope of development. And the size of the company can make it difficult to get to the top.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – When working in any large group, it's important to keep bureaucracy from hampering innovation.

review.title: “Edelman continues to lead the company down a global path.”
review.pros: Pros – Well-established global company. Stand-alone public relations firm with a number of specialty offerings in various offices around the globe. These specialty offerings provide unique differentiators to clients. The company has a good blend of young, new employees and more seasoned professionals who have been employed by the company for many years.
review.cons: Cons – Small management group making decisions in a vacuum. Family ownership may limit advancement for management personnel. For most, the road from assistant account executive to senior management has many roadblocks. Less seasoned employees may be required to spend a number of years working on tasks that are neither learning experiences now rewarding. Senior professionals are often pigeon-holed into roles that neither give them the opportunity nor prospect of growth in other roles or with other departments.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more inclusive when making personnel decisions.

review.title: “Top-notch leader, permanently cut off from his troops by a layer of sycophants.”
review.pros: Pros – Richard Edelman - smart man. He truly understands where our profession is headed.
review.cons: Cons – Fiefdoms, poor performance rewarded, assholes rise to the top unimpeded because Mr. Edelman doesn't like confrontation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You are the problem.

review.title: “Edelman is mostly good”
review.pros: Pros – I enjoy the people with whom I work. It has a good portfolio of clients and a strong network across the globe. It also is a private firm, which means it has more flexibility than many of the other PR behemoths across the globe. They push work-life balance, on paper at least. Also, we have a pretty good softball team.
review.cons: Cons – It is a big PR firm, which means that it is often rigid and the opportunity to advance is dependent upon your years of experience. The experience also varies heavily on your accounts, although this may be the case anywhere.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect your relationship with your employees more than your relationship with your client. Within reason, of course.

review.title: “Supportive work environment”
review.pros: Pros – I work on a very supportive and collaborative team, and there seems to be a lot of room for growth for those who are smart are willing to work. The leadership team is good about openly communicating with staff, management generally keeps an open door policy and there are a lot of fun projects to work on.
review.cons: Cons – Because of the nature of the industry, there is always potential for long hours (every day is different, so you never know just which day will involve long hours). Expect to juggle many things at once.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep open communication.

review.title: “Edelman has its good point and bad points”
review.pros: Pros – Prestige, being at the top of your field
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, little compensation, little recognition for work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management seems to do very well, but there is an overall slump in corporate culture

review.title: “Fun and challenging”
review.pros: Pros – My peers; career growth; and diversity of clients
review.cons: Cons – Very tied to economy, making business uncertain
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep communicating as you do; very open

review.title: “Okay place to work, but not enough knowledge of media”
review.pros: Pros – Advancement - and some training
review.cons: Cons – Very little training, and much of senior management have little knowledge of how the media works. If fact, they seem ashamed to "pitch" the media, and would rather be known as "consultants."
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't scorn medium-sized accounts that require a lot of media work and knowledge. Improve the media skills of all ae and account supervisors -- otherwise you are not giving clients their due.

review.title: “Great company, great clients”
review.pros: Pros – creative, smart, ethical, INDEPENDENT, global
review.cons: Cons – It is a very large comany to navigate
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – All is good!

review.title: “Practice what you preach.”
review.pros: Pros – Big company with small company values. Executive management really believes in the company and the senior leaders are inspiring, motivational and fun to work with. Employees genuinely seem to like each other, especially in the management ranks.
review.cons: Cons – Silos. Leadership says they're different from the other large PR agencies, i.e. better cooperation, less competition between P&L's, faster decision making, less politics--but in reality Edelman is no different from any other large global PR firm. Edelman is somewhat conservative and buttoned up. Many people have been there a very, very, very long time and seem reluctant to do things differently, especially if the change is suggested by or reflected in the actions of a new employee.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Practice what you preach. Being private means that top management is seldom questioned or challenged by independent outsiders/stakeholder to ensure continous improvement. Don't say one thing in an interview and then whack people for behaving according to what they said and heard.

review.title: “Edelman is great!”
review.pros: Pros – Entrepreneurial environment, great colleagues, interesting clients
review.cons: Cons – long hours, little vacation time
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't overload employees with more work than is possible to complete

review.title: “Mixed feelings about Edelman”
review.pros: Pros – The firm has a great reputation (looks great on a resume), and great, industry-leading clientsYou'll get tons of great PR experience, and hit the ground running with work.Entrepreneurial atmosphere-think of great ideas for clients, and you'll be rewarded.
review.cons: Cons – Hours are insane, and expectations for the amount of work one person can do in one day are pretty crazy.Firm's commitment to employee work-life balance is mostly in theory, with little practical applicationEdelman tends to favor its "superstars" with bigger bonuses and higher profile clients. The rest don't really get the same opportunities and it can be hard to break into that circle.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Edelman should be more systematic in how its employees progress, develop and are promoted.

review.title: “Edelman Offers Creative, Cutting-Edge Work Environment”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is committed to keeping it's employees informed on the latest trends in the industry and creating a work environment that is creative enjoyable. There is a true commitment to client service and, while this might mean more work around deadlines for the employee, it means clients stick around---thus, I feel my job is secure and isn't going to another agency. My supervisor catches up with me whenever I seem even the slightest bit stressed so we can assess workload and determine how to better manage my time. This open line of communication encourages me to be candid with my supervisor about the progress of my projects, rather than please her throughout the time leading up to the project deadline with false status reports.Edelman is aware that PR can be a taxing profession. That said, they put their money with their mouth is in tackling this downside. Edelman is committed to healthy work-life balance. They provide breakfast on Mondays, fruits on Tuesdays and Thursday. Fridays they treat everyone to ice cream, many selection are healthy as well.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman can be a lot of work. There are days when I come into the office at 6am and don't leave until 7pm. More times than not, my supervisor will keep track of days like this and allow me to leave early. However, when the team enters a busy season, there is little relief. Because everyone is working hard to meet the constant needs of the client, there can be an unnecessary sense of immediacy. Certainly we want to service the client as best as possible. However, nagging emails from fellow account people can be frustrating and a waste of time.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Rely less on internal spin and more on honest assesment. At the end of the day, using either method of communication leads to a job well done. I just think we might be able to do an even better job not worrying about hurting feelings and, instead, relying on pure, honest assessment.

review.title: “Agency of the Year for Whom?”
review.pros: Pros – The people are smart and driven
review.cons: Cons – Edelman pays below industry averages
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Increase pay to be competitive within the industry.

review.title: “Edelman is above average for PR. Go into consulting”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman employees are smart, hard working and create a great work environment. The people are absolutely the number 1 reason to work at Edelman. The world-wide network offers great opportunities to learn from colleagues around the world.
review.cons: Cons – Despite talk of work/life balance, long hours are expected.Tough economy puts the squeeze on clients and limits opportunities for new business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Successfully implement the network wide tools you've developed. Managment puts a large emphasis on collaboration but the tools they've created are sub par and create roadblocks to collaboration rather than facilitating it.

review.title: “Phenomenal agency with some hangups”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has an excellent reputation in public relations. The Portland office is up-and-coming and making a big splash within the global company. The staff is fun and there are many talented people in the organization. Educational opportunities are abundant. Clients are among some of the best in their respective industries - Microsoft, Columbia Sportswear and Starbucks to name a few. The company has excellent benefits and provides flexibility during the work week with work from home options. Working for a large agency provides instant credibility for someone just starting out in public relations. Management involves interns at various levels providing for an excellent internship experience. An especially great place to work if you value a casual work environment including off color humor, inappropriate remarks and foul language.
review.cons: Cons – Unfortunately interns are supervised by Account Executives (typically only 2 years experience). This role provides a first opportunity for an Account Executive to manage another person, which is good for the company, but its also a gamble as to whether or not the person is up for the task. Since each intern has only one supervisor and one main point of contact, it can ruin much of the experience to have someone who struggles communicating and leading giving oversight. My supervisor was unable to provide helpful feedback on work (struggled with people pleasing). Rather than teaching and instructing, my supervisor was passive and sidestepped issues instead of dealing with them head on. I had hoped for a tremendous learning experience, and it was, but Edelman also provided the worst boss I have had in 9 years of work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Carefully evaluate team leaders to make sure they are qualified before putting them in a supervisory role.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – The best thing about working for Edelman is the access to great clients and accounts.
review.cons: Cons – Some of the downsides of working at Edelman are the unpredictable hours.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more involved

review.title: “Wonderful place for Type A employees. Not ideal for everyone, but overall, tremendous opportunities for learning.”
review.pros: Pros – Professional RecognitionInteresting ClientsOpportunities for creative thinking
review.cons: Cons – Long HoursOccasionally cutthroat natureManagers prone to playing favorites for personal reasons over work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Respect your junior staff! Challenge us, highlight good work and help us find opportunities to grow.

review.title: “On the right path, need to further integrate”
review.pros: Pros – reputation, clients, network and exposure
review.cons: Cons – revenue driven rather than creativety
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – integrate

review.title: “Nice...”
review.pros: Pros – Experience gained with team is worth the job
review.cons: Cons – Secrecy and some infighting makes it hard
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Talk more already!

review.title: “Content but still looking”
review.pros: Pros – Company recognition; Career advancement; Benefits package
review.cons: Cons – Little work/life balance; Low salary; Long hours
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Provide more guidance to entry level employees instead of criticism

review.title: “Good place to work in PR”
review.pros: Pros – Fun place to work overall with great people. There you have a very clear career path and managers are open to giving feedback and committed to helping you grow. Promotions are frequent, but sought after, and they give you something to strive for...rather than at other agencies where you may remain the same position for years at a time. Some people will become Edelman lifers if they fall in with the right contacts. Most others will go away...some to realize that Edelman wasn't so bad after all. Great benefits, smart people, high standards in general.
review.cons: Cons – Very political. Long hours. Some glamorous accounts...some not so much.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Break down the social circles within the organization.

review.title: “Can't imagine working anywhere else! Fantastic firm that cares about its employees.”
review.pros: Pros – Working with smart people and being allowed to be a thought-leader! Employees have the ability to work on clients that interest them, can talk to managers about the right work/life balance for them. There is a tremendous training program, human resources team that is amazing and partners with us to help assure excellence for employees and encouragement of employees to "live in color" which means include other things in your life other than work. The senior leadership is strong and provide good mentorship. They listen to employees and act on what they hear. This office is one of the best Edelman has.
review.cons: Cons – I can't honestly think of a single thing - I love this company!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stay privately owned and keep listening to employees.

review.title: “Great culture”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman Portland has terrific culture. There is a fair amount of freedom to pick what accounts you want to work on, and to pursue new business that is personally interesting. The leadership of the office is very fun and spirit-oriented, which trickles down to make a caring, open atmosphere. Creativity and quality are highly prized, as is a general attitude of can-do, jump-in and help even if it doesn't directly improve your own are of responsibility.
review.cons: Cons – The pay at Edelman Portland is about mid-range compared with similar agencies. It could definitely be higher, especially at the most junior levels. Additionally, some account teams appear to be favorites of the senior management and get more attention and resources. It can be de-motivating to work on an account team that isn't a "pet" of senior management. Another aspect that could use improvement is training. The company tries to provide training, but it isn't terribly level-specific. While most account teams devote a good amount of training to the tactical aspects of junior level work, there should be more training around the areas of influence -- presentation training, client negotiation, etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make promotions and performance more transparent. Don't protect people's feelings so much.

review.title: “Long hours, at times cutthroat, but good if you know you want to be in PR”
review.pros: Pros – It's well recognized and well regarded within the world of PR. If you work or have worked for Edelman people in the marketing world tend to recognize the name, depending on what type of marketing and where in the world you are. Definitely, if you intend to continue on in a career in PR, everyone in PR knows Edelman and most likely associates you with a certain level of aptitude and accomplishment given the nature of the company and the working environment.
review.cons: Cons – Long work hours, sometimes working on weekends if there's a big event going on, always having to be keenly aware of what is going on in the news media, breaking news, etc.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to offer classes that help enrich the knowledge base of junior level people. Continue to make efforts to strike better work/life balance.

review.title: “BEWARE! You are signing away your social life. No such thing as work/life balance here.”
review.pros: Pros – Great reputation and looks great on resumeEdelman has a vast amount of resources available for its employees, far more than your average public relations agency.Great client list, you represent some of the biggest and best brands/products in the world.Good work experience if you plan on climbing the corporate ladder.
review.cons: Cons – Jr. level worked to the bone. Be ready to be the first one in the office and the last one to leave at night.Office politics and "favorites" and cliques, but that goes for every officeIndependently owned but a very, very corporate setting. There is no room for any kind of individuality or even creativity when you are at a junior level.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Sr. management should receive better "management training" on communicating with jr. staff

review.title: “S'ok to work here, as long as you're comfortable paying a lot of dues.”
review.pros: Pros – Recognition in the field amongst members of the media and other PR professionals. Easy to execute large campaign.
review.cons: Cons – Amount of heirarchy, a lot of ego, and hard to accelerate career
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Sacrifice yourself for the little guy

review.title: “Great company, bad timing”
review.pros: Pros – The people are great. They are fun and real. Also, there are some fun happy hours and out of the office activities.
review.cons: Cons – The pay is not great. Also, due to the sinking economy, Edelman is hesitant to hire. These leaves a lot of the employees with a larger than normal workload. There is a definite need for new hires, but until the economy changes, the employees have to work longer hours for less pay. From my experience, it seems that senior management and upper level management at Edelman doesn't do much actual work. All of the work is transfered to lower level employees, stressing them out even more.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire more people!

review.title: “Best company I have worked for...great growth opportunities, healthy competition and amazing, intelligent co-workers.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is fun, hardworking and respectful. I love the people I work with, I love the atmosphere and I love the work-life balance and flexibility that's given to good employees.
review.cons: Cons – I suppose the hours can be long, but we're rewarded fairly.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management lets us know what we need to do to succeed and they put it in our hands, which is the right way to run a business.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – The people at Edelman are very intelligent. Most of the leadership is motivating. Senior leadership wants to keep its employees happy and is very open finding solutions to employee problems/concerns, rather than having a "just deal with it" attitude.
review.cons: Cons – I think that the salary is on the low side.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Junior staff appreciate the level of communication provided. I can't speak for all groups but I feel that my group is well-informed.

review.title: “Edelman is the best of the best”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is the best of the best in the PR industry. Edelman has excellent leadership and opportunities for growth and development of employees. Being the largest independent public relations firm, there is a lot of flexibility for staff, but still challenging and exciting client work.
review.cons: Cons – It's a demandingenvironment where you need to work hard, but in the several years I have been at Edelman, my skills have grown tremendously.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior management at Edelman shoudl keep listening to staff and continue the internal surveys. When they make real changes based on employee feedback, it gets noticed.

review.title: “Exciting, dynamic place to work with lots of opportunity for the highly motivated.”
review.pros: Pros – Top Fortune 500 clients, career growth. Independent spirit and dynamic corporate culture. Strong senior leadership, opportunity for advancement. Brand name strength. Decent bonus/profit sharing system and opportunity to negotiate your salary for high achievers.
review.cons: Cons – They are very picky, so you have to work really hard to stand out among your peers. Teams are usually very busy, so to get noticed, you have to be smart about how you merchandise your work to your boss, your peers and your clients. Medical benefits have a higher than industry average employee contribution.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Listen carefully to the needs of your junior employees and make time for them. Communicate "the big picture."

review.title: “Edelman puts the "work" in work/life balance. As for "life"...”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of learning opportunity; great clients; smart and experienced people.
review.cons: Cons – At the junior level, you receive little support, few incentives and not much recognition. Work/life balance was paid lip service but not actually respected.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Manage better.

review.title: “Neutral - lots of great people to work with but not that impressed with our senior leadership...”
review.pros: Pros – Good reputation in the industry and among clients
review.cons: Cons – Senior management - not sure of their value/expertise sometimes. Also a lack of understanding of "the client side" from those who have spent their whole careers in the agency world.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – You need to hire more professionals with "real world" client-side experience to help us see though all the PR agency BS and figure out what our clients REALLY want/need.

review.title: “Fun, but low-paying”
review.pros: Pros – Fun, great people, Interesting work
review.cons: Cons – Low pay, long hours, lack of organization among teams
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None

review.title: “Great for senior level; horrible for junior level; extreme office politics”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a great reputation, as everyone knows, and there certainly is lots of room to grow (if you know the right people and are part of the circle of office elites). People at Edelman are incredibly smart and understand the various industries very well. The global networking for account servicing is unmatched.
review.cons: Cons – There is no work/life balance at Edelman. Junior level staff are highly disregarded no matter how much they burn the midnight oil to keep the accounts afloat. There are office politics to no end, and personal feelings/vendettas almost always trump professional merit.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in your junior level staffers and don't take them for granted. Too often have I seen our junior level staffers just walked all over upon and stretched so thin. Yet, when it comes down to doling out recognition, the junior staffers hardly ever receive praise. Evaluate your senior level staff for effectiveness in team building and management because there are too many underserving people in senior positions while some amazing junior staffers are consistently overlooked.

review.title: “A great place to work and learn regardless of your level.”
review.pros: Pros – Ahead of the curve in new technologies and the direction the industry is taking. A place you can be proud to work -- high profile clients and great work; a place you can shine. Easy access to senior management. Work/life balance varies but is not unlike any other agency. In-house training is important and available to all employees at all levels. Competitive compensation. As an independent agency without stockholders to consider, they are willing to do investment spending on new offerings to keep themselves cutting edge.
review.cons: Cons – Very little communication within the agency as a whole. You know what's happening in your practice area but not in others. Not a place for everyone: to be successful you need to be aggressive.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Practice PR internally.

review.title: “Hard work and long hours are standard here, but the payoff can be big for those dreaming of careers in PR”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is recognized as one of the world's leading PR firms. You'll learn from some of the brightest in the business. You'll also have the opportunity to work on some of the world's best-known brands that are held by companies with large marketing budgets.Richard Edelman, the company's head honcho, has a future-forward vision of the PR and marketing communications industry. This vision echos throughout the hallways and trickles down to junior staff.The company has practice areas in nearly every industry and offices around the globe, which is a plus for those who may want to explore other areas of PR.
review.cons: Cons – As in any advertising or PR agency, management is promoted based primarily on the ability to bring in new business or for the success/growth of current clients. But a good PR person isn't always a good manager -- so there can be a culture of ineffective and inefficient management on some teams.Be prepared to work long hours and remain constantly tethered to the office and the client. Client demands are high and the grunt work usually falls to the lowest of junior staffers. High burnout (and high turnover) is very common here. In my experience, turnover was higher here than at other similarly-sized marketing communications agencies; that's a red flag in a high churn-and-burn business.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Train your senior people to be better managers -- not just better new business rainmakers. Grow your junior people -- give them solid projects but also help them to balance work and life so that the burnout rate isn't so high.

review.title: “As good as it gets in big agency PR?”
review.pros: Pros – Great reputation within the PR industry, great clients, good/smart people and independent/family company culture.
review.cons: Cons – Inconsistent work/life balance, inconsistent salary/career progression pace between offices/practices, very hierarchical with too many titles.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in junior staff by prioritizing senior management accessibility/mentorship, sufficient staffing at the entry level and by taking an interest in career progression and retention of AAE-SAE employees.

review.title: “Great place to get started.”
review.pros: Pros – Great HR Department, Good Benefits Package, Great Location
review.cons: Cons – It's big, so it can get impersonel, Also the new cubicles are extremly small
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Doing a great job.

review.title: “Edelman has a great reputation”
