review.pros: Pros – Edelman is well respected in its field
review.cons: Cons – No work-life balance, so busy
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None

review.title: “Work Hard for the Money”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to recieve training; good benefits.
review.cons: Cons – Very long hours without feeling valued.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Recognize employees for a job well done and avoid preferential treatment.

review.title: “Great clients, poor work/life balance”
review.pros: Pros – Work for great Fortune 500 clients with interesting PR projects. Had the opportunity to work on things that we cutting edge and drive measurable results for the client. It is the best company in its field and the perks are great. Since it is a privately-owned firm, it still has that smaller structure feel. Not too bureaucratic in process and procedures. Great benefits for a larger firm. Summer hours were given as full comp days so most could take them because early summer hours were hard to take with the amount of projects at a time. Great place for someone just starting career in PR.
review.cons: Cons – No work/life balance, sometimes put in over 60 hours a week; lack of enough junior staff to support workload. Too many tasks with too little people to implement. Not very diverse in its workforce. Deadlines were unrealistic on most projects and required long hours and even holidays. Top management was poor in communicating employee expectations and feedback on projects. Management would commit to more projects than team was able to implement at one time. Account people were responsible with all aspects of business including monthly billing sheets which would take up to a day to complete depending on number of projects in process.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus on things that help your employees with their time, bottom line is important but so are employees

review.title: “Running on a (Informative) Treadmill”
review.pros: Pros – The chance to do high level PR in the context of a consulting practice.
review.cons: Cons – Too often the culture is focused around spinning the material that is given to us by clients and not offering feedback/recommendations on how companies can alter their business practices to be more effective/press worthy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stick to the current four year plan, as there is a market niche to exploit there.

review.title: “Not a terrible place, but sure wouldn't go back”
review.pros: Pros – They offer decent pay if you play a little hard ball; they have typically decent benefits as a large company; working at a "big name" PR agency always looks good on a resume.
review.cons: Cons – Machiavellian management, tends to be a sweatshop, various offices do not support one another, very difficult to change practices or offices within company; a few smart people, a lot of "yes" men. Mgmt doesn't encourage independent thinking that will really benefit the client.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Loyalty to your employees will benefit the company tremendously; taking care of your employees will improve your reputation in the industry and help retention. Don't be quick to let employees (esp. junior ones) go.

review.title: “Best Firm in the Business”
review.pros: Pros – Mobility, flexibility, creativity - they all represent values inside the company that play out every day. It's a great environment that rewards those who work hard, values ideas and creativity regardless of their origin (mostly), and if you're willing to go after them - opportunities around the world. The agency treats its people like their most important piece of equipment, the core of its business, and demands that they're developed as such. And on top of the fact that it's a world-class communications firm, the simple matter of the independence is a game changer. There's no way I would work for another firm, certainly not for a publicly traded one as part of some large conglomerate.
review.cons: Cons – It can be too easy to get wrapped up in the work. You have to be responsible for taking charge of your own life/work balance - no one is going to do it for you. At the same time, while not unique to business, PR, or life in general - there are times that personal relationships among senior staff can cloud or interfere with the best decisions for clients, the firm, or employees. As a whole, there is due consideration and diligence, but the exceptions can stand out - if only in stark contrast.Finally, again, not unique to large companies - the bureaucracy can be a little crushing at times.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Look much closer at the actual performance of Senior Manager, not just the perceived performance.

review.title: “Great place to learn, with the usual level of office-related issues”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is at the forefront of the changing world of PR and puts a high priority on its employees pursuing ongoing professional development opportunities
review.cons: Cons – The level of leadership and employee development opportunities is somewhat inconsistent between offices.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to take steps to minimize the inter-office competition.

review.title: “The best of the best”
review.pros: Pros – The people, the quality of clients, the resources, travel opportunities, big budgets.
review.cons: Cons – - It seems like it's hit or miss in terms of quality managers - some are great, others are dreadful.- Little work/life balance; long hours.- Promotional cycles are too limited.- Offices are open space and we all sit way too close to one another.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More training required on a regular basis for managers so that we maintain quality; better HR departments.

review.title: “Lots of freedom. For better and for worse.”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunities to work with the top clients/brands in the worldOpportunities to gain international experienceEdelman always driving thought leadership and pushing industry standards
review.cons: Cons – Everybody is "too busy" to help one anotherHigh turnover rate (agency norm)Training/introduction to the business often not a priority
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Junior Staff don't know about differing career paths. Help them understand how diverse the company is.

review.title: “Good start of a career”
review.pros: Pros – Interns are delegated important and valued work and feel like part of the team. Edelman is a great start of a PR career, at least it gives you the insight one would need before entering the industry. Lots of talents and highly collaborative environment, very international environment (but this can be a cons though...)Management level staff are very cool and friendly, very willing to teachThumbs up for the company culture.
review.cons: Cons – You either get really free or super busy, but hey, welcome to the PR industry!Perspectives of the company not local enough...this MIGHT be because of the very high expat ratio in the office.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep what you are doing, as an intern I really can't complain!

review.title: “After one and half year, I am still happy here!”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, innovative, large network.
review.cons: Cons – If employee benefit could be better, that would be perfect.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “They try hard to have a good environment, but everything is ruined by work-life balance”
review.pros: Pros – Its exciting to have the opportunity to work in a global company where you share experiences with offices from all around the world. The clients are very good.
review.cons: Cons – Low salaries, excessive hours, lack of skills among top leaders, defective 360 review process, company does not pay much attention to juniors or interns and make their development slower.
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman Vancouver office needs stronger leadership”
review.pros: Pros – -Lots of perks, parties and incentives-Interesting clients for a smaller city
review.cons: Cons – -Management doesn't notice highly unproductive team members and aggressive senior staff who desperately need management training.-Low salaries for middle managers
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Stop playing favourites, reevaluate staff members that are roadblocks.

review.title: “Intern”
review.pros: Pros – FriendlyPositive work environmentGood EnergyEngaged co-workersAlways know what you have to do as you have a line manager
review.cons: Cons – Long hours for an internUnpaid for undergrads

review.title: “The worst workplace of my life. Period.”
review.pros: Pros – International, exciting customers, huge budgets,
review.cons: Cons – Insane workload, horrible, incompetent superiors, outdated office equipment, unrealistic expectations, eploitation of skilled unwary people seems to be the main concept of business operation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay people some adequate salaray, train your middle management and enable people to have a life!

review.title: “Handling projects involving social media management and digital planning”
review.pros: Pros – International network and knowledge base. Document templates are available, and there are rules and procedures as base of operation, including inductions for new employees. After probation, they didn't made you contract worker but promoted as full time employee.
review.cons: Cons – In local office, simplified templates made some knowledge and skill unused or unobserved. Lacking great role model and working attitude. Some does have great working attitude, while some is so so or even below expectation.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Some 'creative title' created mislead opinion and impression. More managerial and people skill required to create more supportive working environment.

review.title: “A good hedge school for learning, career development tricky”
review.pros: Pros – PR focus - because the company was family-owned and independent from the ad agency monoliths, PR was front and centre of everything that happened. That meant is wasn't an afterthought. It was a great place to "learn the trade".Early Adopter - Edelman understood digital and convergence very early on and was a pioneering company. It was sneered at by bigger global competitors but it showed foresight and reaping the benefits of today.
review.cons: Cons – Family ownership - as above it can have advantages, but also disadvantages. The company had a "US first, Rest of World second" mentality. Major decisions were made in the US and filtered through. Some global memos were cringeworthy and did not take cognisance of local cultures or values. Working in a European office felt like you were working in a franchise rather than part of a global team. Also, European executive positions moved like a carousel, leaders never seemed to stay long.Career progression - This was a maze, without clarity. Very political and who you cosied up to. You had to push for promotion.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Use the current no.1 position to hire great people. Give employees some equity in the company.

review.title: “Excellent career builder”
review.pros: Pros – Experience working across practicesAdvocates entrepreneurial spiritProvides added responsibilities and oppoprtunities for growth
review.cons: Cons – More accounts than SAMs should be allowed to handle at one point of timeLong long working hoursRemuneration
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Frequent Change of Management in HK”
review.pros: Pros – International environment, work life balance is good
review.cons: Cons – Lack big retaining client due to frequent change of leadership in respect of many practices and the whole office
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire better leadership with true ability

review.title: “great company”
review.pros: Pros – amazing firm, exciting to work for, always want to be the best - but in a good, ethical way
review.cons: Cons – same as any large firm
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – keep doing what you are doing

review.title: “Great culture for learning, excellent brand for any CV”
review.pros: Pros – Good colleagues, supportive management, some great brand name clients to work with
review.cons: Cons – Tremendous pressure to generate business, long hours
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more attention to work-life balance for various teams.

review.title: “Terrible”
review.pros: Pros – Good values established from company founder. You walk in and sense the family ethic, majority of people are friendly. Decent benefits the longer you are with the company.
review.cons: Cons – The good values are fading fast. The place is full of managers thinking they are top VIP's. The power has gone to their heads. Leadership unable to handle PR pressure and often shout profanities over conference calls or to assistants. Senior staff have no problem in being rude and will happily make you feel as if you can't do your job, terrible as your obviously there as you are fully qualified. You do get a sense that people openly gossip for a pass time. Many middle-aged senior women seem like they could have been top editors or working in fashion PR and missed the boat. The creative division has tarnished the reputation of the company as the senior staff are erratic, many mood swings that makes it impossible for individuals to concentrate and work. Very weak HR team. Induction is a booklet to read on the morning you arrive. Took nearly a week to get a second hand laptop set-up and basic blackberry. Terrible disappointment for a global PR firm.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Build a strong HR team. Management should look at the reputation of the company and the people that are giving the place a bad name. Address behaviour issues with senior staff and offer training/ counselling to heads of divisions to teach them ways of dealing with pressure, and how to treat people with respect.

review.title: “very constructive experience”
review.pros: Pros – very decent knowledge in PR
review.cons: Cons – no bad things at all

review.title: “Work Environment is highly stressful”
review.pros: Pros – Great ClientsGood ContactsGet to go to great events
review.cons: Cons – Horrible working hoursNo overtimeExpected to work weekendsEnvironment is highly stressful
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Overtime and transparency

review.title: “Intern, Edelman India”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent company for holistic Public Relations.
review.cons: Cons – Its one of the best public relations firm , there are no cons!
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Fun, junior colleagues keep things going”
review.pros: Pros – Collaborative atmosphere, fun workplace, great office. Work hard, play hard.
review.cons: Cons – Communications are often unclear. Senior staff sometimes seem unappreciative.

review.title: “Great experience, learned a lot.”
review.pros: Pros – Good team who is professional and works really hard. They are always trying to achieve the best and keep their word.
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, lack of work-life balance and low pay. PR work is needed to be done sometimes after hours and on weekends.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Good opportunities”
review.pros: Pros – Throw you in at the deep and and allow you space to grow
review.cons: Cons – Excessive hours, will screw you on salary given a chance.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Fun and Conducive Open Culture”
review.pros: Pros – it has a fun, inclusive open concept where there is always time for work and also time for team-bonding non-work engagements. Good training and support with regular informative sessions by external parties or even the CEO himself on useful topics such as Writing great proposals. Good staff welfare with initiative such as Shut Down Wednesday, Munchy Mondays and Fruity Fridays, whereby breakfast is provided.
review.cons: Cons – Can get a little political at times, which is natural in big companies.

review.title: “Intern”
review.pros: Pros – Great corporate culture. Amazing working environment.
review.cons: Cons – Work is quite routine and not very challenging.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give me responsibilities to employees.

review.title: “Is Edelman one of the best?”
review.pros: Pros – As an English, native speaker there are numerous opportunities to interact with clients and manage projects in Beijing. An overseas education is something that provides a skill set which is unique among local staff, and, thus, helps you to stand out.
review.cons: Cons – Frankly, the Beijing office operates more on guanxi (personal relationships and connections) than it does on hard work and success. It's a well known fact that foreign staff face greater challenges in being promoted compared to their local counterparts.Maintaining a good work-life balance is difficult.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Ensure that employees that do good work are recognized. The quality of work is not always determined by the hours someone works.Work on employee satisfaction and retention. In particular, pay attention to ensuring that your employees have a work-life balance. Too many colleagues of mine have quit because they've been forced to work overtime nearly everyday.

review.title: “One of the most innovative employers”
review.pros: Pros – Leading edge employee engagement strategies, a true commitment from leadership to valuing contributions of employees, independently owned - have been able to keep the feel of a family owned business on a global level
review.cons: Cons – Bad behavior of leaders at the local level is often overlooked, work life balance can be a challenge to find
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Thought leaders.”
review.pros: Pros – IndependentFamily orientedLeading the way in PR/Public Engagement
review.cons: Cons – UK has been without a CEO for some time. This is now due to change.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “An excellent place to work. I've never been this satisfied with an employer.”
review.pros: Pros – Tends to attracts and retains some of the brightest minds in the industry.An individuals hard work, creativity and talent are recognized and rewarded.A list of incredible clients to work with.My managers have always been accessible and seem to genuinely care about my direction and career path.Management truly respects work life balance.
review.cons: Cons – From a creative perspective it can be sometimes difficult to push the technical envelope.Teams sometimes suffer from inefficient communication.Certain processes can benefit from streamlining.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great work!

review.title: “The Honeymoon is over and I ran out of Koolaid.”
review.pros: Pros – Global and diverse client base, fast pace, fair pay scale. Global offices may open up opportunities to work abroad. Some really great co-workers and ideals. Regardless of your length of stay, the experience you gain will benefit you in the long run.
review.cons: Cons – The Canadian offices are going through some growing pains. I found staffing to be heavy on the Senior level and sparse where the actual detailed work needs to be accomplished. This equates to many consecutive long hours with no compensation. You may find yourself pigeon holed very quickly and looking elsewhere.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I found many executive decisions are made on emotion and internal politics. I've seen a lot of fed up talented people leave and a lot of promotions happen that are not based on skill set or track record.

review.title: “Smart people, strong culture, solid place to build a career and reputation in PR”
review.pros: Pros – Some of the smartest people I've ever met in PR. There's a reason Edelman has clients who have stayed with us for 10+ years. Working for this company, you never stop learning and you never stop growing. It's also very much a team environment. I've met some of my best friends while working here, and the people I work with are what make me want to come to work every day.
review.cons: Cons – Senior management can be a little out of touch. They will occasionally make excuses for negative feedback, rather than dealing with problems head-on. Changing teams or practices is a difficult and lengthy process.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “It's Like Working in a Sorority”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a great company, with potential to move up and make a good salary.
review.cons: Cons – If you come to Edelman as an entry level AAE, expect to be treated like scum. It's like you're pledging for a sorority all over again, and it's not paid well enough to be so.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management definitely needs coaching. 24 and 25 year old managers at this company do not know how to be professional nor how to treat their employees well, with respect, so that they can grow and flourish. AAEs might struggle day-to-day, and it is not a good environment.

review.title: “Very competitive environment, full of personal politics”
review.pros: Pros – Biggest PR firm in the world, exciting environment, holds fun employee morale actives, travel opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Really underpay their employees for how much they claim they are the best, office politics determines 90% of decisions, people are mainly out for themselves and most think they are way better than you which is clearly evident in employee turn over rate
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show mutual respect to those below you rather than adopting an attitude of being too busy and superior. I was literally scolded like a five year old at times by management.

review.title: “Exciting job but questionable performance assessment”
review.pros: Pros – exciting client projects, positive brand image, excellent training
review.cons: Cons – long hours, weak middle managers, inconsistent performance assessment (the quality of the people of the same level varies so much, i.e. some weak performers can get promoted quickly if they are close with their managers)
review.advice-to-management: No, I would not recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Two Thumbs Up”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a fantastic employer. You have a variety of accounts to work on that really help you hone your skills. Strategic thinking, being creative, and emphasizing measurement / ROI are key strengths of the firm, and what you are trained on from day one. Your colleagues are nice, smart, and many long-term friendships are forged, albeit from some late nights at the office. The career path is clear on how to progress up the ladder. What I especially appreciate is the trust Edelman gives to its employees.
review.cons: Cons – It is a lot of work, especially when you are employed in one of the big city locations, but if you want to work at a large global PR agency, it truly is second to none.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue on the path of providing work-life balance and commitment to more women in senior leadership roles.

review.title: “Professionals working together toward a common goal.”
review.pros: Pros – Talented and driven teamsStrong leadership with clear goalsAn environment that is conducive to learning and professional growthPeople who are committed to doing the right thing and a true team environment
review.cons: Cons – If you are not familiar or comfortable working with global or remote teams, the environment could be challenging. Edelman does everything it can to minimize the challenges of a global business. There are few cons to working here that are not overcome by a proactive approach and a strong work ethic.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A dynamic environment with a supportive, entrepreneurial culture and great clients.”
review.pros: Pros – Culture, support, and great clients.
review.cons: Cons – Structure can be complicated and convoluted; senior people with nebulous titles and responsibilities; writing is a dying art.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More regular transparency about the state of the business; targeted and helpful training for junior staff that focuses on core skills like writing.

review.title: “Go-to company to develop your skills and learn how to push the envelope strategically”
review.pros: Pros – Talented, dedicated team membersEngaging clients and workOpportunity to travel domestically and possibly internationally based on clientsFlexible work schedule
review.cons: Cons – Long work hoursDifferences in management and advancement ability among offices in the networkLacking technology for mid-level managersConstant battle to stand out from the clutter
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior managers need to see the needs of the mid-level managers more; focus is place to heavily on the junior support staff and not those who are second in command (a lot of the time) on the business. Additionally, those that have been with the company more than five years need to be recognized and appreciated.

review.title: “Good Company to Work For”
review.pros: Pros – Great culture, solid leadership, and good position as a market leader in the Digital Marketing space. Edelman is a more stable, mature agency than many of the other Digital agencies. Company has great brand recognition among enterprise clients, so it's not hard to get in the door with new target clients. The company is also global, and encourages employees to move between markets (or even specialties) as their personal life goals shift.
review.cons: Cons – Conflict arises as the non-Digital side of the business becomes increasingly threatened by the Digital. Edelman is, at its core, a PR company, and while clients demand Digital as part of any enterprise-level solution, the PR side tends to want to pump non-Digital into the budget to stay alive.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Invest in "productizing" some of the mid- and entry-level Digital services, so that the PR staff can better qualify, position & sell them. This will also help train up entry-level Digital staff to a consistent, high standard.

review.title: “Door opening and positive career experience”
review.pros: Pros – Global presense; viewed as an industry leader; attracts high-quality, driven talent; supports clients of all practice areas and sizes; unending room to grow and learn.
review.cons: Cons – Complicated senior leadership matrix that can take a while to fully understand and navigate.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Spend more time informationalizing your employees to the global Edelman strategic vision.

review.title: “Working in the Edelman Consumer departments has been a great experience. You learn a lot when you work at the top firm!”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity to work on major national campaigns; tons of resources.
review.cons: Cons – It can be also intense.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A great place to learn”
review.pros: Pros – IndoPacific Edelman is a great place to learn for and grow. It offers equal opportunity to grow. Despite the high pressure and workload, the work atmosphere is rather friendly.
review.cons: Cons – As commonly found in the industry, the workload and pressure is quite high, and thus work-life balance is a bit difficult to maintain
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Cut throat and competitive”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, reputation, top notch accounts
review.cons: Cons – Competitive, back stabbing, bureaucratic, egos and arrogance are rewarded
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't reward big egos and attitudes

review.title: “Good global opportunities - but only when you are senior”
review.pros: Pros – - Some really great clients- Decent holiday benefits (start on 20 days holiday (rising to 25) + 1/2 day around bank holidays + days off between Xmas and New Year + Birthday day- Smart and innovative colleagues- Good training
review.cons: Cons – - The pay for junior staff is really poor- People can be overlooked for promotion as MDs are just so busy and don't get much time to interact with junior staff- The hours are long - which would be much more palatable if they pay was better- The tasks can be thankless, boring and monotonousness for junior staff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Pay your junior staff something they can actually survive on

review.title: “great agency if you can hack agency life”
review.pros: Pros – collaborative environmentcreativefungreat perkshigh budget clients
review.cons: Cons – long hoursvery fast pace
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – doing a great jon

review.title: “great intro company”
review.pros: Pros – great place to learn, work on big accounts, get your feet wet
review.cons: Cons – senior staff gets promoted often, junior staff, not so often
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – recognize that the future of the company is the younger group, and show them that you have something invested in keeping them around

review.title: “Great culture, people, clients. Amazing place to work with great career opportunities.”
review.pros: Pros – autonomy, strong global network and resources, room to grow, always learning and being challenged, very stimulating work environment, never gets boring, supportive team environment
review.cons: Cons – very large, very structured and corporate compared to boutique agencies
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “A great place to start your career, learn and grow.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is filled with smart, talented, hard-working people. Working for Edelman gives you the opportunity to learn from the best, live on the cutting edge of communication innovation and work with world-class companies and brands.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman seems to place more value on junior talent than senior talent, offering perks that appeal to 20-somethings (i.e., happy hours), but they fall short when it comes to perks for mid- and senior-level talent and retention at those levels.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Consider ways to retain mid- and senior-level talent (i.e., flexibility). Learn what motivates those groups and implement tactics to reward and retain those levels. Many who join Edelman would consider a longer career with the company if rewards and retention were important at all levels.

review.title: “If PR is your calling, Edelman is the place to be!”
review.pros: Pros – The top 5 reasons to join Edelman are:- Global exposure & best practices- Excellent Career Opportunities- Always attracts the world's best clients to work with- An Industry Paymaster- Employee Friendly HR PoliciesPublic Relations is a local business, FOR MOST AGENCIES. Edelman de-mystifies such perceptions about the business and provides an opportunity to excel and DO MORE THAN JUST MEDIA RELATIONS.Edelman has been a world leader from quite sometime and for some very good reasons. Thanks to their outstanding HR approach, they end up attracting not just the best talent in a marketplace but also the best employees which gives you another reason to work for the firm.
review.cons: Cons – It is only a PR agency
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Edelman has some fantastic values, keep up the great heritage going!

review.title: “Fantastic!”
review.pros: Pros – The fact that Edelman encourages learnings by introducing, sharing and implementing insights to the public relations profession, makes it an ideal company to grow, personally and professionally.
review.cons: Cons – There are absolutely no cons. For the family man and the family woman, the challenge would be to maintain an ideal work life balance, otherwise it's a great place to work at.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Working hours are crazy but it is normal in agency life however the management should implement a system where employees who are raising a family should be allowed to work from home on selected days for time close with their families.

review.title: “Fun, creative, exciting. Highly digitally integrated and always on the edge of the latest in communications”
review.pros: Pros – Great environment, immense learning, digitally integrated
review.cons: Cons – None really. Upto you how far you can go within the company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep the people focus and great work will continue to happen.

review.title: “Good but tough”
review.pros: Pros – Good way to get plenty of experience, and fast! Friendly colleagues and cool team.
review.cons: Cons – Work-life balance leaves much to be desired and salary could be better.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Excellent”
review.pros: Pros – Varied experiences, great mentors and team work
review.cons: Cons – Low salaries, perhaps too stuck to maintaining structure
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Learned A Lot”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to put your foot in the door of PR
review.cons: Cons – Feedback needs to be prompt and not said behind the employees back
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Value employees at all levels (especially those in Levels 1-3)

review.title: “Great company to work and grow with.”
review.pros: Pros – Open door policy, suggest new ideas and then shepherd them to fruition. A constant quest for knowledge is a good quality to have at Edelman. Being independent and not owned by a publicly traded company allows for an ability to be relatively nimble and able to adopt new practices quickly.
review.cons: Cons – As with any large agency, there are pitfalls and the usual issues.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Wonderful employees, horrendous leadership”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman people are hardworking, brilliant, dedicated, creative and live to exceed client's expectations on a daily basis.
review.cons: Cons – Senior leadership only know how to whip the donkeys to "make the numbers." HR practices do not protect employees from harassment. Exiting the company gracefully can be a big challenge. And, they are famous for not listening to feedback and ducking for cover when issues arise.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Wake up and start leading from a 21st century paradigm. Practice what you preach: "Trust is everything." Make it so.

review.title: “Great place”
review.pros: Pros – Wonderful atmosphere to work in
review.cons: Cons – Not enough time to enjoy the building

review.title: “A very good company and environment”
review.pros: Pros – Amiable and reasonable colleaguesVery good payVaried workload
review.cons: Cons – Some of the staff are more obstructive than contributive in nature, mostly fine however. Apart from that no extra cons that don't naturally come with working in PR
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Encourage more readily the blue skies thinking that comes from the excellent creative sessions- strict clients often respect the views of such a well renowned company; there's not reason to hold back critiquing some of their preconceptions in fear of losing business.

review.title: “Working in an ever changing and exciting environment”
review.pros: Pros – Top notch people, great collaboration, team effort and flexibility, entrepreneur spirit with professional growth opportunities
review.cons: Cons – Keeping the work/life balance is tricky - too many decision makers. Too many last minute demands that are urgent
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give up control and allow people to develop and shine. Keep the employee appreciation going and make it viral

review.title: “Have learned a lot but limited growth opportunities over time”
review.pros: Pros – Committed, hard-working colleagues who are eager to perform and do great work
review.cons: Cons – Office politics, once reach upper levels limited opportunities for career development, internal creative services are sub-par and expensive
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Focus and stick with a long-term strategy rather than changing models every year; reduce number of internal initiatives, committees and sub-committees

review.title: “Excellent training program but total waste of good talent; myopic management and ineffectual HR”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman's training program is first-rate. There are online trainings and in-person workshops for all employees, and more rigorous training offerings for managers. Like anywhere else, if you are lucky enough to have a good manager, they will protect you and give you a good chance to thrive in your role. If you wind up with a client you're excited about, the work has the potential make you feel inspired and fulfilled.
review.cons: Cons – The positive reviews on this Web site are so rosy, it makes this former employee wonder whether Edelman mounted a campaign to whitewash its GlassDoor profile.For a company that purports to be at the cutting edge of business communication, the actual staffing model is completely inadequate. Edelman is the stingiest company I've ever worked for, paying low salaries for work that is highly valued elsewhere. Any employee who leaves is likely to discover this almost immediately. Not even the first-rate training program makes up for that.Moreover, Edelman's top management is constantly squeezing more work particularly from junior staff, and tightening the screw further every quarter. In an effort to be as profitable as possible, most accounts lean heavily on junior people with only the token involvement of senior staff. It's common for the average foot-soldier within Edelman to be working on 4-6 accounts. It is not an environment conducive to high-quality work, rather it encourages middling work and is a surefire way to burn out staff and cause heavy turnover, which is exactly what happens. The junior staff bear the brunt of the belt-tightening but never benefit from it, as they usually burn out and leave long before they become a Vice President or above, the only positions eligible for the company's bonus program.Teams are not truly multi-disciplinary, because it would be more expensive to staff teams that way. There is an over-emphasis on traditional media relations skills, insufficient screening for basic writing skills, and no training whatsoever in graphic design or video production. The only exception is social media skills, which Edelman has attempted to diffuse throughout the organization with a unique training program. Unfortunately even the most embarrassingly basic social media programs are priced too high to be useful to most clients. The result is that for all but the major accounts, the company's services can seem a bit limited and behind the times.The culture at Edelman is uneven, with scattered safe havens and many hornets' nests. People who thrive in a highly politicized environment will move up quickly, regardless of their actual talent. You could spend years climbing this ladder, or just leave and move up much more quickly elsewhere.My advice to prospective employees: if the job appeals to you, if you really click with the interview team and if you can confirm that these will be the people you will be working with, it could be a good situation. Then stay long enough to learn the ropes and form some good relationships. But don't stay too long, because you are sure to be valued more elsewhere in the end.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Completely rethink your treatment of the human beings in your company.

review.title: “Progressive in due course”
review.pros: Pros – Brand name, best clients to work on and cooperative environment
review.cons: Cons – Lacks efficient distribution of work amongst all teams n practices
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need more organized structure to help all employees gain exposure

review.title: “I love it here.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a place to build a thriving career. The culture is entrepreneurial, spirited, hardworking and (almost always) fun. The company rewards intelligence, creativity, innovation and high ethics. I've been on board six years and continue to learn new things and be given new opportunities every day. It's the right agency for a self-starter who wants to be at the leading edge of communications, marketing and media.
review.cons: Cons – It's entrepreneurial and fast-moving, and involvement in agency initiatives, beyond the client work, is really encouraged. While there are plenty of flex programs for telecommuters, parents, part-time work, etc, and a healthy respect for balance, it's just not a place for a 9 to 5'er.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – We need to stay lean, creative and competitive because now that we're #1 we have a big red target on our backs.

review.title: “Love it here!”
review.pros: Pros – Great people, great culture, good pay and benefits. Leads the pack in PR firms.
review.cons: Cons – Intense environment is not for everybody.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Nurturing company filled with extremely smart, creative people”
review.pros: Pros – Family owned company, independent PR firm, individual support, great career options throughout the company, very smart and creative people
review.cons: Cons – Only if you don't think you'd fit in a large company
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The annual raise structure is just too small. Last year despite good performance, company growth, my raise was under 2%, and I started just a little too late to be eligible for a bonus. But I don't think you should put it ALL in the bonus category.

review.title: “A great place to learn, grow and work with the best of the best.”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients, strong leadership, focus on an entrepreneurial spirit that supports and rewards employees who define their role and path with the company.
review.cons: Cons – Still needs to build capabilities and offerings around formalized coaching and development and sustainability initiatives. Total compensation package is average at best.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Formalize and build rigor around coaching and development. "Walk the talk" on sustainability company-wide.

review.title: “Smart and Driven Agency”
review.pros: Pros – - Smart and driven employees- Great human resources department- Thoughtful professional development program- Global resources and colleagues
review.cons: Cons – - Average pay- Can get lost in the crowd- Junior-level heavy
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend – I'm optimistic about the outlook for this company

review.title: “Edelman is a great company”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman takes the time to really understand what it needs to do to take care of its people, clients and business. Because the company is private, it doesn't chase the stock price which really allows it to focus on what's best for business. Edelman is also focused on how the market is changing, and making sure it is poised for the future.
review.cons: Cons – Like any PR firm, the hours are long and it is difficult to find time to have a personal life.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take into account the hours you're asking people to put in and offer encouragement.

review.title: “amazing people, amazing work”
review.pros: Pros – top-notch clients and talented people in every corner of the company; executives on the front lines of client work and trends leading the industry
review.cons: Cons – in general, PR agency work can be stressful and hard to achieve a work life balance -- but Edelman does a great job of helping employees achieve it
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – continue to be transparent in business practices and decisions; get employees even more involved in the direction of the business

review.title: “Smart, though sometimes too aggressive, PR Firm”
review.pros: Pros – Market leading accounts to work onSmart people, stong desire to be at the forefront of the PR industrySolid training and employee evaluation programsOpportunities to get involved in new bizNever boring
review.cons: Cons – Expectations make work/life balance a challengeOver allocation happens frequently, since no time is officially reserved for management of personnel, required internal work or new businessQuality of managers varies - as with all companies I suppose - some are so busy with new business and account work that no quality time can be spared for management
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Give people time to learn, manage and work on new business, instead of adding that requirement to the expectation that everyone is also 100% allocated to current accounts

review.title: “Need to have extreme self-drive and patience to strive for basic resources and award for performance”
review.pros: Pros – Not a very aggressive working culture; people are nice to work with in general; some good chances to work on big accounts
review.cons: Cons – incentives for performance come slow or no show, cinsistently high turnover, sometimes an unhealthy or imbalance mix of local and non-local staff which does not match with client portfolios, job assignments tend to be ad hoc by task instead of by project, level of actual responsibilities often goes beyond 1-3 levels of JD
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It is perhaps sensible to make local employees to see and feel that they are rewarded and valued especially when it's time the economy is not so much favorable to regional but local biz development

review.title: “You need to have load of patience and self-initiatives to strive for basic resources and possible reward for performance”
review.pros: Pros – not a very aggressive working culture overall, a comfortable workplace for communications practitioners who enjoy working on the strategic level/strategic type of work which involves minimal execution work, people are generally nice to work with, high level of job security for those who are not productive but at starting to medium level
review.cons: Cons – consistently high turnover while replacement process often takes over a quarter to happen, job assignments are quite ad hoc and by task instead of by project, very different arrangements/ expectations for local and non-local employees, level of responsibilities often goes 1-3 levels of staff grade while pay for performance is not well in place
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It is perhaps sensible to make local employees to see and feel they are truly valued and rewarded for their contribution especially when the economy is not so much favorable for regional but local biz development and growth. Be realistic about what can be offered/proposed to clients (i.e. don't claim you have a specific practice and offerings when there is not even a practice lead to drive and develop the functions and fundamental network essential to the deal)

review.title: “Good name, smart people, but political"”
review.pros: Pros – Big name clients. Smart people. Great agency that many people have heard of.
review.cons: Cons – Younger employees have to fight for raises. Movement within the company not as easy as is leadership says it is.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – To retain talent, realize when junior staff deserves promotions and help them in their career PATH, not just their current job title.

review.title: “Great Intern Experience - Terrible HR/Recruiting arm”
review.pros: Pros – - Great experience as an intern with wide-ranging duties, interesting projects and big brand clients- Richard Edelman is an amazing CEO- Offices were really nice with a rooftop deck and nice perks in free Starbucks-A+ name on your resume
review.cons: Cons – Almost none of the interns from my class were hired, and very poor communication from HR. There's a certain arrogance here, and it's really sad considering it's an amazing agency. Having interviewed and worked with recruiters at different big agencies, it's obvious Edelman HR doesn't care about people and a stand-up hiring process - they do what is most convenient for them, even if it means ignoring communication from candidates. That may work well given the current unemployment rate, but it attaches a certain stigmatism to your company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do something about your recruiting and HR, or you'll lose talent.

review.title: “Fantastic & fun place to work where real opportunities are given, but hours are long and pay is low.”
review.pros: Pros – Global agency with incredible list of clients. Great people, all of whom are very competent and driven. It is fun and full of young people. There is a real push for people to learn and take on as much responsibility as they feel fit.
review.cons: Cons – Resourcing is a constant problem. As with all agencies, the salaries are not high especially if they are put in relation to the number of hours spent in the office.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Pay more attention to people. Winning new business is only one part of a successful company.

review.title: “Good exposure, smart people, entrepreneurial, creative”
review.pros: Pros – High profile clientsFast paced and constantly changing - lots of chances to learnYoung smart team co-workersFew constraints/rulesClient servicing roles offer career prospects
review.cons: Cons – Profit first, people afterHigh turnover and hiring in hastePolitics takes over good work/recognitionNo time for training as deadlines and demands take all the working time
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Make your leaders more accountable for change and improvementListen to your staff - give them credit for good ideas

review.title: “True PR company”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to learn what PR is.
review.cons: Cons – Puppy mill for PR heads.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show more interest in the individual employees career.

review.title: “Good learning. Definitely overworked.”
review.pros: Pros – A lot of great people and good work being done.
review.cons: Cons – Underpaid and overworked. Can be very frustrating.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take the time to worry about what junior level employees want. Offer incentives.

review.title: “Appreciation goes a long way...”
review.pros: Pros – Flexibility around working remotely is great. Decent benefits. Good clients and good people to work with.
review.cons: Cons – Too much politics, title importance. Work, life balance does not exist. Admin staff is not treated with respect. Raises and promotions are very slow. Expectations are set high, but compensation is not at current job market rates.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Management needs to realize that there are many hardworking individuals that have dedicated allot of time to this company to reach the level of recognition Edelman has all over the world. Unfortunately the current compensation structure benefits senior management, but does not compensate lower levels at reasonable salaries due to the strong focus on profitability and meeting financial goals.

review.title: “I love this job!”
review.pros: Pros – -Senior Management is very accessible and easy to approach-Tons of opportunities for career development-Amazingly talented co-workers-Beautiful office space-Tons of creativity and news ideas
review.cons: Cons – -Can be high stress (is fast paced)-Can be a bit clique-ish. but in general the people are great
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior Management is amazing!!!

review.title: “Best choice among PR agencies”
review.pros: Pros – Independent, family-run companyOpportunity to do what you want and chart your own courseFlexibility around time off for family and health issuesLoyalty to long-time employeesMarquee clients and very smart employees
review.cons: Cons – Persistent compensation issue at all levels that is detrimental to existing and future staffInternal politics that make it difficult to achieve client goals at timesRetention of problem employees despite volumes of evidence, perhaps a consequence of above-referenced loyalty
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Please address the compensation issue, don't just keep saying there's an issue and take no decisive action. It's difficult for us as managers and employees.

review.title: “Entrepreneurial environment that breeds innovation, healthy competitiveness and continual learning”
review.pros: Pros – Having the ability to work with highly talented and seasoned communications professionals. Culture of independence fosters innovation and risk taking.
review.cons: Cons – As the firm grows keeping its nimbleness and identity as an entrepreneurial firm.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Assessing the temperature of employees at every level to ensure we're able to attract and retain top talent.

review.title: “Fantastic place to work, with a clear company vision, great clients, and very capable staff at all levels”
review.pros: Pros – Fantastic opportunities to work with some great consumer and corporate brands on interesting projects, very capable management at all levels, decent pay, days in lieu offered readily for working long hours or on the weekend, and a clearly articulated company vision bringing the company together.
review.cons: Cons – Employees often work long hours, not a great pension scheme, quite a top heavy structure - there is a lack of junior support staff, and senior staff often have difficulty in pushing back on clients resulting in unrealistic deadlines and over servicing.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Move to a bit more of a pyramid structure where there is a decent number of junior support staff, and try pushing back on clients. We should be offering strategic counsel and not necessarily doing every single thing they ask us to do.

review.title: “Innovative, fast-paced and fun”
review.pros: Pros – Innovation, strong culture, underdog mentality
review.cons: Cons – Global integration of tools and skills needs work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Spend more time with global offices

review.title: “I work with smart, capable people who work really hard and demand excellence.”
review.pros: Pros – Excellence, Independent, progressive, Entrepeneurial, Global, the leader in its field, pushes the envelope with innovation and new thinking in redefining PR and marketing overall.
review.cons: Cons – level of Intensity, demanding, some politics.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It is a place for entreprenuerial people to dive in and thrive, progressing as aggressively as you are able to manage.”
review.pros: Pros – Amazing people who are crazy smart, creative and an entire team excited to pitch in where neededOpportunities offered based on capability and merit, not just the time spent paying your duesEncourages people to drive new ways of thinking, new offerings and capabilities
review.cons: Cons – Being part of a medium-sized digital agency within the biggest global PR agency can offer non-stop opportunities with clients, but also can be a heavy weight on relatively few digital team members in comparison to the company at-large to address everything of interest to the PR businesses.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “If you're smart, hungry and want to elevate and drive your profession forward...Edelman's the place for you.”
review.pros: Pros – --Smartest, most dedicated people in the industry who are in PR for the right reasons and genuninely believe in the tenets convening transparent, honest debate and engagement to drive client agenda forward.--Private firm with leadership committed to truly great work, not just great quarterly margins.
review.cons: Cons – --For some, a culture where doing average or status quo work is seen as failure is not for them.--Executives are not allowed to rest on laurels and exalted hierarchy is not tolerated. Execs are all required to be hands-on and 'doing' the work, not directly.--I see these as HUGE positives, but I've had colleagues, new hires and recruits say that these are cons. Those folks tend to not last long.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up what you're doing and don't let success go to your head. Stay hungry, focused on doing the BEST work in the industry and we'll continue to be the biggest. Dan Edelman said it first, but it's more true every day the bigger and better we get. Easier to say when you were challenging the 'big' guys.

review.title: “One of the best decisions I've made -- great mentors and friends, true innovation, smart industry leaders”
review.pros: Pros – --Smart, dedicated, innovative professionals--Strong and interconnected network of global colleagues--Broad opportunities--Resources such as attentive IT dept--Reputation--Benefits package
review.cons: Cons – --Our company is not necessarily best for those who are seeking a smaller agency or fewer colleagues; some have an inclination toward smaller, though the benefits of a strong network should be considered
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Edelman attracts the best and the brightest individuals in the PR field; many of whom I'm lucky to work with.”
review.pros: Pros – - The people/staff; creative individuals with a broad range of talents/backgrounds- Access to resources and intellectual property- Broad portfolio of high-profile clients
review.cons: Cons – - Favoritism- Inconsistencies in growth opportunities (sometimes promotions are awarded based on individual team needs vs. job performance)- Sometimes I feel like I work for my clients, not for Edelman
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – - Eliminate favoritism- Take a hard look at people who are rising to the top - make sure they aren't getting there by stepping on other people

review.title: “Consistent progress”
review.pros: Pros – Employee respect, good benefits, privately-owned
review.cons: Cons – At times feels like many little companies cobbled together rather than a holistic company.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – More consistency in communication from top leadership to local leadership.

review.title: “Great place to work, keep your eyes open for political pitfalls”
review.pros: Pros – entrepreneurial environment; fast-paced; ability work with the biggest, best clients in your field with some of the smartest people in the industry
review.cons: Cons – A driven staff can lead to some uncomfortable political situations. I wouldn't go as far as to say cut-throat, but close. Pets of group leadership tend to get better account choices, more opportunities for new business and career growth and faster promotions.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There are a few accounts in my department (and probably in all of them) that have a truly awful reputation. It might be time to have a look at why no one wants to work on those teams and make some changes.

review.title: “A great global agency to work for with reasonable hours for PR, but expect the other pros and cons of any large agency.”
review.pros: Pros – Reputation of agency, opportunity to work on well-known clients with large budgets, knowledge sharing within and between offices, interesting intellectual property, reasonable hours and salary in comparison to other large agencies, great benefits, some of your coworkers will be friendly and very smart, and some of your managers will be great leaders and truely advocate for you
review.cons: Cons – A lot of politics, hierarchical, coworkers can be extremely competitive, little flexibility in what accounts and tactics you get to work on (even when you have put in your time)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Be more transparent, remember to work with your junior staff so they understand how their day-to-day work is impacting a larger strategic initiative

review.title: “it was ok, some stuff left a bad taste in my mouth”
review.pros: Pros – they have got a great eye for detail, high standards, offer opportunities to grow,
review.cons: Cons – as a very junior employee, I was exhausted, long hours are expected. I had just started and yet they do not give staff teething time to settle in, one feels they are already being discussed at the coffee table by peers/ managers. Some of the tasks are very dull and they pounce on juniors with free time to get their tasks done. seemed a bit cuthroat in some instances. Cliquey. There are people there in their early 30s who have been there since their early twenties and probably on over inflated salaries, very nervous that juniors should pull their weight.The economic downturn has made them nervous. Shame I left as I learnt a lot of good stuff but in the long run...it was not a good fit in terms of lifestyle or long run feel good organisation with a creative thought process and supportive learning culture at its heart.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be more flexible, and supportive of juniors. Strip top level of so many overpaid managers. actually let staff leave at 5.30. They might actually be more creative. There was an element of big brother is watching which annoyed me. One had to report their every movement to the entire dept and junior staff are often managed by very young staff themselves who are insecure and put undue pressure on their subordinates.

review.title: “Outstanding”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly environment, good place to learn, competitive salary, Strong connectivity between employee, Big companies as your clients make you trained to be a good leader
review.cons: Cons – Sometimes too much workload. Over all I am satisfied to work at Edelman because it gives me a lot of good things for my career in the future.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Very interesting company with a range of amazing clients”
review.pros: Pros – people are fantastic; very intelligent, very friendly and the working atmosphere is brilliant. the accounts are varied and there is scope to go far.
review.cons: Cons – the pay is atrocious for the work done. regular working late to meet client deadlines with no reward other than a thanks from your boss
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – everyone loves the company but given amount clients pay, many employees aren't paid nearly enough for the work they do.

review.title: “Great independent PR company, nice family feel without the corporate restraints.”
review.pros: Pros – Great perks, promotion opportunities, global relocation available.
review.cons: Cons – Longer hours, but flexibility makes up for it.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “An inspiring company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – There is great leadership at Edelman
review.cons: Cons – You do work hard, but you also get to play hard
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – -

review.title: “Hot and Cold”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people to work with, big-name clients - especially in the consumer, digital and health practices, fast pace and innovative programs keeps people sharp as it relates to work skills, starting to develop a global rotation program for mid-level staff
review.cons: Cons – Under pay their talent, seemingly little to no pushback on demanding/unreasonabe clients, work/life balance hard to acheive, still a bit of a "mean" workplace culture, although they are trying to address it (slow progress)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Better value your talent - if salaries can't be higher, build in other perks/benefits that will help keep talent happy. More formal flex hours; WFH; job sharing opportunities; etc.

review.title: “Great fun. Like a roller-coaster be prepared for ups and downs”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman attracts great talent so it's a fun, lively and dynamic place to work. Edelman also attracts big, global clients, leaders in their field making it an exciting yet challenging environment. It can be thrilling and massivley frustrating in equal measures. Things change on a daily basis.
review.cons: Cons – Many managers (junior to senior levels) are too caught up making their own name to think about team work and support and this creates alot of tension. Pace is fast which means decisions are not always well thought through. A lot of important decisions are made solely on gut instrinct.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Support the talent better. Care a bit more. Think things through. Don't over intellectualise

review.title: “fun place”
review.pros: Pros – the people are amazing. They keep me coming back for more. The room for growth is important and the career paths here are solid
review.cons: Cons – Some of the upper level staff are not self-sufficient. The junior staff really run the office. The work life balance is not ideal
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “A Great Name for the Resume”
review.pros: Pros – Dynamic organization. Management did a terrific job managing the economic downturn. Impressed by tenure of senior executives and name recognition of the firm.
review.cons: Cons – Politics can be a bit too much. Too much effort spent on another internal committee.

review.title: “A great agency to work for....if only I was given a fair compensation.”
review.pros: Pros – - Entrepreneurial spirit and ability to try new things- Strong areas of specialization- Solid senior membership team (Directors and above, in HK)- Good IP (Trust) and innovative approach to PR that pushes the whole industry further (Public Engagement)- Good work atmosphere
review.cons: Cons – - low compensations (in my case, outrageously low)- limited benefits (healthcare insurance is not up to industry standards)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Re-assess the compensation scheme at Edelman HK otherwise risks of losing best people to other PR firms

review.title: “It was an amazing learning experience, but a very tough and cut-throat atmosphere.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman allows young workers an amazing experience in PR. Starting ones career at Edelman helps young professionals truly learn about the PR industry and have ample client facing interactions.
review.cons: Cons – It has a very "revolving door" feeling. In other words, it is difficult to feel as though ones work is truly being appreciated.

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – - great resources- young, vibrant staff- interesting client work
review.cons: Cons – - favoritism amongst senior management
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “great place to start”
review.pros: Pros – We have an intimate staff in the Barcelona office which encourages support and trust. One of the greatest resources within the company are the learning tools available to us by Edelman University.
review.cons: Cons – The Spanish office does not pay well or offer benefits like some of the other offices.
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Overworked and still expected to do more. Highly political and very 'clique'ish'”
review.pros: Pros – Has the reputation of being a good company to work for
review.cons: Cons – Junior staff get more than 6 accounts at any one time and co. still expect good work. Bosses give only lip service to problem but keep adding work such as internal projects and new business on top of work. There is always an excuse but never an excuse to help me. Am let down by promises. CEs who stay late and kiss up to bosses get favouritism. Feedback goes nowhere. Don't want people to make mistake of working here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do something about the lip service. Can't see a career here anymore.

review.title: “great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – tons of opportunities, entrepreneurial, smart colleagues
review.cons: Cons – a bit chaotic, lacking process, challenges with compensation
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Good place, hard to navigate”
review.pros: Pros – Engaged senior leadershipMakes strategic investmentsGood environmentCentral office locationSmart colleagues and good appreciation from the groupFor agency life its pretty decent
review.cons: Cons – Benefits are not as good as previous agency, have to pay part of healthcare costs.Wages are average for the agency world but not competitive with in-house pay.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Do an audit and do cost of living increases for everyone. Also, training programs could be better. More in person less digital

review.title: “My overall experience has been positive.”
review.pros: Pros – Independence, Senior Management, Client Service
review.cons: Cons – Salaries are not competitive with other PR firms
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Employees are motivated by financial compensation. I've seen very talented and qualified employees leave because they were not properly compensated.

review.title: “There is no proper work/life balance.”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has a great reputation and many big clients come to the company for that reason.
review.cons: Cons – They squeeze every ounce of work out of you, but the salaries are really poor. Also, there seem sto be no flrmula as to how and why they issue spot bonuses.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Manage your teams. You should neer be too busy to work with team members. And reward your employees!

review.title: “Excellent”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people, good office environment
review.cons: Cons – Competitive, salaries are not that high
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Friendly yet competitive environment with several professional growth opportunities.”
review.pros: Pros – Several professional growth opportunities. Friendly colleagues. Experienced colleagues and resources to draw from. Promotes work/life balance.
review.cons: Cons – While a work/life balance is promoted, it is hard to do. Possible career paths overwhelming to new comers. Day-to-day account positions have little to no contact with upper management - I know they work on accounts and the company, however I'm not sure what they actually do.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – I think it would be helpful to have creative and fun bonding opportunities within offices. My former company had gatherings, tournaments, etc. for bonding time for just about every minor holiday or event (i.e. put-put course design and putting contest for the Masters, haunted house and costume party for Halloween, Track and field day, etc.) I could really see a difference in the team dynamic after these occassions and our team ran a lot smoother than what I have noticed at Edelman thus far.Second, I would like to say that I chose to work at Edelman because I hold the company in high regards. I am getting paid significantly lower than what I was offered at other companies. If Edelman could at least match other offers in the area, I think Edelman could attract and retain talent better.

review.title: “Get ready to lose part of your life”
review.pros: Pros – - name and good reputation of the brand- good company to start out to build foundation in PR skills
review.cons: Cons – - lack of work/life balance- people get brainwashed about how great this company is (it's good, but not the best at everything), especially when they first start out in the industry here- no transparency in career advancement- set in process - lots of people in management inflexible to other ways of doing things- some people get treated better- company is very bad at communicating internally (quite an irony for a PR firm)- managers expect junior staff to do everything and they just "review"- company doesn't give much room for mistakes
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Wake up and smell the coffee - you are not always the bestPay more attention to junior staff - they do most of the work and are always under-appreciatedDon't force people to do things that they don't want to do - e.g. attend company functions that don't make them feel involved.

review.title: “For a time, It was a terrific place to visit but not a place to live...”
review.pros: Pros – It is a marque name in the PR field; Edelman is to PR what Rolls-Royce is to cars. There is no shortage of communications offerings; from crisis and issues management, CSR to branding and digital, it is certainly "one-stop shopping" with quality, ingenious work all around. With it being a privately held company, there's no worries about dividends, superfluous buzz from NYSE analysts and the like; focus can be devoted to enhancing existing relationships with clients and new business prospects.
review.cons: Cons – The first area of improvement is eliminating the "office politics" and keeping the egos of senior-level people in check...if that's even possible (also, some leaders just need to "toughen up" their pain tolerances more). Edelman has brilliant people at the helms of many practice groups but are not always "generous" to their support staff. They should go beyond minimum 3% increases and try making bigger spot bonuses more regular -- you'd be amazed at what those little things will do for morale. Some executives and account staff take a dismal, almost dismissive view to administrative professionals. I feel that if some had it their way, they would have the secretarial pool enter the offices through a back door not unlike the servants during the Antebellum South. Another area of improvement -- from top leadership down to mid-level -- is to ease up on or outright eradicate petty issues with colleagues on a daily basis or during the annual reviews; going a full year without bringing up any areas for improvement and then bombarding your reviewees with numerous flaws is just poor form. There will be days that go well and some will be better than others; that said, you -- like every living, mortal human being -- have to just roll with the punches and deal. It may be beneficial for Edelman -- and perhaps other companies -- to foster a culture of modesty and humility to some extent.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's simple. Your job does have some stressful days and clients are NOT always reasonable (remember: they give you the six-seven figure budgets that partially feed your salary and you don't need a MBA from Harvard to know that) but do remember that all these pressures came with your highly exalted titles, yearly bonuses, offices with lovely window views and all the other sundry perks...not to mention paychecks that subsidize driving fancy Japanese or European cars, summer homes, exotic vacations, designer handbags and jewelry and living a life that many in this world don't have. Bottom line: just try to keep all things in perspective on a daily basis. Another thing: admin support in all it's forms -- secretaries, IT support, office services -- play a vital daily role in making the lives of staff quite comfortable and that needs to be remembered. Otherwise, your workdays would be considerably longer...and, dare I say it, the mortality rate would be higher!

review.title: “Overall a good way to work. Salary somewhat low, good benefits/PTO, training, opportunities to advance”
review.pros: Pros – -Company seems to care about employees-Lots of training programs-Management is fairly transparent about state of company-Company has long term vision
review.cons: Cons – -Salaries are on the lower end-Office politics/relationships can play a part in promotion/advancement-Workload gradually increasing as company works to become more profitable - but no equivalent raise in salary
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Good work overall.

review.title: “Environment Fosters Learning and Growth”
review.pros: Pros – - Collaborative atmosphere- Forward thinking- Actively listens to needs/requests of employees- Provides opportunity to work on big clients- Ability to test new waters, transition teams and interests if desired- Global company
review.cons: Cons – - Work/Life balance isn't top priority for all senior management- There is a constant focus on new business when there should be attention to current clients
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “great experience!”
review.pros: Pros – access to leadership, growth opportunities, nice culture, great people
review.cons: Cons – poor compensation relative to industry
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – cutting down on meeting times

review.title: “Overworked, under valued, top brass ridicules staff with silly nicknames”
