review.pros: Pros – 1) Claiming taxi fare to and from work. Claiming dinner if you work past 7.2) Learning to call people names3) Being a client as you can bully the staff into submission4) Interns
review.cons: Cons – 1) Being pushed around and ridiculed2) Lousy processes3) Very long hours
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – None that they will listen to.

review.title: “Many opportunities if you are willing to overlook the poor moral ethics of the leadership team.”
review.pros: Pros – Great reputation in the industryHigh profile clients and a lot of varietyOpportunity to work in different locationsGreat place to work for junior and mid-level staff
review.cons: Cons – Incredibly political and a true "good-ole-boys" networkNot a lot of advancement for women at the very top, unless you compromise your moralsMoney is everything to Edelman and client loyalty is based on client budget, if a client's competitor has a bigger budget, Edelman has no problem switching sides
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Start including more women in leadership positions, when Pam Talbot left, the female voice was wiped out at Edelman. Also provide advanced ethical training for leadership on workplace affairs, nepatism and highly unmoral behavior at the top.

review.title: “Great company, but long hours”
review.pros: Pros – Exciting workBig clientsGood leadershipGreat atmosphereVery creative staff
review.cons: Cons – Long, long hoursPay is below market rateSometimes poor communication between different teams
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Overall Satisfied”
review.pros: Pros – Good benefits for an agencyOpportunity for growthOpportunity to work abroadThought leadership by senior management
review.cons: Cons – BureaucracyVPs with questionable competancyRetention of managers who cause turnover of junior team members
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – It's ok not to grow every quarter or every year. Focusing on employee retention, satisfaction and work-life balance at your company is also an accomplishment.

review.title: “pretty ok”
review.pros: Pros – good HR people at the time
review.cons: Cons – no work life balance. employees stay late almost every day
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more communication

review.title: “A good balance between work & home.”
review.pros: Pros – GREAT coworkers. The company knows how to find friendly and intelligent people who help you get the job done.There are a lot of projects one can work on to improve knowledge in one's given field.A great work environment for employees. The company does find ways to put together outside entertainment to keep the work/life balance in check.This is also a company that is excellent at keeping their employees updated with what is happening.Work from home is very acceptable with mgmt, which is a great help to those with families!
review.cons: Cons – Cliq's are for high school, not corporations.Company can sometimes be reactive to problems instead of proactive.Mgmt needs to find a way to consolidate meetings. Many lengthy meetings cause employees to stay late in order to catch up on work.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to align employee pay better within accepted.As stated, meetings need to be shorter or consolidated to help employees from working long nights.

review.title: “Excellent company to work for”
review.pros: Pros – This is a company that offers a number of ways to continue to grow and build professional skills that are transferrable
review.cons: Cons – Very fast paced environment which sometimes can play with work life balance but that can be discussed with management per employee
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Communicate singular messages to all employees; thank you for including all levels in major office and company decisions; good place for advancement

review.title: “Enlightening”
review.pros: Pros – Lots of collaborative efforts, work with excellent companies such as Starbucks and G20
review.cons: Cons – Low pay for interns and most PR specialists especially living in a large city like Seoul
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Always be organized

review.title: “A Solid Company”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients, good training programs for junior and mid-level staff
review.cons: Cons – Separate P and Ls for each office and division increase competition internally and at senior management levels there is less cooperation
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “It's ok.”
review.pros: Pros – Meet good clients ,know how PR works,good work environment.
review.cons: Cons – a little boring if you meet a client with tons of requirments
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – more serious management and rules, more communication with stuff, get interns involved.

review.title: “Good experience”
review.pros: Pros – Great on resume, great in getting interviews other places
review.cons: Cons – Work their employees until the last drop!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Promote more from within.

review.title: “Working at Edelman Digital is great.”
review.pros: Pros – Knowledge sharing is a culture. The company cares about your growth.
review.cons: Cons – Not too many cons. It gets busy at times, but which agency doesn't right?
review.advice-to-management: Yes, I would recommend this company to a friend

review.title: “Overworked and underpaid. They can't afford to pay you more until you tell them you're leaving.”
review.pros: Pros – Smart people. World class clients. Well respected within the PR/Digital industry. Some real thought-leaders work for Edelman Digital. Great resume builder.
review.cons: Cons – At times I had up to five clients to account for at once. They do not care about your work life balance, and they'll pile more and more work onto your plate if you let them. For junior level staff, they are willing to give you high levels of responsibility, but not willing to pay you accordingly. Know what you're worth - you can do better.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your employees fairly. It's as easy as that. The only people I know that LOVE working at Edelman Digital or Edelman in general are extremely Type A and don't care that their personal life and relationships suffer from this rat race job.

review.title: “Good, but could be better”
review.pros: Pros – This a challenging and rewarding place to work and out of all of the large agencies in the area I believe its the best.
review.cons: Cons – They need to do a better job rewarding employees who have put in time with the company. Salaries are not competitive and they almost force you to leave to make what you are worth.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – They need to spend more time retaining quality employees rather than assuming they are happy and focusing efforts on recruitment.

review.title: “Review”
review.pros: Pros – Great reputationGreat to have on your resumeGreat clientsSmart and sharp employeesHigh expectationsSometimes they know what they are doing
review.cons: Cons – Low low pay for interns, and fairly low pay for all others except highest managementNot entirely creative environmentFeedback is rare
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Treat your employees well and they will keep coming back. Don't underestimate the small things like a good break room, organized team building sessions, and your interns!

review.title: “A great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – You can chart your own course for career advancementThe organization is full of highly intelligent individuals
review.cons: Cons – At times the work load is overwhelming, yet highly rewarding.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to forge ahead on more aggressive management and leadership training. Make sure that it is substanative, the center of where we spring from and a committment of our firm for the long haul.

review.title: “From Intern to Assistant Account Executive - An Overall Great Experience”
review.pros: Pros – One of the reasons I love working for Edelman is their focus on nurturing talent within the company. As an intern I was amazing at the amount of training and knowledge sharing available to employees at all levels. It's a great company to work for straight out of college!
review.cons: Cons – Getting an interview for an agency of this caliber is incredibly competitive and I wish career counselors had stressed to me the importance of international work experience and language learning while I was in undergrad to prepare me for getting a job in this market.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Always be available for colleagues to ask you questions because that's how we learn and we won't grow as practitioners unless you guide us and teach us.

review.title: “Overall, a great place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – > Smart colleagues> Opportunity to work with great brands> Prestige of working for such a respected company in the industry> Fantastic intellectual property and visionary thinking> Terrific senior leadership> Excellent resources> Very good pay and benefits> Creative environment
review.cons: Cons – > Can be very competitive and snarky at times> Could be more progressive about flex time and telecommuting> Too much favoritism shown by some managers, resulting in unmerited promotions> Can be arrogant and dismissive when we don't agree with the observations of others> Not diverse enough> Probably too top heavy
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Quit rewarding bad behavior. Just because someone can bring in money shouldn't mean they get to abuse others in the process. There's some bullying behavior here that needs to stop, but it won't as long as we keep promoting people based on dollars instead of how they obtained those dollars.

review.title: “Edelman is a great place to grow!”
review.pros: Pros – Friendly colleagues, relaxed environment, casual dress code, strong employee recognition
review.cons: Cons – Starting salaries for entry level are low. (Not really a big deal, but apparently I have to type 5 words to submit this).
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't make it so easy for someone to get a job just because they "know someone". These are not always the best employees and you could be missing out on other great people.

review.title: “It's all about the people and the ideas”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman has the best, smartest, most creative and most fun/interesting people in the business. This place is dynamic, evolving, forward-looking and unafraid of taking risks on new ideas. The Exec Comm puts people and clients first and keeps a strong focus on growth, development, leading-edge thinking and quality. I can see why many very talented people are attracted here and end up staying a long time, which is the best job perk of all.
review.cons: Cons – All this entrepreneurialism can occasionally lead to new-idea overload, and you have to sort through what's really most important and how you can bring it to your clients.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Don't ever sell!

review.title: “Great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a rare company that values employees and treats me as an individual. They value my opinions and want to hear my ideas.
review.cons: Cons – So far, I haven't had a downside to working here.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Thank you for caring about your people.

review.title: “I'm a comeback kid”
review.pros: Pros – I worked here 10 years ago and came back after leaving for five years. I came back because the business had grown, many of the same clients were still here and growing, and staff I had hired had stepped up the ladder. It seemed to be on the right path, and I've been back now almost five years.
review.cons: Cons – You will never work as hard as you do here, but it is worth it on many levels. Just be ready to run (and learn and grow and have fun ...)
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Take a breath every now and then. We all need to.

review.title: “Great place to work (if you're fine with agency life).”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman places a heavy emphasis upon education and training, which is fantastic for more recent graduates. Edelman also prides itself upon being the "best in class," which means it is always at the forefront of the newest technologies and trends of information dissemination.
review.cons: Cons – Life at an agency means that the client's opinion very often guides what you do, regardless whether it results in the best work. The heavy emphasis upon client satisfaction may translate to longer hours and sometimes tedious work for presentation purposes.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Continue to foster the young adults that make up your workforce. With guidance, positive reinforcements and a chance to perform, they will naturally channel their thirst for achievement to benefit the company.

review.title: “A great place to work”
review.pros: Pros – I get to work with many smart and creative people and work on a variety of clients. The global network is an asset, both for information and for the potential of transferring.
review.cons: Cons – It's an agency, and they don't hire until we win the work so there are times when it's very busy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The entrepreneurial spirit is great, but we could benefit from having a few more processes and standards in place. I also wish we had a better intranet!

review.title: “AAE Review”
review.pros: Pros – People, Culture, Growth, Learning, YEAH
review.cons: Cons – Time, Work/Life Balance, Yep, yep
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Awkward question that I don't feel comfortable answering and will not use twenty words to complete thank you very much

review.title: “Not bad”
review.pros: Pros – the people, client exposure, flexibility, and team work is helpful and refreshing for an agency, but might be too caught up in the name.
review.cons: Cons – lack of work-life balance and some favoritism is a downer. some people ride a fast course while other people just as talented lag behind.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – be more cohesive and consistent with feedback; work with teams to determine best approach for success. not all teams function in the same way.

review.title: “No Work-Life Balance”
review.pros: Pros – Looks great on your resume
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, Very little feedback
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer better training for interns

review.title: “Spinning your wheels”
review.pros: Pros – You can get a lot of Edelman, if you choose, to especially to develop your own careers and new skill sets.
review.cons: Cons – Usually not interested in ideas outside of the status quo, a lot of back patting and self-congratulatory talk, not a lot willingness to think outside the box despite what they think. Focus is on upper level employees.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Offer more ownership opportunities to junior staff, otherwise employees will get bored and move elsewhere. Also, compensation is disappointing.

review.title: “Small thinking RFP Machine”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients and attractitve brand name
review.cons: Cons – Little to no career path. 90% of the business they win is on their name alone, but I rarely ever saw any innovative thinking. Human resources dept doesn't "get it." They cozy up to the old boy network and worry too much about what very junior staff think.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Encourage your people to be more entrepreneurial and don't turn major accounts over to 24 year old to do the same, tired, warmed-over tactical PPR work.

review.title: “Good company for young, scrappy PR pros”
review.pros: Pros – Visionary CEO. Great reputation. Respected in industry. Smart colleagues. Good compensation. Great clients. Interesting work. Nice facilities. Quality work. Impressive unique intellectual property. The company really encourages volunteerism and participating in the community.
review.cons: Cons – The company's lack of diversity is embarrassing. The 360 performance review system is ineffective. Bad behavior is tolerated as long as you're bringing in money. It's not always obvious how promotions are given. Too much competition and politics within teams.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep up the great visionary work and IP. Do a better job of attracting, developing and retaining minority employees. Quit tolerating abusive managers.

review.title: “One of the best agencies to work for”
review.pros: Pros – Great senior leadership, independent spirit, constantly innovates.
review.cons: Cons – As a very large agency, it can take some time to find a niche where you best fit. Overall managers are committed to helping you excel however.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep doing what you're doing.

review.title: “Good name on resume for aspiring PR professional”
review.pros: Pros – Recognized name in PRLarge, well-recognized clients means projects often have national or global scaleDepending on your specific division within the company, you may be exposed, even at the junior level , to client -facing roles.
review.cons: Cons – Level of competence varies amongst employees and managers: some are highly capable leaders while others seem to be merely adequate.The firm is plagued by the same issues that most PR firms encounter: high staff turnover, tensions between business development and delivering a consistently high-quality product.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Show more appreciation for the work doneHR process needs to be improved with respect to candidate evaluation and assessmentMinimize internal politics

review.title: “Excellent internship program”
review.pros: Pros – Great opportunity as an intern to learn the ins and outs of public relations.
review.cons: Cons – Being a large agency, I could see how it would become easy to get caught in the hierarchy.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Task interns with more meaningful work.

review.title: “Soulless corporate factory ridden with arrogance, selfishness and schemers”
review.pros: Pros – Excellent brand name (in terms of globally), wide range of Fortune 500 clients, fair pay in terms of the public relations industry
review.cons: Cons – Does not feel at all like a public relations firm- all employees sit in cubicles, there is hardly any interaction between them, virtually all staff except for IT and support staff are female- meaning there is an unnatural order of things and tensions run high virtually all the time. The corporate culture is such that competition amongst employees is unnaturally fierce and the atmosphere in the office is dry and unwelcoming. Promotions are determined via favouritism.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hire some men to do account work. Give promotions based on merit, not how good an employee is at flattery.

review.title: “Looks great on your resume, but don't expect a job”
review.pros: Pros – -As an intern, you are given a fair amount of responsibility-Great snacks/ice cream fridays!-Looks really good on your resume-You are doing relevant work, not just photo copying, etc.-Overtime pay
review.cons: Cons – -No positive feedback-Analysts are under a lot of pressure and stressed out, and its very obvious-As a result, they put a lot of needless pressure onto the interns-It's obvious that the interns are just in a rotation--they don't really plan to hire anyone, they're just using the interns for as work horses. Not a bad business model, given this economy, but definitely be aware.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – There is little to no feedback.

review.title: “EDELMAN”
review.pros: Pros – High quality of clients and work; many smart people, stong opportunities to forge own path, good infastructure
review.cons: Cons – politics, not good at keeping pace with industry salary, sr. management weak in some areas, bigh level of hubris
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to really make the "one" Edelman work, too much disparity b/t what Sr. Leadership says & what is actually done at the GM/DGM level & within the rank & file

review.title: “So so.”
review.pros: Pros – Great place to work. Well known company. Will look good on your resume and you will learn a lot of things.
review.cons: Cons – Too big of company so no real satisfactory of recognition which can be sad after working there for so long.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – they need to recognize employees more and promote more within or people will just keep on leaving the company, etc.

review.title: “Short time there but really good experience”
review.pros: Pros – Immediately part of the team and given important jobs to do involving interaction with clients. Invited to all meetings and involved with suggestions for forthcoming campaigns. Frequent interaction with senior staff through learning seminars for public relations.
review.cons: Cons – Pedantic in time keeping. A bit of an English native/ Japanese native divide within company. No other comments really, it was a really positive experience!
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – The Japanese section of the company is very efficiently run and a great environment to work in. Especially thought the PR seminars led by Bob Pickard (no longer in that office) were very helpful.

review.title: “Good place to work”
review.pros: Pros – You learn alot from really bright and driven people.
review.cons: Cons – there is the same corporate maze and game to play to get ahead, not always quality of work
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – increase pay

review.title: “Edelman Careerist”
review.pros: Pros – Desirable place to build a long career with a large number having been here 5+ years versus agency-hopping, a recognizable leader in communications, a lot of really smart people with diverse skill sets, an entrepreneurial environment that rewards people for being motivated to go the extra mile or discover the next big thing
review.cons: Cons – A competitive spirit that triggers long hours and desire to own ideas rather than more open collaboration
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Hiremore junior do-ers to help work under all the senior thinkers

review.title: “Not the place to start a career”
review.pros: Pros – Good work enviroment, certain perks were also nice.
review.cons: Cons – Too much worload, no real sense of upward career movement.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Put yourself in the shoes of the junior account staff before making decisions

review.title: “An eye opening experience to be a junior staffer”
review.pros: Pros – The mentoring progam allows you to learn more about the practices, clients and office politics without putting yourself in a compromising position. My supervisor is very aware of my workload and when things are piled, we communicate and adjust things so I'm not completely stressed out. The accounts I work on are far better than my peers at other agencies.
review.cons: Cons – The hierarchy and cliques can make it difficult for a junior staff member to speak out and work collaboratively with others. Also, the immediacy of certain client needs are usually not that immediate. Senior level employees tend to promise the client deliverables before consulting with the junior level staff who actually produce those deliverables and many times this puts pressure on the junior staff to work on tasks that are impossible to accomplish.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Senior level staff should remember what it was like for them to be at the bottom of the totem pole.

review.title: “A behemoth of a PR company makes little room for innovation and creativity”
review.pros: Pros – Edelman is a large company with many resources and a spectrum of high-recognition clients. As a private company, there is less of a "roller coaster" during economic downturn which translates into security for staffers. Edelman is very good at its core competencies - media pitching/placing/ tracking. The sense of hierarchy is minimized within the offices, junior and senior staffers work side by side.
review.cons: Cons – Edelman's specialty practices are weak and poorly structured. Upward mobility is difficult for those outside of the traditional institutional structure (if you're not a manager, you're not going anywhere). Notoriously cheap with employees and projects.
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Choose to be experts with our clients. They are hiring Edelman for our expertise yet too often we let the client dictate process and create problems. Too often, bad clients create bad work, a bad work environment and cost more than the monthly retainer is worth.

review.title: “Good place to work!”
review.pros: Pros – Talent, clients, best reputation in the industry
review.cons: Cons – work-life balance, a lot is pushed down to junior staff
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – promote work-life balance

review.title: “Good opportunities and great experience”
review.pros: Pros – Opportunity, people, independence (not public)
review.cons: Cons – Same as any other agency -- fast-pace, high pressure
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep pushing the work life balance, with the focus on the life part.

review.title: “Keep on like this pelase”
review.pros: Pros – Work environment and its people
review.cons: Cons – Compensation, compensation, compensation, compensation, compensation,
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Keep on like this please

review.title: “Hard work, but worth it”
review.pros: Pros – Great clients tackling major issues; a culture of innovation; focus on personal professional development; collaborative approach; friendly environment. And the new London offices are fantastic.
review.cons: Cons – Work life balance is poor, especially for the best people; slightly obsessed with all things digital, but the firm is a market leader in this space so they do have the right to feel proud about that
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Nothing specific; senior management is generally in touch with the business and manages the organisation well

review.title: “A great place to work and grow your experience in the PR field”
review.pros: Pros – People, PR experience, high calibre of clients
review.cons: Cons – Long hours, high expectations, lack of work/life balance
review.advice-to-management: Advice to Senior Management – Need to ensure work/life balance of team
